(1) Every owner shall, after registration of his hotel or restaurant under section 5, obtain a licence from the Controller on payment of such fee as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) No owner shall carry on his business and in the case of a hotel, use the classification star sign, without first getting the hotel or restaurant registered and obtaining a licence under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Licence granted under this section shall, unless sooner suspended or cancelled, remain in force for a period of one year from the date of issue and may be renewed for a period of one year at a time on payment of such fee as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that if an application for renewal of a licence is made before the expiry of the period of its validity, the licence shall continue in force until orders are passed on such application.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Refusal and cancellation of registration or licence</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) The Controller may refuse to register a hotel or restaurant if it does not conform to the minimum prescribed criteria.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The registration and licence of a hotel or restaurant may be cancelled or suspended, or the star classification of a hotel may be lowered, if-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) its business is wholly or partly discontinued or suspended without the approval of the Controller, except where such suspension or discontinuance is for the purposes of making repairs, improvements, renovations or expansion or, in the case of seasonal business, for the period of the slack season and the fact of such suspension or discontinuance in each case has been duly reported to the Controller in advance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) its owner or any person acting on his behalf contravenes any of the provisions of this Ordinance or the rules or orders made thereunder;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) its owner fails to ensure proper arrangement for the security of person and property of customers or guests;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) it ceases to conform to the requirements of registration under section 5 and, in the case of a hotel, to the prescribed minimum criteria for the class assigned to it; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) In the case of hotel, its owner fails to enter the names and other particulars of guests in the register in such form and manner as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Obligation of the transferee, etc, of a hotel and restaurant</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. Where a hotel or restaurant registered and licensed under this Ordinance is transferred or assigned to any person, it shall be incumbent upon that person to report, within one month of its taking effect, to the Controller the fact of such transfer or assignment and obtain a fresh licence under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Fixation of fair rates</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) Every owner shall fix fair rates to be charged for board, lodging and other services provided in the hotel or restaurant.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every owner may either fix a consolidated rate of lodging, board and service, or for lodging and service only or fair rates separately for-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) lodging with reference to the nature of the accommodation and the number of guests to be accommodated;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)board, partial or full; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) other service.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Fair rates may be fixed separately for daily and monthly guests.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Explanation</strong>.- A guest who agrees to reserve accommodation, or for whom accommodation is reserved, for a period of one month or more, shall be deemed to be a monthly guest provided he actually stays for one month or more or has actually paid in advance for one month, and where the reservation is not for any specified period, or is for a period less than a month, the guest shall be deemed to be a daily guest.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Controller to fix limit of persons to be accommodated in any room</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) The Controller may fix the maximum number of guests to be accommodated in each room or other unit of accommodation in a hotel.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) No room for which an order has been made under sub-section (1) shall be used to accommodate any number of guests in excess of the number specified in the order except with the previous permission in writing of the Controller.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Controller may, from time to time, revise any order made by him under sub-section (1) so as to increase or reduce the number of guests specified in such order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Regulations of hotel and restaurant</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. Every owner shall prepare the regulations in respect of his hotel or restaurant conforming with the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules made thereunder and get them approved by the Controller.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Fair rates, etc, to be displayed</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. (1) The fair rates, the maximum number of guests that may be accommodated in a room or unit of accommodation in a hotel and the regulations of the hotel shall be displayed in a conspicuous manner in the office and in the public rooms, if any, of every hotel.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The fair rates and the regulations of the restaurant shall be displayed in a conspicuous manner in the office and the hall and rooms of every restaurant.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Reservation of accommodation at the instance of the Controller</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) Subject to such directions as may be given in this behalf by the Government, the Controller may by order direct the owner or the manager of a hotel to reserve in the hotel such accommodation as may be specified in the order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Subject to any direction by the Government in this behalf, the Controller may allot the accommodation reserved under sub section (1) to any person and such person shall thereupon be deemed to be a guest at the hotel in relation to the accommodation allotted to him.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Where any accommodation is reserved under sub section (1), the owner or the manager of the hotel shall make the accommodation so reserved, or such portion of it as the Controller may direct, available to the Controller for occupation by the person to whom it has been allotted at the expiry of forty-eight hours from the service upon him of a notice in writing in this behalf by the Controller.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Nothing in this section shall prevent the owner or the manager of the hotel from letting any accommodation reserved under sub section (1) to a guest, other than the person to whom such accommodation is allotted by the Controller, upon the condition that if and when a notice is received from the Controller under sub section (3), such guest will vacate the accommodation within forty-eight hours of the receipt of such notice.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Controller’s power to prohibit certain trades and occupations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. The Controller may, by order in writing prohibit, within one hundred yards of a three star or above hotel, the carrying on of any trade, profession, occupation or industry which in his opinion is likely to be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) injurious to the health and well being of guests or customers or a hazard to their safety;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) a nuisance as defined in the Penal Code (Act XLV of 1860); or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) offensive to good taste.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Eviction of guests</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) Except as hereinafter provided, no guest at a hotel shall be evicted or refused board or other service so long as he pays, or is ready and willing to pay, the fair rates and observes the displayed regulations of the hotel and conforms with the provisions of this Ordinance and the conditions prescribed thereunder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A guest or a customer who has been guilty of conduct which amounts to nuisance, or is a source of annoyance to other guests or customers, or threatens or intimidates any other guest or customers, or is likely to endanger the person or life of any individual in the hotel or restaurant, may be evicted by the owner or manager¬:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that, if the owner or manager has good reason to apprehend an immediate breach of peace or commission of an offence by the guest or customer, he may use such force as may be necessary to restrain the guest or customer from so doing and shall immediately intimate the fact to the local police.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Any guest or customer aggrieved by eviction or refusal of board or other services under sub-section (1) or sub-section (2) may lodge a complain with the Controller who shall, after holding summary enquiry in the prescribed manner, pass such order as he deems fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Procedure and powers of Controller</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. (1) The Controller shall not refuse registration, or cancel or suspend the licence, of a hotel or restaurant, except after holding summary enquiry in the prescribed manner.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) For the purpose of holding an enquiry under sub section (1) or any other enquiry which he may deem necessary for the purposes of this Ordinance, the Controller shall have the same powers as are vested in a civil Court in respect of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)  proof of facts by affidavit;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) summoning and enforcing the attendance of any person and examining him on oath;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) compelling the production of documents and other material evidence; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) issuing commissions for the examination of witnesses</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Additional power of Controller</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. <strong>For the purposes of this Ordinance, the Controller may</strong>-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) call for such information or returns from an owner or manager as may be necessary for satisfying himself that the provision of this Ordinance, the rules and orders made thereunder are being duly complied with;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) require an owner or manager to produce before himself or an officer designated by him for the purpose of any book of account, document or other papers in his possession or power which contain or are believed to contain information relating to the hotel or restaurant of which he is the owner or manager;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) require an owner or manager to undertake, through an agency qualified to do so, scientific tests of water, food and other articles of human consumption at the cost of the owner to determine their quality and conformity with the requirements of health and hygiene;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) issue directive to the owner or manager of a restaurant to improve, within a period of six months from the date of such directive, the conditions, services and facilities at the restaurant to conform to the prescribed minimum criteria;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) call for any other information relating to the development of hotel industry.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Apprenticeship scheme and training policy of employees</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. The Controller shall, in consultation with the Hotel Owners' Association,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) ensure that the number of apprentices in a hotel or restaurant does not exceed ten per cent of the employees in any specified trade;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) Fix, with due regard to the salaries paid to the regularly employed staff of the specified trade, the stipend to be paid to an apprentice over and above the cost of his training and determine the duration of his apprenticeship;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) lay down the age limit, educational qualifications, standards of physical fitness and psychological and mental health of apprentices;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) Direct the programming for training of various categories of employees of hotels and restaurants at a vocational institution recognised by the Government at the various specialised courses run thereat, so that the percentage of qualified trained staff in a hotel or restaurant attains, within a reasonable time, the minimum standard as may be determined by the Controller; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) lay down the maximum percentage of untrained staff that may be employed at a hotel or restaurant at any time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Provision of medical facilities</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. (1) The owner of every hotel registered and licensed under this Ordinance and classified according to the star classification system shall provide the following minimum medical facilities for guests, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         one and two star hotels-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        a doctor on call available in close proximity of the hotel premises;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        first aid equipment and a reasonable stock of life saving drugs;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        two employees trained and qualified in first aid;  (d)        ensure availability of an ambulance, van or car to rush patients to a hospital in emergencies;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        three star hotels:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        as in sub clauses (a) to (c) in clause (i);</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        a drug store or chemist's shop with twenty four hours' service, if not existing in close proximity;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        an ambulance or van;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       four and five star hotels:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        as in sub clause (a) of clause (i);</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        a separate consulting room with reasonable stock of life saving drugs and first aid equipments;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        four employees trained and qualified in first aid;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        an ambulance or a van convertible into an ambulance in emergency;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        a drug or chemist's shop with twenty four hours' service, if not existing in close proximity.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The manager of a hotel shall take all possible care and provide all necessary medical aid without any loss of time to a guest or customer suffering from any serious attack, including heart attack and haemorrhage, or an accident.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Offences and penalties</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. (1) Any owner who fails to apply for registration within the time specified in section 5 shall be liable to pay to the Government a penalty of such sum not exceeding five thousand Taka as the Controller may impose and, in the case of a continuing failure, an additional penalty which may extend to one thousand Taka for every day after the first during which he has persisted in the failure.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any owner or manager who serves any food or beverage which is injurious to health, or who does not take sufficient care to ensure protection of food and beverage against contamination through flies or in any other way, or serves any food or beverage in unclean or contaminated utensils, shall be liable to pay to the Government a penalty of such sum not exceeding one thousand Taka as the Controller may impose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Any owner or manager who fails to comply with any order made or direction given under the provisions of this Ordinance by the Controller or any other authority authorised by him in that behalf shall be liable to pay to the Government a penalty of such sum not exceeding one thousand Taka as the Controller may impose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4)        If a restaurant fails to carry out the directive issued under clause (d) of section 18 within the period specified therein, the Controller may suspend the operation of such restaurant and may also impose on the owner of such restaurant a penalty of such sum not exceeding five thousand Taka as he deems fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5)        If the owner or manager of a hotel or restaurant not licensed under this Ordinance advertises it as a hotel or restaurant, or in any manner whatsoever uses the star sign, he shall be liable to pay to the Government a penalty of such sum not exceeding one thousand Taka as the Controller may impose and, in the case of his continuing to so advertise or use the star sign, an additional penalty which may extend to two hundred Taka for every day after the first during which he so continues or uses the star sign.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6)        Any owner who fails to comply with the provisions of section 20 shall be liable to one or more of the following penalties, namely:-¬</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        penalty of such sum not exceeding two thousand Taka as the Controller may impose;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        suspension of the licence for a period not exceeding six months;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        cancellation of registration.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Contravention by companies, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. If the person contravening, or failing to comply with, any provision of this Ordinance or any rules, order or direction made or issued thereunder is a company or other body corporate, every director, secretary or other officer or agent thereof, unless he proves that the contravention or failure took place without his knowledge or that he exercised due diligence to prevent its taking place, shall be liable to the penalty provided for such contravention or failure.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Mode of recovery</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. Any sum imposed as penalty under this Ordinance shall be recoverable as an arrear of land revenue.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appeal and revision</p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. (1) Any person aggrieved by an order under this Ordinance may, within thirty days of the date of the order, prefer an appeal to-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Deputy Controller, where such order has been passed by an Assistant Controller;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the Controller, where such order, not being an order passed in appeal under clause (a), has been passed by a Deputy Controller;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the prescribed appellate authority, where such order, not being an order passed in appeal under clause (b), has been passed by the Controller.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may, of its own motion, or on the application of any owner or manager aggrieved by an order passed under sub section (i), within the prescribed time and in the prescribed manner, pass such order in relation thereto as it thinks fit:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no order against an owner or a manager shall be made unless he has been given an opportunity of showing cause against it and of being heard.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Indemnity</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against the Government, the Controller, any officer or authority subordinate to the Government or a member of the Committee in respect of anything which is in good faith done or intended to be done under this Ordinance or the rules made thereunder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Exemption</p><p style="text-align: justify;">26. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, exempt any hotel or restaurant from the operation of all or any of the provisions of this Ordinance or the rules made thereunder, for such period, and on such conditions, if any, as may be specified in the notification.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">27. (1) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, such rules may provide for-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        fixation and revision of criteria for the registration and classification of hotels and restaurants;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the grounds on which the classification of a hotel can be altered or lowered;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the manner of issuance of “Sign Shields” including star classification of hotels for display in hotels and restaurants at conspicuous places;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        matters in relation to which the Committee may render aid and advice;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        meetings of the Committee and the procedure to be followed at such meetings;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         fixation of fees for registration and licences;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        form of a certificate of medical fitness referred to in section 5 and the time at which it shall be submitted to the Controller;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        manner of holding summary enquiry; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         any other matter which is to be or may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
616	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH INSTITUTE OF INTERNATIONAL AND STRATEGIC STUDIES ORDINANCE 1984</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE BANGLADESH INSTITUTE OF INTERNATIONAL AND STRATEGIC STUDIES ORDINANCE 1984</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XXVII OF 1984).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[17th April, 1984]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the incorporation of the Bangladesh Institute of International and Strategic Studies. WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the incorporation of the Bangladesh Institute of International and Strategic Studies and matters connected thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 24th march, 1982, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Bangladesh Institute of International and Strategic Studies Ordinance 1984.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Board” means the Board of Governors of the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “Director-General” means the Director-General of the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “Institute” means the Bangladesh Institute of International and Strategic Studies incorporated under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        “member” means a member of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         “Prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Ordinance; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        “Vice-Chairman” means the Vice-Chairman of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Incorporation of the Institute</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. The Bangladesh Institute of International and Strategic Studies, established by the Government is hereby constituted a body corporate by the said name and as such body corporate it shall have perpetual succession and a common seal with power, subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Headquarters of the Institute</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The headquarters of the Institute shall be at Dhaka.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Institute may establish its branches at such places as the Board may decide.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Aims and objects of the Institute</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) The aims and objects of the Institute shall be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)to undertake and promote studies, research and dissemination of knowledge in respect of international relations, national issues and policies relating to security, defence and external relations, and international peace and security including its strategic aspects;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)to assist the Government, when required by it, in the planning, formulation and implementation of policies in the fields mentioned in clause (a);</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to provide a forum for exchange of knowledge and views among persons in the service of the Republic and scholars in such fields with a view of fostering better understanding of relevant national and international issues and policies;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)to exchange information, views and materials with the agencies and scholars engaged in similar studies and research within and outside the country; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)to act as a documentation centre for international affairs and strategic studies.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular and without prejudice to the generality of the above aims and objects, the Institute shall have power-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)to hold meetings and arrange lectures, seminars and conferences for better understanding of relevant national and international issues in the fields mentioned in sub-section (1)(a);</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to publish books, periodicals and reports on studies in the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to institute Research Scholarships and Fellowships for encouraging studies in various fields relevant to the aims and objects of the Institute; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)to take such other actions as may further the aims and objects of the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Management</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The general direction and superintendence of the affairs of the Institute shall vest in a Board of Governors which may exercise all powers and do all acts and things which may be exercised or done by the Institute in accordance with the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Board of Governors</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) The Board of Governors shall consist of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) a Chairman to be appointed by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) a Vice-Chairman to be appointed by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) the Secretary, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) the Secretary, Defence Division, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) the Secretary, Finance Division, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) an Additional Secretary, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, to be nominated by that Ministry;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) the Chief of General Staff, Bangladesh Army, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) the Director-General (Research), Ministry of Foreign Affairs, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) the Assistant Chief of Naval Staff, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) the Assistant Chief of Air Staff, ex-officio; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) the Director-General, ex-officio.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board may co-opt as its members three specialists or scholars in the fields of studies with which the Institute is concerned.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Chairman and Vice-Chairman</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) The Chairman and the Vice-Chairman shall hold office on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chairman and the Vice-Chairman shall perform such functions as the Government may direct or as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Director-General</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) There shall be a Director-General of the Institute who shall be appointed by the Government on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Director-General shall be the Chief Executive of the Institute and shall, on behalf of the Board, direct and control the affairs of the Institute in accordance with the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Director-General shall act as the Secretary to the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Director-General shall be responsible for the implementation of the decision of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Meetings of the Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) The meetings of the Board shall be held at such times and places as may be decided by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Five members including the Chairman shall form the quorum at a meeting of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) At a meeting of the Board each member shall have one vote and in the event of equality of votes, the person presiding shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The meeting of the Board shall be presided over by the Chairman, and in his absence, by the Vice-Chairman, and in the absence of both, by a member elected for the purpose by the members present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) No act or proceeding of the Board shall be invalid merely on the ground of the existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Senior Fellows</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) There shall be not more than ten Senior Fellows of the Institute who shall be appointed by the Board from persons who have attained eminence in the fields of diplomacy, international relations, international economics, political science, defense, international security, international law and strategic study.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A Senior Fellow shall hold office for a term of three years on such conditions as the Board may determine and shall be eligible for reappointment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A Senior Fellow shall advise and assist the Institute in the formulation and conduct of plans and projects for research, training and other activities.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) A Senior Fellow who, except for unavoidable reasons to be intimated in writing to the Director-General, fails to attend three consecutive meetings of the Senior Fellows convened by the Director-General shall cease to be such Fellow, if the Board so decides.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Officers and employees</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. The Institute may appoint such officers and employees as it considers necessary for the efficient performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as it may deem fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Fund</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. (1) The Institute shall have its own fund which shall consist of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        grants made by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        gifts and endowments;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        income from research undertakings and consultancy services;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        sale proceeds, and royalties of publications; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        moneys received from any other source.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All moneys credited to the Fund of the Institute shall be deposited in such bank or invested in such manner as the Board may decide.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Budget</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. The Institute shall, by such date in each year as may be prescribed, submit to the Government for approval, a budget in the prescribed form for each financial year showing the estimated receipts and expenditure and the sums which are likely to be required from the Government during that financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Accounts and audit</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) The Institute shall maintain in the prescribed manner its accounts which shall be audited annually by such auditors as may be appointed by the Board in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The accounts of the Institute, together with the audit report thereon, shall be forwarded annually to the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Annual report</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. The Institute shall prepare for every year a report of its activities during that year and submit it to the Government within sixty days after the expiry of that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Indemnity</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. The members and the officers and employees of the Institute shall be indemnified by the Institute against all losses and expenses incurred by them in the discharge of their duties except such as are caused by their wilful act or default.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to make rules</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. The Board may make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Source</strong> : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
617	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH INSTITUTE OF NUCLEAR AGRICULTURE ORDINANCE 1984</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE BANGLADESH INSTITUTE OF NUCLEAR AGRICULTURE ORDINANCE 1984</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO II OF 1984).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[5th January, 1984]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the establishment of the Bangladesh Institute of Nuclear Agriculture.WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of the Bangladesh Institute of Nuclear Agriculture and for matters connected therewith and incidental thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 24th March, 1982, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Bangladesh Institute of Nuclear Agriculture Ordinance 1984.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Board” means the Board of the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ (c)    “Council” means ???????? ???? ?????? ???????? established by ???????? ???? ?????? ???????? ???, ???? (???? ???? ? ?? ???);</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(cc)      “Director-General” means the Director-General of the Institute;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “Institute” means the Bangladesh Institute of Nuclear Agriculture established under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        “member” means a member of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         “prescribed” means prescribed by rules or regulations made under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        “regulations” means regulations made under this Ordinance; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        “rules” means rules made under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Establishment of the Institute</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) As soon as may be after the commencement of this Ordinance, the Government shall, by notification in the official Gazette, establish an Institute to be called the Bangladesh Institute of Nuclear Agriculture for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2)   The Institute shall be a body corporate, having perpetual succession and a common seal, with power, subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Head office, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The Head office of the Institute shall be located at Mymensingh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Institute may establish offices at such other places as it may think fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Management</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) Subject to the rules and regulations made under this Ordinance, the general direction, administration and supervision of the affairs of the Institute shall vest in a Board which may exercise all powers and do all acts and things that may be exercised or done by the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board in discharging its functions shall be guided on questions of policy by such instructions as may be given to it by the Government from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Certain directions etc, of Council to be given effect to</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"> 6. Notwithstanding anything contained in this Act, the Institute, or any of its functionaries shall, in relation to the affairs of the Institute, ensure that-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) any direction issued by the Council under or in pursuance of the provisions of section 8 or 14 of ???????? ???? ?????? ???????? ???, ???? (???? ???? ? ?? ???) is complied with;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) any recommendation or determination made or advice given by the Council under or in pursuance of the provisions referred to in clause (a), as far as practicable, is given effect to:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that where, in the opinion of the Institute, it is not possible to give effect to such recommendation or advice or any part thereof,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) the Institute shall, without delay, communicate its opinion with reasons therefore to the Council; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)the Council may, after consideration of such opinion, modify or revoke its earlier recommendation or advice, or may issue fresh recommendation or advice on the same subject:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that the recommendation or advice so modified or issued afresh, as the case may be, shall be deemed to be a direction under clause (a) and shall be complied with accordingly.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Constitution of the Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6A. (1) The Board shall consist of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the Director-General, ex-officio, who shall also be the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)  a representative of the Bangladesh Atomic Energy Commission, not below the rank of Director, to be nominated by that Commission;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) the Dean of the Faculty of Agriculture, Bangladesh Agricultural University, Mymensingh, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) a representative of the Council, to be nominated by it;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) a representative of the Department of Agricultural Extension, not below the rank of Director, to be nominated by the Ministry or Division dealing with agriculture;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) the Directors of the Institute, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) two senior scientists of the Institute, to be nominated by the Ministry or Division dealing with agriculture;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) two representatives, one from among the progressive farmers, and the other from amongst the Non-Government Organisations (NGO's) performing functions similar to those of the Institute, to be nominated by the Ministry or Division dealing with agriculture;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) two representatives, one from the Ministry or Division dealing with agriculture and the other from the Finance Division of the Ministry dealing with finance, not below the rank of Deputy Secretary, to be nominated by that Ministry or Division.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Director-in-charge of Administration of the Institute shall act as the Secretary of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Tenure of membership, resignation, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6B. (1) The members specified in clause (h) of section 6A(1) shall hold office for a period of three years from the date of their nomination:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that such members may resign their membership in writing addressed to the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A person shall cease to be a member, if he-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        dies; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        being a member specified in clause (h) of section 6A(1)-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         resigns his membership under the provision to sub-section (1) of this section; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        his tenure expires under sub-section (1) of this section; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       remains absent, without permission of the Chairman, from three consecutive meetings of the Board; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        is declared by a competent Court to be of unsound mind; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        is an undischarged insolvent; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        has been, on conviction for a criminal offence involving moral turpitude, sentenced to imprisonment for a term of not less than three months or to a fine not less than five thousand Taka and unless a period of two years has elapsed since his release or realisation of the fine, as the case may be, a person so sentenced shall not be eligible to be a member.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Functions of the Institute</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7.         The functions of the Institute shall be to-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) undertake research adopting nuclear techniques for the purpose of ensuring a stable and productive agriculture through evolution of new varieties of crops, scientific management of land and water, development of appropriate technology to improve quality and quantity of crops, and development of methods for control of disease and insect and management of pest;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) undertake agronomic and soil-plant studies;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        carry out demonstration tests or trial-runs of new varieties of crops and their management practices;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        publish annual reports relating to the activities of the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        publish agricultural manuals, monograms, bulletins and other literature relating to crop research;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         train research and extension officers in the improved technology of crop production;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        provide post-graduate research facilities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)      organise seminars, symposia and workshops on selected problems relating to agriculture and agricultural research and technology;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         undertake research programmes in collaboration with other national and international agencies and organisations;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         enter into bilateral agreements with foreign institutions for academic degrees, specialised training, scientific visits and exchange programmes; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        perform such other functions as may be necessary for the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Meetings of the Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) The meetings of the Board shall be convened by the Secretary of the Board, in consultation with the Chairman, at least once every quarter of a year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All meetings of the Board shall be presided over by 3[ a member elected for the purpose by the members present] and, in his absence, by the Vice-Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Board not less than six members shall be present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) All matters at a meeting shall be decided by the votes of the majority of the members present and voting.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) At a meeting of the Board, each member shall have one vote, and in the event of equality of votes, the Chairman 4[ or the member presiding over the meeting] shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) No act or proceeding of the Board shall be invalid merely on the ground of existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Director-General</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) There shall be a 6 Director-General of the Institute who shall be appointed by the Government for such period and on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The 7[ Director-General] shall be a full-time officer and the chief executive of the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The 8[ Director-General] shall exercise such powers, and perform such functions, as may be prescribed or assigned to him by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Appointment of Directors, officers etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9[ 10. For the efficient performance of the functions of the Institute-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the Government may appoint such number of Directors and on such terms and conditions as it may determine from time to time;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the Board may appoint such officers and other employees and on such terms and conditions as it may determine from time to time.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to borrow, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. The Institute may, for carrying out its functions, borrow money, if necessary, with the approval of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Budget</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. The Board shall, by such date before the commencement of every financial year as the Government may direct, submit to the Government for approval a budget, in such form as the Government may specify, for each financial year showing the estimated receipts and expenditure and the sums which are likely to be required from the Government during that financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Fund of the Institute</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. (1) The Institute shall have its own Fund which shall consist of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        grants made by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        loans obtained from the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        grants made by the local authorities; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        grants and aid received, with the approval of the Government, from any aid giving agency.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All moneys of the Institute shall be kept in a scheduled bank.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Audit and accounts</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) The Board shall maintain its accounts in such manner as the Government may specify.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The accounts of the Board shall be audited by the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh (hereinafter in this section referred to as the Auditor-General), in such manner as he deems fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) For the purpose of an audit under sub-section (2), the Auditor-General or any person authorised by him in this behalf shall have access to all records, books, documents, cash, securities, stores and other property of the Institute and may examine the Chairman or any member, Director, officer or employee of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Auditor-General shall, as soon as possible after completion of the audit, send to the Board his audit report and the Board shall forward it, with its comments thereon, to the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Board shall take steps forthwith to remedy any defects or irregularities pointed out in the audit report.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Submission of reports, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) The Board shall submit to the Government, as 10[ soon] as possible after the end of every financial year, a report on the conduct of its affairs for that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board shall submit to the Government at such time and at such interval as the Government may specify-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) such returns, accounts, statements, estimates and statistics as may be required by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) information and comments asked for by the Government on any specific subject;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) copies of documents required by the Government for examination or any other purpose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Committees of the Institute</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. The Board may, from time to time, appoint such committees as may be necessary to discharge such functions as may be assigned to them by the Board or to assist the 11[ Director-General] in the performance of his functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purpose of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to make regulations</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. (1) The Board may, with the prior approval of the Government, make regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules, to provide for all matters for which provision is necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All regulations made under this section shall be published in the official Gazette and shall come into force on such publication.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Savings</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any contract or instrument, on the establishment of the Institute,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the Institute of Nuclear Agriculture, hereinafter referred to as the dissolved Institute, shall stand dissolved;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) all assets, rights, powers, authorities and privileges, all property, movable and immovable, cash and bank balances, funds, investments and all other rights and interests in, or arising out of, such property of the dissolved Institute shall stand transferred to and vest in the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) all debts, liabilities and obligations of the dissolved Institute shall be the debts, liabilities and obligations of the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) all officers, consultants, advisers and other employees of the dissolved Institute shall become officers, consultants, advisers and employees of the Institute and shall hold office or service in the Institute on the same terms and conditions as were enjoyed by them immediately before such establishment and shall continue to do so until their remuneration or terms and conditions are duly altered by the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) all suits and other legal proceedings instituted by or against the dissolved Institute before such establishment shall be deemed to be suits and proceedings by or against the Institute and shall be proceeded or otherwise dealt with accordingly.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Clauses (c) and (cc) were substituted for former clause (c) by section 2 of the Bangladesh Institute of Nuclear Agriculture (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. IV of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Sections 6, 6A, and 6B were substituted for previous section 6 by section 3 of the Bangladesh Institute of Nuclear Agriculture (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. IV of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The words “a member elected for the purpose by the members present” were substituted for the words “the Chairman” by section 4 of the Bangladesh Institute of Nuclear Agriculture (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. IV of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The words “or the member presiding over the meeting” were inserted by section 4 of the Bangladesh Institute of Nuclear Agriculture (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. IV of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 Clauses (c) and (cc) were substituted for former clause (c) by section 2 of the Bangladesh Institute of Nuclear Agriculture (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. IV of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 The word “Director-General” was substituted for the word “Director” by section 5 of the Bangladesh Institute of Nuclear Agriculture (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. IV of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 The word “Director-General” was substituted for the word 618	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH IRRIGATION WATER RATE ORDINANCE 1983</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE BANGLADESH IRRIGATION WATER RATE ORDINANCE  1983</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XXXI OF 1983).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[10th July, 1983]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to consolidate and amend the law relating to the imposition of water rate for supply, regulation or storage of water for irrigation or drainage.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to consolidate and amend the law relating to the imposition of water rate for supply, regulation or storage of water for irrigation or drainage and to provide for certain matters connected therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 24th March, 1982, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the Chief Martial Law Administrator is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"> <strong>commencement</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Bangladesh Irrigation Water Rate Ordinance 1983.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force on such date as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Board” means the Bangladesh Water Development Board constituted by the Bangladesh Water and Power Development Boards Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 59 of 1972); (c)  “canal” means any canal, channel, including field channel, plot channel and intake channel, river, stream, water course, reservoir, pump or tube well constructed, installed, maintained or controlled by the Government or by the Board or by the Corporation for supply, regulation or storage of water for the purpose of irrigation or drainage and includes any work, embankment, structure, supply or escape channel connected with any such canal, channel or reservoir, and any land on the bank of any canal as defined in this clause;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “Corporation” means the Bangladesh Agricultural Development Corporation established under the Bangladesh Agricultural Development Corporation Ordinance, 1961 (E.P. Ord. XXXVII of 1961);</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         “Deputy Commissioner” means the Deputy Commissioner of a district and includes such other officer of the Government or such officer of the Board or of the Corporation as may be empowered by the Government to perform all or any of the functions of a Deputy Commissioner under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Ordinance; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        “Water rate” means the water rate payable under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Ordinance to override other laws</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. The provisions of this Ordinance shall have effect notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in any other law or in any contract for the time being in force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Imposition of water rate</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. 3 (1) Whenever the Government is of opinion that lands within any area are benefited or are likely to be benefited by water supplied or regulated by the Government or by the Board or by the Corporation through any canal during any financial year, the Government may, by notification, declare its intention to impose in such area, hereinafter referred to as the notified area, a water rate for such financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) On the publication of a notification under sub-section (1), any person interested in any land likely to be affected by the imposition of the water rate referred to in the notification may, within a period of one month from the date of publication of the notification, prefer objections to the Government to the inclusion of such land in the area in respect of which the declaration has been made under sub-section (1).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) On the expiry of the period referred to in sub-section (2) for preferring objections, the Government may, after considering the objections, if any, received within such period, by notification,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        withdraw the declaration intending to impose a water rate, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 (b) declare that a water rate in the area in respect of which the declaration under sub-section (1) was made or any part thereof shall be imposed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Determination of water rate etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 )5. (1) The water rate to be imposed in a notified area shall be determined by such authority and in such manner as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the water rate so determined may vary from one notified area to another notified area and from one year to another year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in section 4, a water rate determined for a financial year shall remain in force and be payable for subsequent financial years unless the notification published under that section is rescinded or the rate is varied under sub-section (1).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any custom, usage or contract, a water rate determined under sub-section (1) shall be payable in respect of all agricultural lands in the notified area.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Remission</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6.(6) If, for any reason, there is, in any financial year, a total or partial failure of crops in any land in the notified area, the Government may grant total or partial remission of the water rate in respect of such lands.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Assessment and collection of water rate</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7.(7) The water rate payable under section 5 shall be assessed and collected in such manner as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Free Passage of water for irrigation or drainage</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) For the purpose of irrigation or drainage of lands in the notified area, the owners or occupiers of such lands shall be bound to afford free passage for water through or over all lands in their possession and for that purpose, to allow, when so required by the Deputy Commissioner, by an order in writing, construction and maintenance of such channels as may be necessary:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the capacity of such channels shall not exceed in any case two cusecs of flow.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If any person refuses to comply with an order under sub section (1), the Deputy Commissioner may cause the channel to be constructed or maintained and may impose a penalty which may extend to five times the water rate assessed on such land.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, no person shall be entitled to claim any compensation for any damage or loss which may be caused as a result of construction or maintenance of any channel under sub section (1) or sub section (2):</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that he shall be entitled to remission of water rate in respect of that portion of land which is affected by such construction or maintenance of channels.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Any person aggrieved by an order imposing a penalty on him under this section may within thirty days from the date of receipt of the order, appeal to such appellate authority as may be prescribed, and the decision of the appellate authority in such appeal shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Penalty for diversion of normal flow of water by obstruction, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) If, without any written permission of the Deputy Commissioner, any obstruction is put in any channel referred to in section 8 or other canal or any cut is made on the bank thereof as a result of which the normal flow of water through</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) take such measures as he may consider necessary to remove such obstruction or to close such cut;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) impose a penalty, which may extend to ten time the water rate assessed for the 8[ financial year] during which the obstruction is put or the cut is made, on the persons who are the owners or occupiers of lands irrigated by, or filled up with, water so diverted, after giving them an opportunity of showing cause against the imposition of such penalty:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no such penalty shall be imposed on any person who proves to the satisfaction of the Deputy Commissioner that such obstruction was put or such cut was made without his knowledge or consent.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any person aggrieved by an order imposing a penalty under this section may, within thirty days from the date of receipt of the order, appeal to such appellate authority as may be prescribed, and the decision of the appellate authority in such appeal shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Prevention of unauthorised use or waste of water</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) It shall be the duty of the owners or occupiers of lands in the notified area to take proper precautions for the prevention of waste of the water supplied through any canal in the area or use of such water in an unauthorised manner.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If water supplied through a canal be suffered to run to waste, the person by whose act or neglect such water is suffered to run to waste shall be liable to pay a penalty which may extend to ten times the water rate that could be charged if the water so wasted were supplied in bulk.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) If water supplied through a canal in the area be used in an unauthorised manner, the person by whose act or neglect such use has occurred shall be liable to pay a panalty which may extend to five times the water rate assessed on the land in which such water is used or on which such water has flowed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) A penalty under this section may be imposed by the Deputy Commissioner after causing such inquiry as he deems necessary and after giving the persons liable to pay the penalty an opportunity of showing cause against the imposition of such penalty.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) Any person aggrieved by an order imposing a penalty on him under this section may, within thirty days from the date of receipt of the order, appeal to such appellate authority as may be prescribed, and the decision of the appellate authority in such appeal shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Recovery of arrears of water rate and penalties</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. All arrears of water rate, together with interest and costs, if any, and all penalties under this Ordinance shall be recoverable as public demands.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Delegation of power</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. The Government may, by notification, direct that any power conferred or any duty imposed on it by this Ordinance may, in such circumstances and under such conditions, if any, as may be specified in the notification, also be exercised or performed by such officer or authority as may be mentioned in the notification.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Bar to Jurisdiction of Civil Courts</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, no Civil Court shall entertain any application or suit for any action taken or anything done under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Indemnity</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. No suit, prosecutions or other legal proceedings shall lie against any person for anything which is in good faith done or intended to be done under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to make rules</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, such rules may provide for-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the authority or person for assessment of water rate;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the manner of publication of notification or public notices issued under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        the form and manner of service of notices;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        the persons by whom water rate may be collected and the remuneration, if any, payable to them;            (h)        the manner of collection of water rate;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         the amount of rebate to which a person paying water rate in time is entitled and penalty to which he may be liable in case of default;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         the appellate authorities to whom appeals under sections 8, 9 and 10 shall lie;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        the fees, if any, payable on petitions of appeal;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l)         the procedure to be followed by the appellate authorities.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Repeal and savings</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) The Irrigation (Imposition of Water Rate) Ordinance, 1963 (E.P. Ord. VII of 1963), is hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding such repeal, anything done or any action taken, including any notification published, water rate imposed or assessed, notice issued, order made or appeal preferred under the said Ordinance shall be deemed to have been done, taken, published, imposed, assessed, issued, made or preferred under the corresponding provision of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Clause (a) was omitted by section 2 of the Bangladesh Irrigation Water Rate (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. XXXIV of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Clause (e) was omitted by section 2 of the Bangladesh Irrigation Water Rate (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. XXXIV of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 Sub-section (1) was substituted by section 3 of the Bangladesh Irrigation Water Rate (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. XXXIV of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 Clause (b) was substituted by section 3 of the Bangladesh Irrigation Water Rate (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. XXXIV of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 Section 5 was substituted by section 4 of the Bangladesh Irrigation Water Rate (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. XXXIV of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 Section 6 was substituted by section 5 of the Bangladesh Irrigation Water Rate (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. XXXIV of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 Section 7 was substituted by section 6 of the Bangladesh Irrigation Water Rate (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. XXXIV of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8 The words “financial year” was substituted for the words “crops season” by section 7 of the Bangladesh Irrigation Water Rate (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. XXXIV of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9 Clause (b) was omitted by section 8 of the Bangladesh Irrigation Water Rate (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. XXXIV of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10 Clause (d) was omitted by section 8 of the Bangladesh Irrigation Water Rate (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. XXXIV of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11 Clause (f) was omitted by section 8 of the Bangladesh Irrigation Water Rate (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. XXXIV of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
619	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH JATIYA JADUGHAR ORDINANCE 1983</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE BANGLADESH JATIYA JADUGHAR ORDINANCE 1983</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. LIII OF 1983).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[20th September, 1983]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the establishment of the Bangladesh Jatiya Jadughar.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS, it is expedient to provide for the establishment of the Bangladesh "Jatiya Jadughar" and for matters ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 24th March, 1982, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the Chief Martial Law Administrator is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Bangladesh "Jatiya Jadughar" Ordinance, 1983.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “antiquity” means-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) any ancient movable product of human activity illustrative of art, architecture, craft, custom, literature, morals, politics, religions, warfare, science or of any aspect of civilisation or of culture;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) any ancient movable object of historical, ethnological, anthropological, biological, geological, military or scientific interest;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii) any gate, door, window, panelling dados, ceiling, inscription, wall-painting, wood work, iron work, or sculpture or other thing which is attached or fastened to an immovable antiquity; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv) any other ancient object or class of such objects declared by the Government, by notification in the official Gazette, to be an antiquity for the purposes of this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Board” means the Board of Trustees of the Jadughar;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Jadughar” means the Bangladesh Jatiya Jadughar established under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “Mahaparichalak” means the Mahaparichalak appointed under section 11;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules or regulations made under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) “Sabhapati” means the Sabhapati of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) “Sachib” means the Sachib of the Jadughar appointed under section 12; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) “Trustee” means a Trustee of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Establishment of Jadughar</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) On the commencement of this Ordinance, there shall be established a National Museum to be called the Bangladesh Jatiya Jadughar.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Jadughar shall be a body corporate, having perpetual succession and a common seal, with power to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>General direction</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The General direction and administration of the affairs of the Jadughar shall vest in a Board of Trustees which may exercise all powers and do all acts or things which may be exercised or done by the Jadughar.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Patron-in-Chief</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The President shall be the Patron-in-Chief of the Jadughar.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The Board shall consist of the following Trustees, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        an eminent person from the field of education or culture to be appointed by the Government, who shall also be the Sabhapati of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (b) the Secretary of the Ministry or Division dealing with finance, ex-officio, or any officer thereof not below the rank of Deputy Secretary to be nominated by it;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(bb) the Secretary of the Ministry or Division dealing with cultural affairs, ex-officio, or any officer thereof not below the rank of Deputy Secretary to be nominated by it;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) two professors of Universities of Bangladesh, one from the subjects of humanities and the other from the subjects of science, to be appointed by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) the Mahaparichalak of the Jadughar, who shall also act, as Secretary of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. (e) the Director, Directorate of Archives and Libraries, ex-officio;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) the Director, Department of Archaeology, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) the Principal, Bangladesh College of Arts and Crafts, Dhaka, ex-officio; 3[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (gg) a representative of the Asiatic Society of Bangladesh, Dhaka, to be appointed by the Government;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) five persons to be appointed by the Government from amongst the donors of antiquities and works of arts, and from amongst persons interested in arts, antiquities and museum activities.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Terms of office of Trustees, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) A Trustee, other than an ex-officio Trustee, shall hold office for a period of three years from the date of his appointment and shall be eligible for reappointment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A Trustee, other than an ex-officio Trustee may, at any time, resign his office by a letter addressed to the Sabhapati.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) No act or proceedings of the Board shall be invalid merely on the ground of the existence of a vacancy in, or defect in the constitution of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Functions of the Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. <strong>The functions of the Board shall be</strong>-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) to administer and develop the Jadughar;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to collect, preserve and display the antiquities, works of art, ethnological specimens, relics connected with the liberation struggle of Bangladesh, specimens of flora and fauna, traditional crafts and artifacts, products of intellectual activities, audio-visual documentary evidence, and such other objects and items related to the cultural and natural heritage of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to collect, preserve and display material evidence of different aspects of various world civilisations;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to make arrangements for research on the collections of the Jadughar;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to publish and sell periodicals, books, anthologies and reproductions of objects;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) to organise exhibitions, conferences, lectures, seminars and assemblies on the cultural and natural heritage of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)to
