organise, with prior approval of the Government, exhibitions outside the country in order to project cultural and natural heritage of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) to assist, encourage and promote development of other museums in Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) to take over and administer a museum on such terms or conditions as may be agreed upon between the Board and the museum committee concerned;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) to take over and administer any museum established by the Government, or execute any scheme or project prepared by the Government, if so directed by the Government, on such terms and conditions as may be agreed upon between the Board and the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) to engage individuals or organisations of specific work for the Jadughar and to pay remuneration for the same;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) to register, organise, administer, regulate and supervise the movable antiquities in Bangladesh, other than those belonging to the Department of Archaeology, in such manner as may be determined by the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m) to assist individuals, institutions and authorities engaged in educational activities for the understanding of cultural and natural heritage of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n) to organise training courses and award certificates in art-history and museology independently or in collaboration with any other organisation; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(o) to do such other things ancillary or incidental to any of the aforesaid functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to dispose of object of the Jadughar</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. The Board may sell or otherwise dispose of any object of the Jadughar if the object is a duplicate of another such object, or if the object is, in the opinion of the Board, unfit to be retained in the Jadughar:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that if the object is a gift, bequest or donation of a foreign Government or a foreign national, prior approval of the Government shall be obtained for its sale or otherwise disposal.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Division, etc, of Jadughar</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. The Jadughar shall have such Division, Departments or Sections as may be prescribed for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Mahaparichalak</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) There shall be a Mahaparichalak of the Jadughar who shall be appointed by the Government and who shall hold office on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Mahaparichalak shall be the chief executive of the Jadughar and shall be responsible for carrying out the decisions of the Board and for the proper administration of the affairs of the Jadughar.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Mahaparichalak shall exercise such powers and perform such functions as may be prescribed or assigned to him by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) If a vacancy occurs in the office of the Mahaparichalak or if the Mahaparichalak is unable to discharge the functions of his office on account of absence, illness or any other cause, those functions shall be performed by such persons as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Sachib</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. There shall be a Sachib to the Jadughar who shall be appointed by the Government on such terms and conditions as may be determined by it.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Appointment of officers, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. The Board may appoint such officers and other employees as it considers necessary for the efficient administration of the Jadughar on such terms and conditions as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Meeting of the Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) The Board shall meet at least once in four months on a date to be fixed by the Mahaparichalak in consultation with the Sabhapati.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Sabhapati may, whenever he thinks fit, and shall, upon the written request of not less than six Trustees, call special meetings.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Five Trustees shall form a quorum.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) All meetings of the Board shall be presided over by the Sabhapati and, in his absence, by a Trustee elected for the purpose by the Trustees present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) Each Trustee shall have one vote and in the event of equality of votes, the Trustee presiding shall have a casting or second vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) Proceedings of the meeting of the Board shall be recorded and circulated to the Trustees and submitted for confirmation at the next meeting of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Funds of the Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) The funds of the Board shall comprise-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) funds of the Dhaka Museum Board of Trustees which stand transferred to the Board under section 18;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) grants from the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) grants from the local authorities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) sale-proceeds and royalties accruing from the publications and re-productions made by the Board; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) receipts from such other sources as may be approved by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The funds of the Board shall be kept in a scheduled bank approved by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Annual Budget Statement</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5[ 15A. The Board shall, by such date as may be prescribed, submit to the Government for approval a statement to be called the annual budget statement for each financial year showing the estimated receipts and expenditure and the sum which are likely to be required from the Government during that financial year.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Audit and accounts</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) The Board shall keep accounts of all moneys received and expended by it.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The accounts of the Board shall be audited by the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh in such manner as he deems fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The audit report, together with the statement of accounts audited, shall be furnished by the Board to the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Submission of annual reports, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. (1) The Board shall, as soon as possible after the end of every financial year, submit to the Government an annual report on the conduct of its affairs for that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may require the Board to furnish any report, return, statement, estimate, statistics or other information regarding any matter under the control of the Board, and the Board shall comply with every such requisition.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Repeal and savings, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. (1) On the commencement of this Ordinance, the Dacca Museum (Board of Trustees) Ordinance, 1970 (E.P. Ord. X of 1970), hereinafter referred to as the said Ordinance, shall stand repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Upon repeal of the said Ordinance,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Dhaka Museum Board of Trustees, hereinafter referred to as the said Board of Trustees, established under said Ordinance, shall stand dissolved;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        all assets, rights, powers, authorities and privileges and all properties, movable or immovable, including antiquities, works of art, ethnological specimens, relics and other objects, lands, buildings, cash and bank-balances, reserve funds, investments and all other rights and interests in, or arising out of, such properties and all</p><p style="text-align: justify;">books of accounts, registers, records and all other documents of whatever nature relating thereto, of the said Board of Trustees shall stand transferred to, and vest in, the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        all debts, liabilities and obligations incurred, all contracts entered into and all matters and things engaged to be done by, with or for, the said Board of Trustees before the commencement of this Ordinance shall be deemed to have been incurred, entered into or engaged to be done by, with or for, the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        all suits and other legal proceedings instituted by or against the said Board of Trustees shall be deemed to have been instituted by or against the Board and may be continued or proceeded with accordingly;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        all officers and other employees of the said Board of Trustees shall stand transferred to the Board and shall serve on the same terms and conditions as were applicable to them before their transfer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Notwithstanding the dissolution of the said Board of Trustees, all rules and regulations made under the said Ordinance, shall, mutatis mutandis, and so far as they are not inconsistent with any provision of this Ordinance, continue in force until altered, repealed or amended by rules or regulations made under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Government may, for the purpose of removing any difficulty in relation to the transfer and other matter specified in sub-section (1), make such orders as it may consider expedient and any such order shall be deemed to be, and given effect to as, part of the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Indemnity</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceedings shall lie against the Government or any person in respect of anything done or purporting to be done under this Ordinance or any order made thereunder for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to make rules</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to make regulations</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. The Board may 6[ , with the prior approval of the Government,] make regulations, not inconsistent with this Ordinance or rules made thereunder, to provide for all matters for which provision is necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of the Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Clauses (b) and (bb) were substituted for former clause (b) by section 2 of the Bangladesh Jatiya Jadughar (Amendment) Act, 1988 (Act No. XIII of 1988)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Clause (e) was substituted by section 2 of the Bangladesh Jatiya Jadughar (Amendment) Act, 1988 (Act No. XIII of 1988)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The word “and” was omitted by section 2 of the Bangladesh Jatiya Jadughar (Amendment) Act, 1988 (Act No. XIII of 1988)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 Clause (gg) was inserted by section 2 of the Bangladesh Jatiya Jadughar (Amendment) Act, 1988 (Act No. XIII of 1988)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 Section 15A was inserted by section 2 of the Bangladesh Jatiya Jadughar (Amendment) Ordinance, 1985 (Ordinance No. VII of 1985)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 The commas and the words “, with the prior approval of the Government,” were inserted by section 3 of the Bangladesh Jatiya Jadughar (Amendment) Ordinance, 1985 (Ordinance No. VII of 1985)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
620	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH KRIRA SHIKKHA PROTISHTAN ORDINANCE 1983</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE BANGLADESH KRIRA SHIKKHA PROTISHTAN ORDINANCE 1983</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. LVIII OF 1983).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[2nd October, 1983]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the establishment of a Krira Shikkha Protishtan.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of a Krira Shikkha Protishtan and to provide for matters connected therewith or incidental thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 24th March, 1982, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the Chief Martial Law Administrator is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>commencement</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Bangladesh Krira Shikkha Protishtan Ordinance 1983.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force on such date as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, specify.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Board” means the Board of Governors of the Bangladesh Krira Shikkha Protishtan;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Director General” means the Director General of the Bangladesh Krira Shikkha Protishtan appointed under section 8;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Protishtan” means the Bangladesh Krira Shikkha Protishtan established under section 3; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “prescribed” means prescribed by rules or regulations made under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Establishment of the Protishtan</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) There shall be a Krira Shikkha Protishtan to be called the Bangladesh Krira Shikkha Protishtan for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Protishtan shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal, with power to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>General direction</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) Subject to rules and regulations made under this Ordinance, the general direction and administration of the affairs of the Protishtan shall vest in a Board of Governors which may exercise all powers and do all things which may be exercised or done by the Protishtan.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board in discharging its functions shall be guided on questions of policy by such instructions as may be given to it by the Government from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The Board shall consist of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        Minister, Sports and Culture Division, who shall also be the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) Secretary, Finance Division, ex officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) Secretary, Education Division, ex officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) Secretary, Sports and Culture Division, ex officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) Chairman, Governing Bodies of Cadet Colleges, ex officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) Chairman, National Sports Control Board, ex officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) Chairman, Army Sports Control Board, ex officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        Director General, Secondary and Higher Education, ex officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         Secretary General, Bangladesh Olympic Association, ex officio; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         Director General of the Protishtan, who shall also be the Member- Secretary of the Board, ex-officio.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Functions of the Protishtan</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The functions of the Protishtan shall be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)    To find out promising sports talents from young boys and girls of the country and to provide adequate facilities and opportunities for their intensive training on scientific lines along with the scope of general education up to higher secondary level;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)    To provide training of prospective coaches, referees and umpires with a view to producing coaches,referees and umpires of higher calibre;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) To raise the technical competence of existing coaches, referees and umpires;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) To impart proper coaching to all national teams before their participation in international competitions;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)   To conduct certificate course for coaches, referees and umpires;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) To serve as an information centre for matters connected with sports and games;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) To publish books, periodicals, bulletins and up to date information on games and sports; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) To do such other acts and things as may be connected with or incidental to the carrying out of the functions of the Protishtan for the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Meetings of the Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) The meetings of the Board shall be held at such times and places and in such manner as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that until so prescribed, such meetings shall be held at such times and places as may be determined by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Board not less than four members shall be present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) All meetings of the Board shall be presided over by the Chairman and, in his absence, by a member chosen by the members present from amongst themselves.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) At a meeting of the Board, each member shall have one vote, and, in the event of an equality of votes, the Chairman shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) No act or proceedings of the Board shall be invalid or be called in question merely on the ground of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Director General</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) There shall be a Director General of the Protishtan who shall be appointed by the Government on such terms and conditions as may be determined by it.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Director General shall be a whole time officer and the chief executive of the Protishtan.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, the Director General shall administer and manage the affairs and fund of the Protishtan and shall be responsible for the General administration of the Protishtan and for the implementation of policies formulated by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Director General shall also perform such functions and discharge such duties as may be assigned to him by the Board or as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Appointment of officers, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. The Protishtan may, subject to such general or special order as the Government may give from time to time, appoint such officers and other employees as it considers necessary for the efficient performance of its affairs on such terms and conditions as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Committee</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. The Board may appoint such Committees as it may be considered necessary to assist it in the performance of its functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Delegation of powers</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. The Board may, by general or special order in writing, direct that such of its owners shall, in such circumstances and under such conditions, if any, as may be specified in the order, be exercisable also by the Chairman, or by such other member or officer of the Protishtan as may be so specified.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Fund of the Protishtan</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) The Protishtan shall have its own fund which shall be utilized by it to meet the charges in connection with its functions under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The fund shall consist of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) grants made by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) loans obtained from the Government and the local bodies;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) foreign loans obtained by the Protishtan with the prior approval of the Government; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) all other sums received by the Protishtan.     (3) All moneys of the Protishtan shall be kept in any scheduled bank.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Budget of the Protishtan</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. The Protishtan shall, before the commencement of every financial year, submit to the Government for approval a budget for each financial year showing the estimated receipts and expenditure and the sums which are likely to be required from the Government during the financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to make rules and regulation</strong>s</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) The Government may make rules for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Protishtan may, with the previous approval of the Government, make regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules made thereunder, to provide for all matters for which provision is necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) All rules and regulations made under this section shall be published in the official Gazette and shall come into force on such publication.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Transfer of assets, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any contract or agreement or in any order, instrument or notification, on the commencement of this Ordinance,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the Bangladesh Sports Institute, hereinafter referred to as the said Institute, shall cease to exist;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) all assets, rights, powers, authorities and privileges and all properties, movable and immovable of the said Institute, shall stand transferred to, and vest in, the Protishtan;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) all debts, liabilities and obligations of whatever kind of the said Institute shall, unless the Government otherwise directs, be the debts, liabilities and obligations of the Protishtan;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) every officer and other employee of the said Institute shall stand transferred to the Protishtan and shall serve the Protishtan on the same terms and conditions as were applicable to them immediately before their transfer and shall continue to do so unless and until the employment in the Protishtan is terminated or until his terms and conditions of service are altered by the Protishtan with the prior approval of the Government:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that an officer or other employee may, within such time as may be specified by the Protishtan, exercise his opinion not to continue in the service of the Protishtan.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Transfer of schemes under any sports organisation</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any contract or agreement or in any order, instrument or notification, the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, direct that any sports training scheme conducted by any sports organisation, by, whatever name called specified in the Notification shall be transferred to the Protishtan.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Upon the transfer of any scheme under sub section (1), the grants, if any, made by the Government for such scheme shall stand transferred to the Protishtan.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Source</strong> : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
621	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH NURSING COUNCIL ORDINANCE 1983</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE BANGLADESH NURSING COUNCIL ORDINANCE 1983</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. LXI OF 1983).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[5th October, 1983]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to constitute a Nursing Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to constitute a Nursing Council and to provide for matters connected therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 24th March, 1982, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the Chief Martial Law Administrator is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Bangladesh Nursing Council Ordinance 1983.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Council” means the Bangladesh Nursing Council constituted under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “member” means a member of the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “nursing and allied qualification” means any of the qualifications specified in the Schedules;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “prescribed” means prescribed by regulations made under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        “President” means the President of the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         “Schedule” means a Schedule annexed to this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Constitution of Bangladesh Nursing Council</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) There shall be constituted in accordance with the provisions of this Ordinance a Council to be known as the Bangladesh Nursing Council for the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Council shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal with power to acquire and hold property, both movable and immovable, and to contract, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Composition of the Council</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The Council shall consist of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        Secretary, Ministry of Health and Population Control, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        Director-General of Health Services, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        Director-General of Family Planning and Population Control, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        Director-General of Medical Services (Armed Forces) or a person nominated by him;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        Director, Medical Education and Hospital, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         Director of Nursing Services, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        Principal, College of Nursing, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        one member to be nominated by the Government from among the Principals of Medical Colleges;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         one member to be nominated by the Government from among the Superintendents of Medical College Hospitals;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         one member to be nominated by the Ministry of Social Welfare and Women Affairs from among its officers;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        one member to be nominated by the Ministry of Labour and Manpower from among its officers;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l)         one member to be nominated by the Health Division from among its officers not below the rank of Deputy Secretary;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m)       one member to be nominated by the Director of Nursing Services from among the Deputy Directors of Nursing Services;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n)        two members to be nominated by the Director of Nursing Services from among Matrons;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(o)        one member to be nominated by the Government from among the members of the teaching staff of the Medical Assistant Training Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(p)        one member to be nominated by the Bangladesh Medical and Dental Council from among its members;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(q)        one member to be nominated by the Bangladesh Nursing Association from among its members;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(r)        two members to be nominated by the Director of Nursing Services from among the members of teaching staff of Nursing Institutions;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(s)        three members to be nominated by the Government from among the members of Nursing Profession;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(t)         one member to be nominated by the Government from among the prominent lady educationists;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(u)        one member to be nominated by the Government from among the lady social workers.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Council shall elect from among its members a President, a Vice-President, a Treasurer and a Secretary:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Secretary, Ministry of Health and Population Control, shall be the first President of the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) No act or proceeding of the Council shall be invalid merely on the ground of the existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Terms of office</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) The President, the Vice-President, the Treasurer and the Secretary shall, subject to their continuing to be members of the Council, hold office for a term of three years from the date of their election.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A nominated member shall, unless removed earlier by his nominating authority, hold office for a term of three years from the date of his nomination.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Where a person is nominated to be a member by virtue of his holding an office or appointment or of his being a member of any organisation or profession, he shall cease to be such member when he ceases to hold that office or appointment or be such member.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) A nominated member may at any time resign his office by writing under his hand addressed to the President:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no such resignation shall take effect until it has been accepted by the President.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Meetings of the Council</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) Save as hereinafter provided, the Council shall follow such procedure as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The meetings of the Council shall be held on such date and at such time and place as may be determined by the President:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Provided that at least two meetings shall be held in each year.</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) One-third of the total number of members shall form a quorum.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) All questions at a meeting of the Council shall be decided by a majority of the members present and voting, and in the case of equality of votes, the person presiding shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Officers and employees</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. The Council shall appoint a Registrar and such other officers and employees, as it deems fit for the efficient performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Executive Committee</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) There shall be an Executive Committee of the Council consisting of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the President, who shall also be its Chairman;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the Vice-President, who shall also be its Vice-Chairman;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        five members to be elected by the Council from amongst its members.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Executive Committee shall perform such functions as may be assigned to it by the Council or as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A member of the Executive Committee shall, subject to his continuing to be a member, hold office for a term of three years.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Executive Committee shall follow such procedure as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Recognition of nursing and allied qualifications</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) The Nursing and allied qualifications specified in the Schedules granted by the Institutions mentioned therein shall be recognised nursing and allied qualifications for the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any Institution which grants any nursing or allied qualification not included in any of the Schedules may apply to the Council to have such qualification recognised, and the Council may, after due consideration of the application, either recognise such qualification or refuse recognition of such qualification, and if it recognises such qualification it shall, by notification in the official Gazette, amend the Schedule concerned so as to include such qualification therein.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Council may, if it deems fit, recognise any nursing or allied qualification granted by any institution outside Bangladesh, and on such recognition such qualification shall be deemed to be recognised nursing or allied qualification for the purpose of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power of the Council to certify certain persons to be possessed of sufficient nursing and allied qualification</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. If the Council is satisfied that a person is, by reason of qualifications granted by any institution outside Bangladesh and of experience gained in any part of Bangladesh, possessed of qualifications which entitle him to be recognised as possessed of sufficient nursing or allied qualifications for the purposes of this Ordinance, it may certify that the person is possessed of such qualifications and, on such certification by the Council, the person shall be deemed to be possessed of qualifications which are recognised nursing or allied qualifications for the purposes of this Ordinance for such period and upon such conditions as may be specified by the Council in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to require information as to courses of study and examinations</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. Every Institution in Bangladesh which trains for or grants any nursing or allied qualification specified in the Schedules shall furnish such information as the Council may, from time to time, require as to the courses of study and examinations to be undergone in order to obtain such qualification, as to the minimum age at which such courses of study can be undertaken on admission in the Institution concerned, examinations required to be undergone prior to such qualification being conferred, and generally as to the requisites for obtaining such qualification.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Inspection of examinations</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) The Executive Committee shall appoint such number of Inspectors as it may deem requisite to attend at any or all of the examinations held by any Institution in Bangladesh for the purpose of granting recognised nursing or allied qualifications or in respect of which recognition has been sought.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Inspectors appointed under this section shall not interfere with the conduct of any examination but they shall report to the Executive Committee on the sufficiency of every examination which they attend and on the courses of study and facilities for teaching provided by the Institution in question at different stages in respect of such examination, and on any other matter in regard to which the Executive Committee may require them to report.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Executive Committee shall forward a copy of any such report to the Institution concerned, and shall also forward a copy with the remarks of such Institution thereon to the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Withdrawal of recognition</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. (1) When, upon report by the Executive Committee, it appears to the Council that the courses of study and examinations to be gone through in any Institution in Bangladesh in order to obtain a recognised nursing or allied qualification or that the standards of proficiency required from candidates at any examination held for the purpose of granting such qualification are not such as to secure to persons holding such qualification the knowledge and skill requisite for the efficient practice of nursing or allied profession, the Council shall forward the report, along with such remarks as it may choose to make, to the Institution with an intimation of the period within which the Institution may submit its explanation to the Council.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) On the receipt of the explanation or, where no explanation is submitted within the period fixed, on the expiry of that period, the Council may, after making such further inquiry, if any, as it may think fit, by notification in the official Gazette, direct that an entry shall be made in the Schedule against the said nursing or allied qualification declaring that it shall not be a recognised nursing or allied qualification from a specified date.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Maintenance of nursing and allied register</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) The Council shall maintain in such manner as may be prescribed, separate registers for nurses, midwives, health visitors, family welfare visitors, junior nurses and others possessing recognised nursing or allied qualifications.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The registers maintained under this section shall be deemed to be public documents within the meaning of the Evidence Act, 1872 (I of 1872).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Removal of names from the register</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) The Council may refuse registration of any person or direct the removal altogether or for a specified period from the register of the name of any nurse or other person who has been convicted of any such offence as implies, in the opinion of the Council, a defect of character or who, after any inquiry at which opportunity has been given to such person to be heard in person, has been held by the Council guilty of infamous conduct in any professional respect or who has shown himself to be unfit to continue in profession on account of mental ill-health or other grounds.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Council may, if it so deems fit, restore in the register the name of any person removed therefrom under sub-section (1).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) For the purpose of an inquiry under sub-section (1), the Council shall be deemed to be a Court within the meaning of the Evidence Act, 1872 (I of 1872), and shall exercise all the powers of a Commissioner appointed under the Public Servants (Inquiries) Act, 1850 (XXXVII of 1850).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Appeals</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) Where the Council has refused recognition of any nursing or allied qualification under section 9(2), or has withdrawn such recognition under section 13 or has refused registration of any person or removed from the register the name of any person under section 15, it shall inform the Institution or the person concerned in writing of such refusal, withdrawal or removal.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any Institution or person aggrieved by an order of refusal, withdrawal or removal mentioned in sub-section (1) may, within sixty days from the date of receipt of information regarding such refusal, withdrawal or removal, prefer an appeal to the Government and the decision of the Government on such appeal shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Penalty for fraudulent representation or registration</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. Whoever wilfully procures or attempts to procure his registration under this Ordinance by making or causing to be made any false or fraudulent representation or declaration, either orally or in writing, or whoever abets processing of such registration or, whoever falsely pretends to be registered under this Ordinance shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to two thousand Taka, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Indemnity</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against the Council or the Executive Committee, or any officer or other employee of the Council for anything which is in good faith done or intended to be done under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to make regulations</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. (1) The Council may, with the previous approval of the Government, make regulations to carry out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, such regulations may provide for-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the management of the property of the Council and the maintenance and audit of its accounts;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the summoning and holding of meetings of the Council and of the Executive Committee and the conduct of business thereat;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the powers and duties of the President and Vice-President;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        the terms and conditions of service of the Registrar and other officers and employees of the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        the powers and duties of the Registrar and other officers and employees of the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         the powers and duties of Inspectors and procedure of inspection;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        the procedure for maintenance, compilation and publication of the register, list of the holders of nursing and allied qualifications and the fees to be charged for registration;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        the procedure of an enquiry held under section 15;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         prescribing a uniform minimum standard of courses of training for obtaining basic or post basic nursing and allied qualifications to be included in any of the Schedules, and the duration of, and the conditions for admission to, such courses;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         prescribing the minimum qualification and experience required of teachers for appointment in nursing and allied Institutions;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        prescribing the standards of examinations, methods of conducting the examinations and other requirements to be satisfied for securing recognition of nursing or allied qualifications under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l)         prescribing the qualifications and experience required of examiners for professional examinations in nursing and allied profession antecedent to the granting of recognised nursing and allied qualifications;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m)       registration of nursing and allied students at any nursing or allied Institution, and the fees payable in respect of such registration; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n)        any other matter for which under this Ordinance provision may be made by regulations.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Repeal and savings</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. (1) The Nurses Act, 1934 (Ben. Act X of 1934), and the Nursing Council Act, 1952 (LIX of 1952), hereinafter referred to as the said Acts, are hereby repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Upon the repeal of the said Acts,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        all assets, rights, powers, authorities and privileges, and all property, movable or immovable, cash and bank balances, funds, investments and all other interests and rights in, or arising out of, such property of the Bangladesh Nursing Councils constituted under the said Acts, hereinafter referred to as the Nursing Councils, and subsisting immediately before such repeal shall stand transferred to, and vest in, the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        all debts, obligations and liabilities incurred, all contracts entered into and all matters and things to be done by, with or for, the Nursing Councils and subsisting immediately before such repeal shall be deemed to have been incurred, entered into or engaged to be done by, with or for, the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        all officers and other employees of the Nursing Councils serving immediately before such repeal shall stand transferred to and become officers and employees of the Council and shall hold their office or service in the Council on the same terms and conditions as were enjoyed by them immediately before such repeal and shall continue to do so until their terms and conditions are duly altered by the Council;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        all suits, prosecutions and other legal proceedings instituted by or against the Nursing Councils shall be deemed to be suits, prosecutions and proceedings by or against the Council and shall be proceeded or otherwise dealt with accordingly;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        every nurse, midwife, health visitor and family welfare visitor registered under the said Acts shall be deemed to be registered under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Source</strong> : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
622	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH OIL, GAS AND MINERAL CORPORATION ORDINANCE 1985</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE BANGLADESH OIL, GAS AND MINERAL CORPORATION ORDINANCE 1985</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO XXI OF 1985).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[11th April, 1985]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the establishment of the Bangladesh Oil, Gas and Mineral Corporation. WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of the Bangladesh Oil, Gas and Mineral Corporation and for matters incidental thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 24th March, 1982, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Bangladesh Oil, Gas and Mineral Corporation Ordinance, 1985.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “Board” means the Board of Directors of the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Corporation” means the Bangladesh Oil, Gas and Mineral Corporation established under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “Director” means a Director of the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “mineral” means all minerals, whether in a solid, liquid or gaseous state and rock resources, metal or non-metal, including coal, lime-stone, clay, sand, metalliferous ore and non-metallic mineral and any other naturally occurring substance which may be used either in its original form or after processing for economic purposes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules or regulations made under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Establishment of the Corporation</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) There shall be established a Corporation to be called the Bangladesh Oil, Gas and Mineral Corporation for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ (1A) The Corporation may also be called PETRO BANGLA.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Corporation shall be a body corporate, having perpetual succession and a common seal with power to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Authorised capital</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The authorised capital of the Corporation shall be taka two hundred crore to be subscribed by the Government, in the manner determined by the Government from time to time, according to the requirements of the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>General direction</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) Subject to rules and regulations made under this Ordinance, the general direction and administration of the affairs and business of the Corporation shall vest in a Board of Directors which may exercise all powers and do all acts and things which may be exercised or done by the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board in discharging its functions shall act on commercial considerations having due regard to public interest generally and shall be guided on questions of policy by such instructions as may be given to it by the Government from time to time, and, if any question arises as to whether any question is a question of policy or not, the decision of the Government shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ 6. (1) The Board shall consist of the following Directors, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) a Chairman to be appointed by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        an officer not below the rank of a Joint Secretary of the Ministry or Division dealing with energy and mineral resources to be nominated by that Ministry or Division;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        an officer not below the rank of a Joint Secretary of the Ministry or Division dealing with finance to be nominated by that Ministry or Division;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) an officer not below the rank of a Joint Secretary of the Ministry or Division dealing with planning to be nominated by that Ministry or Division;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        not more than five other Directors to be appointed by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chairman shall be the chief executive officer of the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Chairman and the appointed Directors shall be whole-time officers of the Corporation and shall serve on such terms and conditions as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Chairman and other Directors shall exercise such powers and perform such functions as may be prescribed or as may be assigned to them by the Government from time to time.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Meeting of the Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) The meetings of the Board shall be held at such times and places as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that, until so prescribed, such meetings shall be held at such times and places as may be determined by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Board, not less than three Directors shall be present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) All meetings of the Board shall be presided over by the Chairman, and in his absence, by a Director elected for the purpose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) At a meeting of the Board, each Director shall have one vote, and in the event of equality of votes, the person presiding shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) No act or proceeding of the Board shall be invalid merely on the ground of existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the Constitution of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Committees</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. The Board may appoint such committee or committees as it thinks fit to assist it in the efficient discharge of its functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Functions of the Corporation</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) The functions of the Corporation shall be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) to undertake research in the field of oil, gas and minerals;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to prepare and implement programmes for the exploration and development of oil, gas and mineral resources;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to produce and sell oil, gas and mineral resources; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to perform such other functions as the Government may, from time to time, assign to the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing provisions, the Corporation shall, in particular, have power-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) to undertake research for alternative use of natural gas;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to carry out geological, geophysical and other surveys for the exploration and development of oil, gas and mineral resources;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to carry out drilling and other prospecting operations to prove and estimate the reserves of oil, gas and mineral resources and collect all data required for adopting the most suitable extraction and mining method;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to set up mining industries and to continue production and sale of the mined commodities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to plan, promote and develop cement industries in the country;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) to take up, execute and operate any project on mining and mineral development;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) to contribute towards the cost of any studies, experiments or technical research connected with the functions of the Corporation and undertaken or done in the interest of the Corporation by any other person, body or agency;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) to undertake, assist or encourage the collection, maintenance and publication of statistics, bulletins and monograph.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Formation of Companies</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. The Corporation may, with the previous approval in writing of the Government, sponsor the formation of subsidiary companies for exploration and exploitation of oil, gas and mineral resources and may hold an interest therein and may also, subject to the general policy of the Government regarding foreign investment, permit any foreigner to hold an interest in such companies.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to hold shares or interest in any company</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3[ 10A. The Corporation may hold shares or interest in any company formed for the purpose of exploration and exploitation of oil, gas and mineral resources.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Head Office</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) The Head Office of the Corporation shall be at Dhaka.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Corporation may establish such regional office or other offices, branches and agencies as the Board may think fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Appointment of officers, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. The Corporation may appoint such officers and other employees as it considers necessary for the efficient performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Delegation of powers</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. The Board may, by general or special order in writing, direct that such of its powers shall, in such circumstances and under such conditions, if any, as may be specified in the order, be exercisable also by the Chairman or any other Director or by an officer of the Corporation as may be so specified:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no power to make regulations under section 23 shall be delegated under this section.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Annual Budget Statement</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. The Corporation shall, by such date each year as may be prescribed, submit to the Government for approval a statement to be called the Annual Budget Statement in the prescribed form for each financial year showing the estimated receipts and expenditure during that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Bank Account</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. The Corporation may open and operate any account with any scheduled bank.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Investment of funds</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. The Corporation may invest its funds in such securities as may be authorised by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Borrowings</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. The Corporation may, with the prior approval of the Government, borrow such sums, with or without security, as may be required by it to discharge its functions under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Audit and Accounts</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. (1) The Corporation shall maintain proper accounts and other relevant records, and prepare annual statement of accounts, including the profit and loss account and balance sheet, in accordance with such general directions as may be issued, and such form as may be prescribed, by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The accounts of the Corporation shall be audited by not less than two auditors, being chartered accountants within the meaning of the Bangladesh Chartered Accountants Order, 1973 (P.O. No. 2 of 1973), who shall be appointed by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Every auditor appointed under sub-section (2) shall be given a copy of the annual balance sheet and other accounts of the Corporation who shall examine it together with the account books and vouchers relating thereto; and shall have a list delivered to him of all books kept by the Corporation, and at all reasonable times have access to the books, accounts and other documents of the Corporation, and may in relation to such accounts examine any Director or officer of the Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The auditors shall report to the Government upon the annual balance sheet and accounts, and in their report they shall state whether, in their opinion, the balance sheet contains all necessary particulars and is properly drawn up so as to exhibit a true and correct view of the state of the affairs of the Corporation and, if they have called for any explanation or information from the Board, whether it has been given and whether it is satisfactory.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Government may, at any time, issue directions to the auditors requiring them to report to it upon the adequacy of measures taken by the Corporation for the protection of the interest of the Government or upon the sufficiency of their procedure in auditing the affairs of the Corporation, and may, at any time, enlarge or extend the scope of the audit or direct that different procedure in audit shall be adopted or that any other examination shall be made by the auditors or any other person or persons if, in its opinion, the interest of the Government so requires.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Submission of annual report, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. (1) The Corporation shall, as soon as possible after the end of every financial year, furnish to the Government a statement of account audited by the auditors under section 18.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may require the Corporation to furnish any report, return, statement, estimate, statistics or other information regarding any matter under the control of the Corporation and the Corporation shall comply with every such requisition.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Survey of lands, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. (1) The Chairman or any other person authorised by him in writing may enter upon and survey any land, undertake investigations, erect pillars for the determination of areas and intended lines of works, make borings and excavation for the discovery of minerals, and do all other acts which may be necessary in order to carry out all or any of the purposes of this Ordinance:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that when the affected land does not vest in the Corporation, powers conferred by this sub-section shall be exercised in such manner as to cause the least interference with, and the least damage to, the rights of the owner thereof.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) When any person enters into or upon any land in pursuance of sub-section (1), he shall, at the time of entering, pay or tender payment for all necessary damage to be done as aforesaid and in case of dispute as to the sufficiency of the amount so paid or tendered, he shall at once refer the dispute to the Corporation whose decision shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall be lawful for any person authorised under sub-section (1) to make an entry upon any land, to open or cause to be opened a door, gate or other barrier,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) if he considers the opening thereof necessary for the purpose of such entry;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        if the occupier or owner, as the case may be, is absent, or being present refuses to open door, gate or barrier:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the compensation shall be paid for the damage caused in such manner as the Corporation may prescribe, and in case of dispute as to the sufficiency of the amount, the matter shall be referred to the Corporation whose decision shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Indemnity</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceedings shall lie against the Board, the Chairman or any other Director or any officer or employee of the Corporation for anything which is in good faith done or intended to be done under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to make rules</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to make regulations</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. (1) The Board may make regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules made thereunder, to provide for all matters for which provision is necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All regulations made under this section shall be published in the official Gazette and shall come into force on such publication.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Repeal, amendment, dissolution, savings, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. (1) On the commencement of this Ordinance,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Bangladesh Mineral Exploration and Development Corporation Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 120 of 1972), shall stand repealed;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)      in the Bangladesh Industrial Enterprises (Nationalisation) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 27 of 1972), in Article 10, in clause (1), in sub-clause (d), the words, brackets, figure and comma “and (iii) Bangladesh Oil and Gas Corporation which may also be called PETROBANGLA”, shall stand omitted; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the Bangladesh Mineral Exploration and Development Corporation established under the Bangladesh Mineral Exploration and Development Corporation Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 120 of 1972), and the Bangladesh Oil and Gas Corporation (PETROBANGLA) established under the Bangladesh Industrial Enterprises (Nationalisation) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 27 of 1972), hereinafter referred to as the said Corporation, shall stand dissolved.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any contract, agreement or other instrument,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) all business, project including the projects specified in the Schedule to this Ordinance, and undertakings of the said Corporations including all assets, rights, powers, authorities and privileges and all property, movable and immovable, cash and bank balances, reserve funds and investments of the said Corporation and all other rights and interest in, and arising out of, such property and all books of accounts, registers, records and other documents of whatever nature relating to the said Corporation, shall stand transferred to, and vest in, the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        all debts and liabilities incurred, obligations undertaken, contracts entered into, agreements made by or with the said Corporation shall be deemed to have been incurred, undertaken, entered into or may by or with the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        all suits and other legal proceedings instituted by or against the said Corporation shall be deemed to be suits or other legal proceedings by or against the Corporation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        every officer or other employee of the said Corporation shall become an officer or other employee of the Corporation and shall hold office or service in the Corporation on the same terms and conditions as were applicable to him immediately before the dissolution of the said Corporation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) On the repeal of the Bangladesh Mineral Exploration and Development Corporation Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 120 of 1972), and amendment in the Bangladesh Industrial Enterprises (Nationalisation) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 27 of 1972), hereinafter</p><p style="text-align: justify;">referred to as the said Orders, anything done or any action taken, including any order made under the said Orders shall be deemed to have been done, taken or made under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Government may, for the purpose of removing any difficulty in relation to the transfer and other matters specified in sub-section (2), make such order as it considers expedient and any such order shall be deemed to be, and given effect to as, part of the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Sub-section (1A) was inserted by section 2 of the Bangladesh Oil, Gas and Mineral Corporation (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. XI of 1989).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Section 6 was substituted by section 3 of the Bangladesh Oil, Gas and Mineral Corporation (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. XI of 1989).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 Section 10A was inserted by section 4 of the Bangladesh Oil, Gas and Mineral Corporation (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. XI of 1989).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Source</strong> :  Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
623	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE BANGLADESH PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION TRAINING CENTER ORDINANCE 1984</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE BANGLADESH PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION TRAINING CENTER ORDINANCE 1984</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO XXVI OF 1984).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[11th April, 1984]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the establishment of a Public Administration Training Center. WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of a Public Administration Training Center and for matters connected therewith or incidental thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 24th March,1982, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>commencement</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Bangladesh Public Administration Training Center Ordinance 1984.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force on such date as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Board” means the Board of Governors of the Center;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “Center” means the Bangladesh Public Administration Training Center established under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “member” means a member of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        “prescribed” means prescribed by rules or regulations made under this Ordinance; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         “Rector” means the Rector appointed under <strong>section 8</strong>.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Establishment of the Center</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) There shall be a Public Administration Training Center to be called the Bangladesh Public Administration Training Center for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Center shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal with power to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>General direction</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) Subject to the rules and regulations made under this Ordinance, the general direction and administration of the affairs of the Center shall vest in a Board of Governors which may exercise all powers and do all things which may be exercised or done by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board in discharging its functions shall be guided on questions of policy by such instructions as may be given to it by the Government from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) The Board shall consist of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        a Minister to be nominated by the Government, who shall also be the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        Cabinet Secretary, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        Rector, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        Secretary, Ministry of Establishment, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        Secretary, Finance Division, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         Secretary, Education Division, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1[ (ff) Vice-Chancellor, Jahangirnagar University, ex-officio;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ (g) a Vice-Chancellor of a University, other than the Jahangirnagar University, to be nominated by the Government;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        Commandant, Defence Services Command and Staff College, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         Chairman, Bangladesh Federation of Commerce and Industry, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         Chairman, Department of Public Administration, University of Dhaka, Chittagong, Rajshahi or Jahangirnagar by rotation in that order;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)  two persons including one woman to be nominated by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The members mentioned in sub-section (1) (g), (j) and (k) shall hold office for a period of two years.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Functions of the Center</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The functions of the Center shall be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to equip senior public and business executive of Bangladesh for their role in a dynamic and developing society;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        to impart in-service training to persons in the service of the Republic and of local authorities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        to provide foundational training to the officers of different cadres and sub-cadres of Bangladesh Civil Service;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        to provide foundational and refresher training to non-cadre officers of the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        to organise research and publication on public administration and development;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         to publish books, periodicals and reports on administration and development;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        to establish and maintain libraries and reading rooms;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        to advise the Government on any specific problem of administration and development as and when referred to it;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         to prescribe courses of training;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         to grant certificates to persons who have undergone training at the Center; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        to do such other acts and things as may be considered necessary for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Meetings of the Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) The meetings of the Board shall be held at such times and places and in such manner as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that, until so prescribed, such meetings shall be held at such times and places as may be determined by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Board, not less than six members shall be present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) All meetings of the Board shall be presided over by the Chairman and, in his absence, by a member authorised in writing by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) At a meeting of the Board, each member shall have one vote, and, in the event of equality of votes, the person presiding shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) No act or proceeding of the Board shall be invalid or be called in question merely on the ground of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Rector</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) There shall be a Rector of the Center who shall be appointed by the Government on such terms and conditions as may be determined by it.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Rector shall be a whole time officer and the chief executive of the Center.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, the Rector shall manage the business and fund of the Center and shall be responsible for the efficient management of the business of the Center and for the proper execution of the decision of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Rector shall perform such other functions as may be assigned to him by the Board or as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) If a vacancy occurs in the office of Rector or if the Rector is unable to discharge the functions of his office on account of absence, illness or any other cause, the Government shall make such arrangement for discharging the functions of the Rector as it may consider expedient.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Director and Member of Directing Staff</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. (1) There shall be appointed such number of Directors and Members of the Directing Staff of the Center as the Government may determine from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A Director or a Member of the Directing Staff shall be appointed by the Government on such terms and conditions as it may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A Director or a Member of the Directing Staff shall perform such functions as may be assigned to him by the Rector or as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Appointment of officers, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. The Center may, subject to such general or special order as the Government may give from time to time, appoint such officers and other employees as it considers necessary for the efficient performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Committees</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. The Board may appoint such committee as it may consider necessary to assist it in the performance of its functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Delegation of powers</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12.
