shall dismiss the suit so far as it relates to the remainder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) Where a suit is dismissed under sub-section (1) or wholly or partly dismissed under sub-section (4), the plaintiff may, within thirty days of the making of the order of dismissal, apply to the Court by which the order was made for an order to set the dismissal aside, and if he satisfies the Court that there was sufficient cause for his non-appearance when the suit was called on for hearing, the Court shall make an order setting aside the dismissal, and shall appoint a day for proceeding with the suit:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Court may set the dismissal of a suit under sub-section (4) aside on such terms as to costs or otherwise as it thinks fit:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that no order setting the dismissal of a suit under sub-section (4) aside shall be made unless notice of the application has been served on the defendant.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) Where a decree is passed ex parte against a defendant, he may, within thirty days of the passing of the decree, apply to the Court by which the decree was passed for an order to set it aside, and if he satisfies the Court that there was sufficient cause for his non-appearance when the suit was called on for hearing, the Court shall make an order setting aside the decree as against him on such terms as to costs or otherwise as it thinks fit, and shall appoint a day for proceeding with the suit:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that where the decree is of such a nature that it cannot be set aside as against such defendant only, it may be set aside against all or any of the other defendants also:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that no order shall be made under this sub-section unless notice of the application has been served on the plaintiff.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) The provisions of section 5 of the Limitation Act, 1908 (IX of 1908), shall apply to an application under sub-section (6).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Pre-trial proceeding</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) When the written statement is filed, the Family Court shall fix a date ordinarily of not more than thirty days for a pre-trial hearing of the suit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) On the date fixed for pre-trial hearing, the Court shall examine the plaint, the written statement 16[ * * *] and documents filed by the parties and shall also, if it so deems fit, hear the parties.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) At the pre-trial hearing, the Court shall ascertain the points at issue between the parties and attempt to effect a compromise or reconciliation between the parties, if this be possible.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) If no compromise or reconciliation is possible, the Court shall frame the issues in the suit and fix a date 17[ ordinarily of not more that thirty days] for recording evidence.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Trial in camera</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) A Family Court may, if it so deems fit, hold the whole or any part of the proceedings under this Ordinance in camera.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Where both the parties to the suit request the Court to hold the proceedings in camera, the Court shall do so.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Recording of evidence</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) On the date fixed for recording of the evidence, the Family Court shall examine the witnesses produced by the parties in such order as it deems fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Court shall not issue any summons for the appearance of a witness for any party, unless, within three days of the framing of issues, the party intimates the Court that it desires the witness to be summoned through the Court and the Court is satisfied that it is not possible or practicable for the party to produce the witness.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The witnesses shall give evidence in their own words and may be cross-examined and re-examined.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Court may forbid any question which it regards as indecent, scandalous or frivolous or which appears to it to be intended to insult or annoy or be needlessly offensive in form.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Court may, if it so deems fit, put any question to any witness for the purpose of elucidation of any point which it considers material in the case.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) The Court may permit the evidence of any witness to be given by means of affidavit:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Court may, if it so deems fit, call such witness for the purpose of examination.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) The evidence of each witness shall be taken down in writing, in the language of the Court, by the presiding Judge of the Court and shall be signed by such Judge.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(8) Where the evidence of a witness is given in any language other than the language of the Court, the presiding Judge may take it down in that language, if possible, and an authenticated translation of such evidence in the language of the Court shall form a part of record.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(9) When the evidence of a witness is taken down, it shall be read over to him and shall, if necessary, be corrected.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(10) If the witness does not accept the correctness of any part of the evidence, the presiding Judge may, instead of correcting the evidence, make a memorandum of the objection made by the witness, and shall add such remarks as he thinks necessary.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(11) If the evidence is taken down in a language different from that in which it has been given and the witness does not understand that language, the evidence shall be interpreted to him in the language in which it was given or in a language which he understands.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Conclusion of trial</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. (1) After the close of evidence of all parties, the Family Court shall make another effort to effect a compromise or reconciliation between the parties.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If such compromise or reconciliation is not possible, the Court shall pronounce judgment and, on such judgment 18[ either at once or on some future day not beyond seven days of which due notice shall be given to the parties or their agents or advocates], a decree shall follow.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Compromise decree</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. Where a dispute is settled by compromise or conciliation, the Court shall pass a decree or give decision in the suit in terms of the compromise or conciliation agreed to between the parties.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Writing of judgment</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) Every judgment or order of a Family Court shall be written by the presiding Judge or from the dictation of such Judge in the language of the Court and shall be dated and signed by the Judge in open Court at the time of pronouncing it.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All judgments and orders which are appealable shall contain the point for determination, the decision thereon and the reasons therefore.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Enforcement of decrees</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) A Family Court shall pass a decree in such form and manner, and shall enter its particulars in such register of decrees as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If any money is paid, or any property is delivered, in the presence of the Court in satisfaction of the decree, it shall enter the fact of such payment or delivery in the aforesaid register.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">19[ (3) Where the decree relates to the payment of money and the decretal amount is not paid within the time specified by the Court, the decree shall, on the prayer of the decree-holder to be made within a period of one year from the expiry of the time so specified, be executed-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) as a decree for money of a Civil   Court under the Code, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) as an order for payment of fine made by a Magistrate under the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898 (Act V of 1898),</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">and on such execution the decretal amount recovered shall be paid to the decree-holder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3A) For the purpose of execution of a decree under sub-section (3)(a), the Court shall be deemed to be a Civil   Court and shall have all the powers of such Court under the Code.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3B) For the purpose of execution of a decree under sub-section (3)(b), the Judge of the Family Court shall be deemed to be a Magistrate of the first class and shall have all the powers of such Magistrate under the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898 (Act V of 1898), and he may issue a warrant for levying the decretal amount due in the manner provided in that Code for levying fines, and may sentence the judgment debtor, for the whole or any part of the decretal amount remaining unpaid after the execution of the warrant, to imprisonment for a term which may extend to three months or until payment if sooner made.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3C) When a decree does not relate to payment of money, it shall be executed as a decree, other than a decree for money of a Civil Court and for that purpose the Court shall be deemed to be a Civil Court and shall have all the powers of such Court under the Code.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">20[ (4) The decree shall be executed by the Family Court passing it or by such other Family Court to which the decree may be transferred for execution by the Court passing it and in executing such a decree the Court to which it is transferred shall have all powers of the Family Court passing the decree as if the decree were passed by it.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Court may, if it so deems fit, direct that any money to be paid under a decree passed by it be paid in such instalments as it deems fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Interim order by Family Courts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21[ 16A. Where, at any stage of a suit, the Family Court is satisfied by affidavit or otherwise, that immediate action should be taken for preventing any party from frustrating the purpose of the suit, it may make such interim order as it deems fit.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appeal</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. (1) Subject to the provisions of sub-section (2), an appeal shall lie from a judgment, decree or order of a Family Court to the Court of District Judge.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) No appeal shall lie from a decree passed by a Family   Court-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) for dissolution of marriage, except in the case of dissolution for reasons specified in section 2(viii)(d) of the Dissolution of Muslim Marriages Act, 1939 (VIII of 1939);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) for dower not exceeding five thousand taka.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) An appeal under this section shall be preferred within thirty days of the passing of the judgment, decree or order excluding the time required for obtaining copies thereof:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Court of District Judge may, for sufficient cause, extend the said period.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) An appeal shall-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) be in writing;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) set out the grounds on which the appellant seeks to challenge the judgment, decree or order;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) contain the names, description and addresses of the parties; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) bear the signature of the appellant.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) A certified copy of the judgment, decree or order of the Court from which the appeal is preferred shall be attached with the appeal.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) Any order passed by the Court of District Judge shall, as soon as may be, be communicated to the Family Court which shall modify or amend the judgment, decree or order accordingly and shall also make necessary entries to that effect in the appropriate column in the register of decrees.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">22[ (7) The District Judge may transfer an appeal to the Court of an Additional District Judge or a Subordinate Judge for hearing and disposal and may withdraw any such appeal form such Court.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power of Family Court to summon witnesses</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. (1) A Family Court may issue summons to any person to appear and give evidence, or to produce or cause the production of any document:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) no person who is exempt from personal appearance in a Court under section 133(1) of the Code, shall be required to appear in person;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) a Family Court may refuse to summon a witness or to enforce a summons already issued against a witness when, in the opinion of the Court, the attendance of the witness cannot be procured without such delay, expense or inconvenience as in the circumstances would be unreasonable.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If any person to whom a Family Court has issued summons to appear and give evidence or to cause the production of any document before it wilfully disobeys such summons, the Court may take cognizance of such disobedience, and after giving such person an opportunity to explain, sentence him to a fine not exceeding one hundred taka.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Contempt of Family Courts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. A person shall be guilty of contempt of the Family Court if he, without lawful excuse,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) offers any insult to the Family Court;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) causes an interruption in the work of the Family Court;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) refuses to answer any question put by the Family Court, which he is bound to answer; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        refuses to take oath to state the truth or to sign any statement made by him in the Family Court;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">and the Family Court may forthwith try such person for such contempt and sentence him to a fine not exceeding two hundred taka.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Application and non-application of certain laws</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. (1) Save as otherwise expressly provided by or under this Ordinance, the provisions of the Evidence Act, 1872 (I of 1872), and of the Code except sections 10 and 11 shall not apply to proceedings before the Family Courts.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Oaths Act, 1873 (X of 1873), shall apply to all proceedings before the Family Courts.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appearance through agents</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. If a person required under this Ordinance to appear before a Family Court, otherwise than as a witness, is a pardahnashin lady, the Family Court may permit her to be represented by a duly authorised agent.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Court-fee</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. The Court-fees to be paid on any plaint presented to a Family Court shall be twenty-five taka for any kind of suit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Ordinance VIII of 1961 not affected</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. (1) Nothing in this Ordinance shall be deemed to affect any of the provisions of the Muslim Family Laws Ordinance, 1961 (VIII of 1961), or the rules made thereunder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Where a Family Court passes a decree for the dissolution of a marriage solemnised under the Muslim Law, the Court shall, within seven days of the passing of the decree, send by registered post a certified copy of the same to the appropriate Chairman referred to in section 7 of the Muslim Family Laws Ordinance, 1961 (VIII of 1961), and upon receipt of such copy, the Chairman shall proceed as if he had received an intimation of talaq required to be given under the said Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A decree passed by a Family Court for the dissolution of a marriage solemnised under the Muslim Law shall-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) not be effective until the expiration of ninety days from the day on which a copy thereof has been received under sub-section (2) by the Chairman; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) be of no effect if within the period specified in clause (a) a reconciliation has been effected between the parties in accordance with the provisions of the Muslim Family Laws Ordinance, 1961 (VIII of 1961).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Family Court deemed to be a District Court for purposes of Act VIII of 1890</p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. (1) A Family Court shall be deemed to be a District Court for the purposes of the Guardians and Wards Act, 1890 (VIII of 1890), and notwithstanding anything contained in this Ordinance, shall, in dealing with matters specified in that Act, follow the procedure specified in that Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding anything contained in the Guardians and Wards Act, 1890 (VIII of 1890), an appeal from an order made by a Family Court as District Court under that Act shall lie to the Court of District Judge, and the provisions of section 17 shall apply to such appeal.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Transfer and stay of suits and appeals</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. (1) The High Court Division may, either on the application of any party or of its own accord, by an order in writing,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) transfer any suit under this Ordinance from one Family Court to another Family Court in the same district or from a Family Court of one district to a Family Court of another district;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        transfer any appeal under this Ordinance from the Court of District Judge of one district to the Court of District Judge of another district.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A District Judge may, either on the application of any party or of his own accord, by an order in writing, transfer any suit under this Ordinance from one Family Court to another Family Court within the local limits of his jurisdiction.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Notwithstanding anything contained in this Ordinance, a District Judge may transfer an appeal pending before him under this Ordinance to any Court of Additional District Judge or Subordinate Judge under his administrative control and may also retransfer such appeal from such Court to his own Court.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Any Court to which a suit or appeal is transferred under this section, shall, notwithstanding anything contained in this Ordinance, have the jurisdiction to dispose it of in the manner as if it were instituted or filed before it:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that on the transfer of a suit, it shall not be necessary to commence the proceedings before the succeeding Judge de novo unless the Judge, for reasons to be recorded in writing, directs otherwise.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) A District Judge may, by an order in writing, stay any suit pending before a Family Court within the local limits of his jurisdiction.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) The High Court Division may, by an order in writing, stay any suit or appeal pending before any Family Court or Court of District Judge.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">26. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provisions relating to pending cases</p><p style="text-align: justify;">27. Notwithstanding anything contained in this Ordinance, all suits, appeals and other legal proceedings relating to, or arising out of, any of the matters specified in section 5 pending in any Court immediately before the commencement of this Ordinance shall continue in the same Court and shall be heard and disposed of by that Court as if this Ordinance had not been made.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The words “Assistant Judges” were substituted for the word “Munsifs” by section 2 of the Family Courts (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. XXX of 1989).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The words “Assistant Judges” were substituted for the word “Munsifs” by section 2 of the Family Courts (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. XXX of 1989).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The words “and a brief summary of the facts to which they would depose” were omitted by section 3 of the Family Courts (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. XXX of 1989).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The words “and shall also enter such documents in a list to be added or annexed to the plaint” were inserted by section 3 of the Family Courts (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. XXX of 1989).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 Sub-section (7) was substituted by section 3 of the Family Courts (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. XXX of 1989).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 Sub-sections (8) and (9) were added by section 3 of the Family Courts (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. XXX of 1989).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8 The words, figure and brackets “and copies of the list of documents referred to in sections 6(5) and 6(6) ” were substituted for the words, figure and brackets ” a copy of the schedule referred to in section 6(3), a copy of the document referred to in section 6(5) and a list of the document referred to in section 6(6)” by section 4 of the Family Courts (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. XXX of 1989).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9 The figure “20” was inserted by section 4 of the Family Courts (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. XXX of 1989).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10 The colon (:) was substituted for the full-stop (.) and thereafter the proviso was added by section 5 of the Family Courts (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. XXX of 1989).</p><p style="text-align: inserted by section 5 of the Family Courts (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. XXX of 1989).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13 Sub-section (5) was substituted by 6 of the Family Courts (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. XXX of 1989).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16 The brackets and words “(if any) and the summary of evidence” were omitted by section 7 of the Family Courts (Amendment) Act, 1989 (Act No. XXX of 1989).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17 The words “ordinarily of 639	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE FINANCE ACT 1981</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE FINANCE ACT 1981</p><p style="text-align: justify;">NO. XI OF 1981).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[30th June, 1981]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to authorise payment and appropriation of certain sums from and out of the Consolidated Fund for the services of the financial year ending on the thirtieth day of June 1982.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to authorise payment and appropriation of certain sums from and out of the Consolidated Fund for the services of the financial year ending on the thirtieth day of the June, 1982;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> commencement</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the Finance Act, 1981.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Subject to the Provisional Collection of Taxes Act, 1931 (XVI of 1931), and the declaration made thereunder, this Act shall, except as otherwise provided, come into force on the first day of July, 1981.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Amendments of Act VII of 1870</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In the Court Fees Act, 1870 (VII of 1870), for Schedule I and Schedule II thereto the Schedules set out in the First Schedule to this Act shall be substituted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Amendment of Act II of 1899</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. In the Stamp Act 1899 (II of 1899), in Schedule I, in entry 54, against item (b) in the first column, in the second column, for the words “Twenty-five Taka” the words “Seventy-five Taka” shall be substituted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Amendment of Act XI of 1922</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The following amendments shall be made in the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) in section 4, in sub-section (3),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) in clause (via), for the words “Taka two thousand” the words “Taka two thousand and five hundred” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) for clause (xvi) the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(xvi) any interest, not exceeding Taka three thousand, received by an assessee, being an individual, from a scheduled bank, a co-operative bank or a co-operative society on any deposit;”; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) in clause (xviii), in the proviso, for the word, brackets and figure “clause (xvii)” the words, brackets and figures “clauses (xvi) and (xvii)” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) in section 7, in sub-section (1), in the third proviso, for the words “three thousand and six hundred Taka”, “one thousand and eight hundred taka” and “one thousand and five hundred Taka” the words “four thousand and two hundred Taka”, “two thousand and four hundred Taka” and “one thousand and eight hundred Taka” shall, respectively, be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) in section 9, in sub-section (1), in clauses (i) and (ii), for the word “one-sixth” the word “one-fifth” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) in section 9A, sub-section (6) shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) in section 10, in sub-section (4)-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) in clause (d), for the words “fifty thousand Taka” the words “sixty thousand Taka” shall be substituted; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        in clause (f), for the full-stop at the end a semi-colon and word “; or” shall be substituted and thereafter the following new clause (g) shall be added, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(g) any allowance in respect of so much of the expenses incurred by an assessee on account of entertainment or services rendered as are not supported by excise stamp or seal in cases of sales and services liable to excise duty.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) <strong>In</strong> <strong>section 14A</strong>,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) I<strong>n sub-section (2B)</strong>, in clause (a), for sub-clause (ii) the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(ii) except in the case of a company or other body corporate under the control of Government or of a corporation the administration and management of which is subject to instruction, direction or control of Government, a subscribed and paid-up capital of not less than Taka one lakh"</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) <strong>after sub-section (2B)</strong>, the following new sub-section (2BB) shall be inserted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(2BB) The provisions of sub-sections (2A) and (2B) shall also apply to an industrial undertaking consisting of an expansion of an existing industrial undertaking if such expansion constitutes-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) an identifiable industrial unit for production of similar or other goods or class of goods, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) a similar unit for the carrying out of an identifiable industrial process and such identifiable or similar unit fulfills the conditions laid-down in sub-section (2B),</p><p style="text-align: justify;">but nothing contained in this sub-section shall apply to an industrial undertaking which is formed by the splitting up or the reconstruction or reconstitution of any business already in existence or by the transfer to a new business of any machinery or plant used in a business which was being carried on in taxable territories.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7)<strong> In section 15</strong>-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) in sub-section (3), for the words “thirty thousand Taka” the words “thirty five thousand Taka” shall be substituted; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) after sub-section (3) amended as aforesaid, the following new sub-section (3A) shall be inserted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(3A) The aggregate sum of exemption under sub-section (3), other than the sums exempted under the first proviso to sub-section (1) of section 7, sub-section (1) of section 58F and sub-section (1) of this section, shall be calculated subject to the following limits:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) Where the amount does not exceed "Taka five thousand" the whole of such amount.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) Where the amount exceeds Taka five thousand        Taka five thousand plus sixty per cent of the amount exceeding Taka five thousand.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(8) <strong>In section 15AA</strong>,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) In sub-section (1), after the words and brackets “National Investment (Unit) Trust”, a comma and the words, “, Unit Certificates issued by the Investment Corporation of Bangladesh” shall be inserted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) In sub-section (3), after the words, brackets and comma “National Investment (Unit) Trust,” the words and comma “Unit Certificates issued by the Investment Corporation of Bangladesh,” shall be inserted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(9) section 15B shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(10) In section 16, in sub-section (1), in clause (b), for the word “super tax” the word “income-tax” shall be substituted and shall be deemed to have been so substituted on and from the first day of July, 1980;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(11) In section, 17, in sub-section (5), in clause (b), in sub-clause (ii), in paragraph (1), in the first column for the words “before five-years” the words “within five years” shall be substituted and shall be deemed to have been so substituted on and from the first day of July, 1980;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(12) In section 18, in sub-section (3BB), after the words “on account of” occurring for the first time, the words and comma “indenting commission”, shall be inserted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(13) In section 18A,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) In sub-section (1), for the words “twenty thousand taka” the words “twenty-five thousand Taka” shall be substituted; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In sub-section (3), for the words “Twenty thousand taka” the words “twenty-five thousand Taka” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(14) In section 22,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">in sub-section (1), in the second proviso, for the words “Taka twenty thousand” the words “Taka twenty-five thousand” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(15) In section 23, in sub-section (3A),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) for the word “shall” occurring for the first time, the word “may” shall be substituted and shall be deemed to have been so substituted provided in sub-sections (1), (2) and (3) and sections 46A, 46B, 46C and 46D.”.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendments of Act I of 1944</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The following amendments shall be made in the Excises and Salt Act, 1944 (I of 1944), namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) in section 2, in clause (m), for sub-clauses (ii) and (iii) the prices or adoption of any other process to render the product marketable to consumers;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">and the word “manufacturer” shall be construed accordingly and shall include Notwithstanding anything contained in the Customs Act, 1969 (IV of 1969), a passenger arriving at Bangladesh from a foreign country shall be allowed to import any goods as accompanied baggage under rule 5 of the Passengers (Non-tourists) Baggage (Import) Rules, 1981, the value of which as defined in section 25 of the aforesaid Act does not exceed the amount specified in the aforesaid Rules on payment of sales tax at the effective rate and customs-duty at the rates of 250% ad valorem no textile goods, spirituous beverages, perfumery, cosmetics and toilet preparations and 150% ad valorem on other goods, provided that the import of such goods in not prohibited or restricted under any law for the time being in force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Development surcharge</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. Development surcharge.- Omitted by section 6</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Income-tax</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) Subject to the provisions of sub-sections (2), (3), (4) and (5), in making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1981, income-tax shall be charged at the rates as specified in the Third Schedule.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1981,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) where the total income of an assessee, not being a company, includes any income chargeable under the head “Salaries” or any income chargeable under the head “interest on Securities”, the income-tax payable by the assessee on that part of his total income which consists of such inclusion shall be an amount bearing to the total amount of income-tax payable according to the rates applicable under the operation of the Finance Act, 1980 (XXIII of 1980) on his total income the same proportion as the amount of such inclusion bears to his total income; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) where the total income of a company includes any profits and gains from Life Insurance business, the income-tax payable by the company shall be reduced by an amount equal to 12.5 per cent of that part of its total income which consists of such inclusion.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) In making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1981, where the assessee is a co-operative society, the tax shall be payable at the rate specified in paragraph A, or clause (c) of sub-paragraph (i) of paragraph B, of the Third Schedule, whichever treatment is more beneficial to the assessee:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that in calculating for the purposes of this sub-section, the amount of income-tax at the rates specified in paragraph A of the Third Schedule, no deduction in respect of any allowance or sums referred to in the proviso to the said paragraph shall be made.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) (a) In making any assessment for the year beginning on the first day of July, 1981, where the total income of an assessee other than a company not registered in Bangladesh, includes any profits and gains derived from the export of goods out of Bangladesh, income-tax payable by him in respect of such profits and gains shall, subject to the provisions of clauses (b) and (c), be reduced by an amount computed in the manner specified hereunder:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Amount</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Where the goods exported abroad had not been manufactured by the assessee who exported them:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">30 per cent of the income-tax attributable to export sales.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">and where the export sales during the relevant year exceed the export sales of the preceding year:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">plus an additional 1 per cent for every increase of 10 per cent in export sales over those of the preceding year, subject to an overall maximum of 40 per cent.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">and where the export sales during the relevant year do not exceed the export sales of preceding year:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">minus 1 per cent for every decrease of 10 per cent in export sales from those of the preceding year, subject to an overall minimum of 20 per cent.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">where the goods exported had been manufactured by the assessee who had exported them:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)   where the export sales do not exceed 10 per cent of the total sales:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Nil.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) where the export sales exceed 10 per cent but do not exceed 20 per cent of the total sales:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">30 per cent of the income-tax attributable to export sales.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) where the export sales exceed 20 per cent but do not exceed 30 per cent of the total sales:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">40 per cent of the income-tax attributable to export sales.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) where the export sales exceed 30 per cent of the total sales:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">50 per cent of the income-tax attributable to export sales.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)   Nothing contained in clause (a) shall apply in respect of the following goods or class of goods, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)    tea;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)   raw jute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii) jute manufacture;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv)  raw hides and skin and wet-blue leather;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(v)   such other goods as may be notified by the National Board of Revenue form time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)   The National Board of Revenue may make rules providing for the computation of profits and the tax attributable to export sales and for such other matters as may be necessary to give effect to the provisions of this sub-section.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) In cases to which section 17 of the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), applies the tax chargeable shall be determined as provided in that section but with reference to the rates imposed by sub-section (1), and in accordance, where applicable, with the provisions of sub-section (2).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) For the purpose of making deduction of tax under section 18 of the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), the rates specified in the Third Schedule shall apply as respects the year beginning on the first day of July, 1981, and ending on the thirtieth day of June, 1982.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) For the purposes of this section and of the rates of tax imposed thereby, the expression “total income” means total income as determined for the purposes of income-tax in accordance with the provisions of the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Source</strong> : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
640	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE FINANCE ORDINANCE 1982</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE FINANCE ORDINANCE 1982</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XVI OF 1982).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[30th June, 1982]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to give effect to the financial proposals of the Government and to amend certain laws.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to make provisions to give effect to the financial proposals of the Government and to amend certain laws for the purpose hereinafter appearing;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 24th March, 1982, and in exercise of all powers enabling him on that behalf, the Chief Martial Law Administrator is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>commencement</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Finance Ordinance, 1982.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Except as otherwise provided in this Ordinance, this section and sections 5, 11 and 13 shall come into force at once, and other sections shall come into force on the first day of July, 1982.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Amendments of Act XI of 1922</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. The following amendments shall be made in the Income tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1)        in section 2, clause (6AA) shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2)        in section 4, in sub section (3), -</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        in clause (xii),</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) in sub clause (ff), the words “begun and” shall be omitted and shall be deemed to have been so omitted on and from the first day of July, 1980;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) in sub clause (h), the words “begun and” shall be omitted and shall be deemed to have been so omitted on and from the first day of July, 1980;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) in section 7, in sub section (1), in the third proviso, for the words “four thousand two hundred Taka”, “two thousand four hundred Taka” and one thousand eight hundred Taka” the words “six thousand Taka”, “three thousand two hundred Taka” and “two thousand four hundred Taka” shall, respectively, be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) in section 8, in the second proviso, the words “or super tax” shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) in section 9, in sub section (2), in the first proviso, in clause (b), for the words “the total income” the words “all other income excluding the notional income from the residential house” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) in section 10, in sub section (2),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        in clause (vi), in the proviso, in clause (a), for the word “prescribed” the words “necessary” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        in clause (vib), -</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         for the figure “1982” the figure “1987” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        in the third proviso, for the word “prescribed” the word “necessary” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        in clause (x), in the proviso, for the semi colon at the end a colon shall be substituted and thereafter the following new proviso shall be added, namely:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">“Provided further that any sum paid to an employee as festival bonus shall not be subjected to the conditions laid down in the first proviso;”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) in section 12B, after sub section (6), the following new sub section (7) shall be added, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(7)      Notwithstanding anything contained in sub section (1) where a capital gain arises from the sale, exchange or transfer of a capital asset being buildings or lands which within a period of two years immediately following the date on which the sale, exchange or transfer took place, is invested in the acquisition of capital asset of a new industrial undertaking, then instead of the capital gain being charged to tax as income of the previous year in which the sale, exchange or transfer took place, it shall, if the assessee so elects in writing before the assessment is made, be dealt with in accordance with the following provisions of this sub section, that is to say,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        if the amount of the capital gain is greater than the cost of the new asset,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) the difference between the amount of the capital gain and the cost of the new asset shall be charged under this section as income of the previous year, and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) for the purposes of computing in respect of the new asset any allowance under clause (vi) or clause (vii) of sub section (2) of section 10 or the amount of any capital gain arising from its sale, exchange or transfer, the cost or the written down value, as the case may be, shall be nil, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        if the amount of the capital gain is equal to or less than the cost of the new asset,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         the capital gain shall not be charged under this section, and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) for the purposes of computing in respect of the new asset any allowance under the said clause (vi) or any allowance or adjustment under the said clause(vii) or the amount of any capital gains arising from its sale, exchange or transfer, the cost or the written down value, as the case may be, shall be reduced by the amount of the capital gain:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that where in respect of the acquisition of the capital asset of a new industrial undertaking, the assessee satisfies the Deputy Commissioner of Taxes that despite the exercise of due diligence it has not been possible to acquire the new asset within the period specified in this sub section, the Deputy Commissioner of Taxes may, with the prior approval of the Inspecting Joint Commissioner of Taxes, extend the said period to such date as he considers reasonable.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(8) in section 13A, in sub section (1), for the words “twenty lakhs” the 641	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE FINANCE ORDINANCE, 1983</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">THE FINANCE ORDINANCE, 1983</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XXVII OF 1983).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[30th June, 1983]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to give effect to the financial proposals of the Government and to amend certain laws.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to make provisions to give effect to the financial proposals of the Government and to amend certain laws for the purpose hereinafter appearing;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 24th March, 1982, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the Chief Martial Law Administrator is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Short title and commencement</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Finance Ordinance, 1983.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Except as otherwise provided in this Ordinance, this section and sections 7 and 9 shall come into force at once, section 4 shall come into force on the first day of July, 1984, and other sections shall come into force on the first day of July, 1983.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of Act I of 1878</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. The following amendments shall be made in the Opium Act, 1878 (I of 1878), namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) throughout the Act, for the words “Deputy Commissioner of the District” and “Deputy Commissioner” the words “Deputy Controller” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) in section 3, after the definition of “Magistrate”, the following new definition shall be inserted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“Deputy Controller” means “the Deputy Controller of Narcotics and Liquor of the Civil Division;”.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of Ben Act V of 1909</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. The following amendments shall be made in the Excise Act, 1909 (Ben. Act V of 1909), namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) throughout the Act unless otherwise specified-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) for the words “Deputy Commissioner” the words “Deputy Controller” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the words “Commissioner of a Division” shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) in section 2,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) in clause (1), after the word “malt” the words “and from coconut water” shall be inserted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) for clause (5), the following shall be substituted, namely:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(5)      “Deputy Controller” means the Deputy Controller of Narcotics and Liquor of a Civil Division;”; (3) in section 8, in sub-section (1), the words and commas “and shall, in such matters as the Government may direct, be subject also to the control of the Commissioner of the Division” shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) in section 34,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) for sub-section (2), the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(2) The Deputy Controller shall then forthwith submit the said list, as so revised, and the said objections and opinions, and his own opinion to the Controller.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) sub-section (3) shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) in section 35, the proviso shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) in section 65, in sub-section (1), the words and comma “Deputy Collector, or” shall be omitted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendments of Act XI of 1922</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The following amendments shall be made in the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) in section 4, sub-section (3) shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) in section 10, in sub-section (2), after clause (xi), the following clause (xi a) shall be inserted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(xi a) in respect of provision for bad and doubtful debt, made by a bank, for overdue agricultural or rural loan, a sum equal to one and a half per cent of such overdue loan or the amount of actual provision for such bad or doubtful debt in the books of the assessee, whichever is the less:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that if any amount out of the amount so allowed is ultimately recovered, the same shall be deemed to be a profit of the year in which it is recovered;”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) in section 12B, in sub-section (7), for the words “a new industrial undertaking” occurring twice, the words “an industrial undertaking” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) in section 14, in sub-section (3), in clause (b), in sub-clause (ii), in the Explanation, in clause (b), for the word “it” the words and comma “plant, machinery and equipments” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) in section 15, in sub-section (3), for the words and commas “thirty per cent of the total income of the assessee, or thirty-five thousand taka, whichever is the less”, the words “one-third of the total income of the assessee” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) in section 15AA,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) in sub-section (1),-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         for the brackets and words “(including Development Loans)” the brackets and words “(including Development Loans or Bonds)” shall be substituted; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        after the word “behalf ” at the end, a comma and words “, or as is contributed by an individual in any Deposit Pension Scheme sponsored by the Government” shall be inserted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) in sub-section (3), for the brackets and words “(including Development Loans)” the brackets and words “(including Development Loans or Bonds)” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) in section 15C,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        in sub-section (1), after the words “Subject to the provisions of this section”, the words and figures “and sub-section (3) of section 15” shall be inserted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) sub-sections (2) and (2A) shall be omitted;  (c) in sub-section (3), in clause (b), after the figure “1913”, the comma and words “, and listed in a stock Exchange” shall be inserted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(8) in section 15D, in sub-section (2), for the words “twenty per cent” the words “thirty per cent” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(9) in section 15F, after the words and comma “income, profits and gains”, the commas and words “, not exceeding three thousand taka;” shall be inserted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(10) in section 16, in sub-section (1), in clause (a), after the word, figure and letters “section 15DD” the comma, word, figure and letters “, section 15DDD” shall be inserted and shall be deemed to have been so inserted on and from the first day of July, 1982;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(11) in section 18, in sub-section (3BB), for the full-stop at the end a colon shall be substituted and thereafter the following proviso shall be added with effect from the first day of July, 1983, namely:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“Provided that any person making any collection in full or in part (including collection by way of an advance) from any person on account of such purpose as may be prescribed shall also collect, on account of the tax payable by him, an amount calculated at such rate or rates and in such manner as may be prescribed, and such collections shall also be deemed to be advance payment of tax made by the assessee and shall be given credit for in his assessment.”.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of the Ben Act X of 1932</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The following amendments shall be made in the Opium Smoking Act, 1932 (Ben. Act X of 1932), namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1)        throughout the Act, for the words “Deputy Commissioner” the words “Deputy Controller” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) in section 2, for clause (5), the following shall be substituted, namely:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“(5) ‘Deputy Controller' means ‘the Deputy Controller of Narcotics and Liquor of the Civil Division.'”.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of Ben Act X of 1935</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The following amendments shall be made in the Electricity Duty Act, 1935 (Ben. Act X of 1935), namely:-     (1) for section 3, the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“3. There shall be charged, levied and paid to the Government on the units of energy consumed, a duty (hereinafter referred to as “electricity duty”) at the rate specified in the Schedule:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that electricity duty shall not be leviable on the units of energy consumed in any-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p vessel, whether sea-going or inland;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv) premises in the occupation of foreign diplomatic missions for the purposes of office and residence.”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) section 4 shall be omitted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) in the words “one hundred taka” shall be substituted;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) for the First Schedule and the Second Schedule, the following shall be substituted, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of Act I of 1944</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. In the Excises and Salt Act, 1944 (I of 1944), for the First Schedule the Schedule set out in the First Schedule to this Ordinance shall be substituted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Repeal of EP Act XI of 1957</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. Act XI of 1957), and the rules, orders or instructions made or issued thereunder shall continue to apply to the levy and collection of tax payable thereunder before the repeal of this Act and to all proceedings connected therewith as if the said Act had not been repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Amendment of Act IV of 1969</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9.
