XX OF 1983).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[17th May, 1983]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for inspection and quality control of fish and fish products.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for inspection and quality control of fish and fish products and for matters ancillary thereof;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 24th March, 1982, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the Chief Martial Law Administrator is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>commencement</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Fish and Fish Products (Inspection and Quality Control) Ordinance 1983.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force on such date as the Government may by notification in the official Gazette appoint.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “container” means any type of receptacle, package, wrapper or confining band used in packing or marketing of fish and fish products;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Fish” includes all cartilaginous and bony fishes, prawn, shrimp, amphibians, tortoise, turtles, crustacean animals, coelenterates, molluscs, echinoderms and frogs at all stages of their life history;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Fish products” includes any products or by-products of fresh fish;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)“Fresh fish” means freshly caught fish which has not been processed in any manner;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “Fish processing and fish packing plant and establishment” means any place where fish or fish</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>products is processed for export or stored for export or for internal marketing</strong>;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) “inspection” means physical examination of fish processing and packing plants with regard to hygiene and sanitation and physical, chemical and bacteriological examination of fish and fish products;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)“processing” includes cleaning, filleting, icing, packing, canning, freezing, smoking, salting, cooking, pickling, drying or preparing fish in any other manner for marketing; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)“quality control” means the technique by which conformity of a product to establish standard is assured.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Rule making powers</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make such rules as appear to it to be necessary or expedient for ensuring the quality of fish and fish products for export and of the containers thereof.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Without prejudice to the generality of the powers conferred by sub-section (1), the rules may provide for all or any of the following matters, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        prescribing grades, quality and standard of fish and fish products;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        regulation of catching, handling and marketing of fish or, as the case may be, fish products;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        processing, storing, grading, packaging, marking, transporting and inspection of fish and fish products;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)      prescribing the quality and specifications for containers of fish and fish products and the marking and inspection of such containers;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        requiring the registration of fish processing and fish packing plant and establishment for freezing, processing and preservation of fish and fish products;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         requiring the licensing of persons dealing in freezing, processing and preservation of fish and fish products;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        determining the requirements of the equipment, construction and sanitary operation of fish processing and fish packing plant and establishment and boats, vehicles and other carriers used in connection with fishing and fish processing and fish packing plant and establishment or export of fish;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        prescribing the fees for registration of fish processing and fish packing plant and establishment and for issuance of licences and inspection of laboratory analyses of fish and fish products samples;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         prohibiting the sale or offering for sale or holding in possession for sale, except in accordance with the manner and upon fulfillment of the requirements prescribed in this behalf, any fish, fish products or container under any grade, name or standard;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         prescribing the sampling procedure and the manner in which samples of any fish and fish products may be taken;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        prohibiting or restricting marketing or offering or any attempt to market or offer, without obtaining quality control certificate from the Government, of any fresh, frozen, processed or preserved fish or container thereof; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l)         manner of disposal of fish and fish products which do not conform with the prescribed standard or is otherwise considered unwholesome or unfit for human consumption.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Inspection to ensure compliance with the provisions of the Ordinance</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The Government may, for the purpose of seeing that the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules made thereunder have been complied with, appoint such person or persons to be Inspectors as it deems fit and any Inspector appointed under this sub-section or any officer empowered by the Government in this behalf may,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) at all reasonable times enter any place or premises or go on board any steamship, vessel or boat, any railway car, truck, carriage, aircraft or other vehicle used for the carriage and storage of fish and fish product and inspect the same and open any container if he believes or has reason to believe that the container contains fish and fish products and take sample of any fish or fish products for inspection free of cost; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) require and enforce production of any book, shipping bills, bills of lading or other documents or papers for inspection or for the purpose of obtaining copies thereof or extracts therefrom.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) No person shall obstruct, impede or refuse admittance, or aid or assist in the obstruction, impudence or refusal of admittance, to an Inspector or any officer empowered under sub-section (1) in the performance of his duties under that sub-section.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Export, etc of fish</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. No person shall export or sell for export or have in his possession for export, or deal in, any fish or fish products intended for human consumption which is decomposed, unwholesome or contaminated with pathogenic organisms.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Handling, etc of fish and fish product</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. No person who is suffering from leprosy, tuberculosis or such other contagious disease as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, specify, shall catch, handle, carry or, process or cause to catch, handle, carry or process fish or, as the case may be, fish products or work in fish processing and fish packing plant and establishment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Operation of fish processing and fish packing plant and establishment</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) No person shall operate any fish processing and fish packing plant or establishment without obtaining a licence to be issued in this behalf by the Government in such form as it may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) An application for granting a licence under sub-section (1) shall be made by the person concerned in such form as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Where the Government is satisfied that the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules made thereunder have been complied with, it shall grant to the applicant a licence which may contain such conditions as it may impose in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) If it is found that the applicant has not complied with the provisions of this Ordinance or the rules made thereunder, the Government may refuse to grant the licence applied for.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Appeal</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. Any person aggrieved by any order under this Ordinance may, within thirty days from the date of the order, file an appeal against the order, to the Government whose decision in the matter shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Penalty for contravention of section 4(2)</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. Any person who contravenes the provisions of sub-section (2) of section 4 shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to Taka five thousand, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Penalty for contravention of section 5 or 6</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. Any person who contravenes the provisions of section 5 or 6 shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to Taka five thousand, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Penalty for consecutive offences</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) A person who after being convicted for contravention of sub-section (2) of section 4, section 5 or section 6, or any rule made thereunder, is convicted for the second or subsequent times, he shall, for every such conviction, be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to Taka ten thousand, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In inflicting the punishment under sub-section (1), the Court may order the seizure and forfeiture to the Government of the fish processing and fish packing plant or establishment to which the contravention may relate together with the cancellation of the licence issued in respect of such processing and fish packing plant or establishment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Bar of Jurisdiction</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) No Court inferior to that of a Magistrate of the First Class shall try an offence under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) No Court shall take cognizance of an offence under this Ordinance except upon a complaint in writing made by an Inspector appointed or an officer empowered under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Indemnity</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceedings shall lie against any person for anything which is in good faith done or intended to be done in pursuance of this Ordinance or any rule made thereunder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Delegation of powers</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. The Government may, by notified order, direct that any power or duty, other than those specified in section 3 or 8 or 15, conferred or imposed by this Ordinance upon the Government, shall, in such circumstances and under such conditions, if any, as may be specified in the direction, be exercised or discharged also by any officer subordinate to the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to make rules</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Source</strong> :  Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
645	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE FISHERIES RESEARCH INSTITUTE ORDINANCE 1984</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE FISHERIES RESEARCH INSTITUTE ORDINANCE 1984</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO XLV OF 1984).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[14th July, 1984]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the establishment of a Fisheries Research Institute. WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of a Fisheries Research Institute and for matters connected therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 24th March, 1982, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"> <strong>Commencement</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Fisheries Research Institute Ordinance 1984.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force on such date as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “Board” means the Board of Governors of the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3[ (bb) “Council” means ???????? ???? ?????? ???????? established by ???????? ???? ?????? ???????? ???, ???? (???? ???? ? ?? ??? );]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Institute” means the Fisheries Research Institute established under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “Member” means a member of the Board; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules or regulations made under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Establishment of the Institute</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) There shall be an Institute to be called the Fisheries Research Institute for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Institute shall be a body corporate, having perpetual succession and a common seal, with power to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>General direction</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. Subject to the rules and regulations made under this Ordinance, the general direction, administration and supervision of the affairs of the Institute shall vest in a Board of Governors which may exercise all powers and do all acts and things that may be exercised or done by the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Certain directions, etc of Council to be given effect to</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4[ 5. Notwithstanding anything contained in this Ordinance, the Institute, or any of its functionaries shall, in relation to the affairs of the Institute, ensure that-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) any direction issued by the Council under or in pursuance of the provisions of section 8 or 14 of ???????? ???? ?????? ???????? ???, ???? (???? ???? ? ?? ??? ) is complied with; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)any recommendation or determination made, or advice given, by the Council under or in pursuance of the said provisions is given effect to:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that where, in the opinion of the Institute, it is not possible to give effect to such recommendation or advice or any part thereof,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) the Institute shall, without delay, communicate its opinion with reasons therefore to the Council; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) the Council may, after consideration of such opinion, modify or revoke its earlier recommendation or advice, or may issue fresh recommendation or advice on the same subject:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that the recommendation or advice so modified of issued afresh, as the case may be, shall be deemed to be a direction under clause (a) and shall be complied with accordingly.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5A. (1) The Board shall consist of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) Minister-in-charge of the Ministry or Division dealing with fisheries and livestock, who shall also be the Chairman of the Board, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) Two Members of Parliament nominated by the Speaker;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) Secretary of the Ministry or Division dealing with fisheries and livestock Division, who shall also be the Vice-Chairman of the Board, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) Secretary of the Finance Division of the Ministry dealing with finance, ex officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) The Chief Executive of the Council, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) Vice-Chancellor, Bangladesh Agricultural University, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) Member (Agriculture), Planning Commission, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) Director-General, Department of Fisheries, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) two persons to be nominated by the Government from among persons engaged in research activities in the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) two persons to be nominated by the Government from among persons having interest in fisheries development; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) Director-General of the Institute, who shall also be the Secretary of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Tenure of membership, resignation, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5B. (1) The members specified in clause (i) of section 5A shall hold office for a period of three years from the date of their nomination:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that such members may resign their membership in writing addressed to the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A person shall cease to be a member, if he-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) dies; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) being a member specified in clause (i) of section 5A-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) resigns his membership under the provision to sub-section (1) of this section; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) his tenure expires under sub-section (1) of this section; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii) remains absent, without permission of the Chairman, from three consecutive meetings of the Board; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) is declared by a competent Court to be of unsound mind; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) is an undischarged insolvent; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) has been, on conviction for a criminal offence involving moral turpitude, sentenced to imprisonment for a term of not less than three months or to a fine not less than five thousand taka and unless a period of two years has elapsed since his release or realisation of the fine, as the case may be, a person so sentenced shall not be eligible to be a member.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Functions of the Institute</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The functions of the Institute shall be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to carry out and co-ordinate fisheries research in Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        to assist in development of more efficient and economic methods for fish production, management, processing and marketing; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        to do such other acts or things a may be considered necessary for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Meetings of the Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) The meetings of the Board shall be held at such times and places and in such manner as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that, until so prescribed, such meetings shall be held at such times and places as may be determined by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Board, not less than five members shall be present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) All meetings of the Board shall be presided over by the Chairman and, in his absence, by the Vice-Chairman and, in the absence of both, by a member authorised in writing by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) No act or proceeding of the Board shall be invalid or be called in question merely on the ground of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Director-General</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) There shall be a Director-General of the Institute who shall be appointed by the Government for such period and on such terms and conditions as may be determined by it.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Director-General shall be a whole time officer and the Chief executive of the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, the Director-General shall be responsible for the efficient management of the affairs and business of the Institute and for the proper execution of the decisions of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Director-General shall perform such other functions as may be assigned to him by the Board or as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) If a vacancy occurs in the office of the Director-General or if the Director-General is unable to discharge the functions of his office on account of absence, illness or any other cause, the Government shall make such arrangement for discharging the functions of the Director-General as it may consider expedient.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Appointment of officers, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. Subject to the approval of the Government, the Institute may appoint such officers and other employees as it considers necessary for the efficient performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Committees</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. The Board may appoint such committees as it may consider necessary to assist it in the performance of its functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Delegation of powers</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. The Board may, by general or special order in writing, direct that such of its powers shall, in such circumstances and under such conditions, if any, as may be specified in the order, be exercisable also by the Chairman or the Director or by such other member or by such officer of the Institute as may be so specified:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no power to make regulations under section 19 shall be delegated under this section.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Funds of the Institute</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) The funds of the Institute shall comprise –</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        grants made by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        grants from the local authorities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        loans obtained from the Government or, with the prior approval of the Government, from the local authorities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        sale proceeds and royalties accruing from the property owned by the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        receipts from any other source.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The funds of the Institute shall be kept in a nationalised commercial bank or in such other scheduled bank as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Budget of the Institute</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. The Institute shall, by such date in each year as may be specified by the Government, submit to the Government for approval a budget for each financial year showing the estimated receipts and expenditures and the sums which are likely to be required from the Government during that financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Audit and accounts</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) The Institute shall maintain its accounts in such manner and form as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The accounts of the Institute shall be audited by the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh, hereinafter in this section referred to as the Auditor-General, in such manner as he deems fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) For the purpose of an audit under sub-section (2), The Auditor-General or any person authorised by him in this behalf shall have access to all records, books, documents, cash, securities, stores and other property of the Institute and may examine the Chairman or any member or any officer or employee of the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Auditor-General shall, as soon as possible after completion of the audit, send to the Board his audit report and the Board shall forward it with its comments thereon to the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Institute shall take steps forthwith to remedy any defect or irregularity pointed out in the audit report.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Submission of annual report, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) The Institute shall, as soon as possible after the end of every financial year, submit to the Government an annual report on the conduct of its affairs for that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may require the Institute to furnish any report, return, statement, estimate, statistics or other information regarding any matter under the control of the Institute and the Institute shall comply with every such requisition.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Certain research stations to cease to exist, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any regulation, resolution, agreement, contract or other instrument, on the commencement of this Ordinance-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the Fisheries Research Station, Chandpur, the Freshwater Aquaculture Research Station, Mymensingh, the Marine Fisheries and Fisheries Technological Research Station, Chittagong, the Mariculture and Coastal Aquaculture Research Station, Cox's Bazar, hereinafter referred to as the said research stations, shall cease to exist;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) such assets and properties, movable or immovable, used by or for the purposes of the said research stations as are specified by the Government by order in writing shall, unless otherwise directed by the Government, stand transferred to, and vest in, the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) such officers and other employees in the said research stations as are specified by the Government by order in writing shall stand transferred to the Institute and shall serve the Institute on the same terms and conditions as were applicable to them immediately before such transfer:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Institute may, with the approval of the Government, alter such terms and conditions:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that if the terms and conditions so altered are disadvantageous to any officer or employee, such officer or employee may opt to revert to his original post or service.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may, for the purpose of removing any difficulty in relation to the transfer and other matter specified in sub-section (1), make such orders as it may consider expedient and any such order shall be deemed to be given effect to as part of the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Indemnity</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceedings shall lie against the Board, the Chairman, the Director or any member or any officer or employee of the Institute for anything done or intended to be done in good faith under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to make rules</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to make regulation</strong>s</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. (1) The Board may make regulations, not inconsistent with this Ordinance or rules made thereunder, to provide for all matters for which provision is necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All regulations made under this section shall be published in the official Gazette and shall come into force on such publication.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Throughout this Ordinance the word “Director-General” was substituted for the word “Director” by section 6 of the Bangladesh Fisheries Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. X of 1996)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The words “and commencement” were added by section 2 of the Bangladesh Fisheries Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. X of 1996).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 Clause (bb) was inserted by section 3 of the Bangladesh Fisheries Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. X of 1996).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 Sections 5, 5A and 5B were substituted for former section 5 by section 4 of the Bangladesh Fisheries Research Institute (Amendment) Act, 1996 (Act No. X of 1996</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Source</strong> : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
646	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE FOREIGN CONTRIBUTIONS (REGULATION) ORDINANCE 1982</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE FOREIGN CONTRIBUTIONS (REGULATION) ORDINANCE 1982</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XXXI OF 1982).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[8th September 1982]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to regulate receipt of foreign contributions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to regulate receipt of foreign contributions;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 24th March, 1982, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the Chief Martial Law Administrator is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Foreign Contributions (Regulation) Ordinance, 1982.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Ordinance to override all other laws</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. The provisions of this Ordinance shall have effect notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any contract or agreement.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definition</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, “foreign contribution” means any donation, grant or assistance, whether in cash or in kind, including a ticket for journey abroad, made by any Government, organisation or citizen of foreign state.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Receipt of foreign contribution without permission prohibited</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) No citizen of or organisation in, Bangladesh shall receive any foreign contribution without the prior permission of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) No Government, organisation or citizen of a foreign state shall make any donation, grant or assistance, whether in cash or in kind, including a ticket for journey abroad, to any citizen of, or organisation in, Bangladesh without the prior permission of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Nothing in this section shall apply to an organisation established by or under any law or the authority of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Penalty, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) Whoever receives or makes any foreign contribution in contravention of the provisions of section 4 shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine not exceeding two times the amount or value of the contribution, or with both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) No Court shall take cognizance of an offence under this Ordinance except on a complaint made by the Government or any officer authorised by it in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Source</strong> :  Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
647	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">   THE FOREIGN VOLUNTARY ORGANISATIONS (ACQUISITION OF IMMOVABLE PROPERTY) REGULATION ORDINANCE 1983</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE FOREIGN VOLUNTARY ORGANISATIONS (ACQUISITION OF IMMOVABLE PROPERTY) REGULATION ORDINANCE 1983</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. LXXIII OF 1983).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[22nd December, 1983]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to regulate the acquisition of immovable property by foreign voluntary organisations.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to regulate the acquisition of immovable property by foreign voluntary organisations;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 24th March, 1982, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Foreign Voluntary Organisations (Acquisition of Immovable Property) Regulation Ordinance 1983.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Ordinance to override all other laws</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. The provisions of this Ordinance shall have effect notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any contract or agreement.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Acquisition of immovable property by foreign voluntary organisation</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) No foreign voluntary organisation shall purchase or acquire in any other manner any immovable property in Bangladesh without the previous permission of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any immovable property acquired by any foreign voluntary organisation in violation of the provision of this section shall be liable to be forfeited to the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Explanation</strong>: In this section, “foreign voluntary organisation” means any organisation, body or authority, whether incorporated or not, constituted or established in any country outside Bangladesh for the purpose of doing any voluntary work, or rendering any voluntary service to any individual, organisation, body or authority, in Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to make rules</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Source</strong> : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
648	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">  THE GHOUSUL AZAM ABDUL QADER JILLANI MOSQUE TRUST (REPEAL) ORDINANCE, 1985</h2>

XVII OF 1985).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[30th March, 1985]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to repeal the Ghousul Azam Abdul Qader Jillani Mosque Trust Ordinance, 1984.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to repeal the Ghousul Azam Abdul Qader Jillani Mosque Trust Ordinance, 1984 (XLVI of 1984);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 24th March, 1982, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Short title</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1.
