651	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">   THE GROUND WATER MANAGEMENT ORDINANCE, 1985</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">THE GROUND WATER MANAGEMENT ORDINANCE, 1985</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XXVII OF 1985).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[9th June, 1985]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to manage the ground water resources for agricultural production.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to manage the ground water resources for agricultural production and for matters connected therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 24th March, 1982, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Short title and commencement</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1.         (1) This Ordinance may be called the Ground Water Management Ordinance, 1985.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force on such date as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Definitions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2.         In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “aquifer” means a body of saturated soil at any depth below ground level that can store and transmit sufficient quantity of water to the wells;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Upazila Parishad;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “Committee” means an Upazila Irrigation Committee;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “deep tube well” means a tube well called as such operated by a submersible pump set or turbine pump coupled with a prime mover capable of pumping ground water when the pumped water level depth is more than 7 metres;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        “deep set hand-pumped tube well” means a hand-pumped well used for either irrigation or water supply where the pump valve is set below the surface and operated remotely by a pump rod operated from the surface and is capable of pumping ground water when the pumped water level depth is more than 8 metres;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         “drawdown” means the difference in ground water level between static water level and pumped water level;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        “pumped water level” means the depth from ground level to the saturated water level measured in a well when the well is pumping;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         “shallow tube well” means a tube well called as such operated by a centrifugal pump coupled with a prime mover but only capable of pumping water when the vertical distance between the centrifugal pump and the pumped water level depth is within 7 metres;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         “static water level” means the depth from ground level to the saturated water level beneath the ground surface where no pumping has taken place;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        “suction lift hand-pumped tube well” means hand-pumped well used for either irrigation or potable water supply when the pump valves are situated above ground level but is only capable of operation when the vertical distance between the pump valve and the pumped water level depth is within 8 metres;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l)         “tube well” means a deep tube well, shallow tube well, suction lift hand-pumped well or deep set hand-pumped well used for irrigation or water supply;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m)       “Upazila Irrigation Committee” means a Upazila Irrigation Committee constituted under section 4 and includes a Thana Irrigation Committee in a Thana which has not been declared a Upazila;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n)        “Upazila Parishad” means a Upazila Parishad constituted under the Local Government (Upazila Parishad and Upazila Administration Reorganisation) Ordinance, 1982 (LIX of 1982), and includes a Thana Parishad in a Thana which has not been declared a Upazila.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Effect of laws, etc inconsistent with the Ordinance</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3.         The provisions of this Ordinance and the rules made thereunder shall have effect notwithstanding anything inconsistent therewith contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any rule, regulation, bye-law, or in any other instrument.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Upazila Irrigation Committee</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4.         There shall be constituted, in the prescribed manner, a Upazila Irrigation Committee in each Upazila for the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Licence for tube well</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5.         (1) No tube well shall be installed in any place without a licence granted by the Upazila Parishad.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) An application for licence for installation of a tube well shall be made to the Upazila Parishad in such form as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) No application shall be entertained by the Upazila Parishad unless it is accompanied by such fee as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) On receipt of an application for licence, the Upazila Parishad shall direct the Committee to hold a local enquiry and submit a report on the following points, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the aquifer condition of the soil where the tube well is to be installed;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the distance of the nearest existing tube well;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the area likely to be benefited by the tube well;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        the likely effect on the existing tube wells including tube wells used for domestic purpose;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        the suitability of the site for installation of the tube well; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         the conditions on which a licence, if any, may be granted.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) If, on consideration of the report of the Committee, the Upazila Parishad is satisfied that the installation of tube well applied for-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        will be beneficial to the areas for which it is to be installed, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        will not have any adverse effect upon the surrounding area, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        is otherwise feasible,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">it may grant the licence applied for.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) A licence granted under sub-section (5) shall be in such form as may be prescribed and shall be subject to such conditions as may be specified therein.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) Any person aggrieved by the decision of the Upazila Parishad may file an application to such authority as may be prescribed for review of the decision and the decision of that authority on such review shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Licence of existing tube wells</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. Notwithstanding anything contained in this Ordinance, a tube well in existence on the day of commencement of this Ordinance shall not operate after six months from such commencement unless a licence is obtained in the meantime from the Upazila Parishad on payment of the prescribed fee:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no enquiry by the Committee shall be necessary for granting a licence under this section.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Suspension and revocation of licence</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) The Committee may, if it is satisfied that the conditions of a licence are being violated, by order in writing specifying the reasons therefore, suspend the licence of a tube well and report the matter forthwith to the Upazila Parishad.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Upazila Parishad may confirm the order of suspension of a licence if it is satisfied that there are good reasons for suspension of the licence:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Upazila Parishad shall not confirm the suspension of a licence unless the licensee is given a reasonable opportunity of being heard:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that, if an order of suspension is not confirmed within fifteen days from the date of making of the order of suspension, the order of suspension shall be deemed to have been vacated on the expiry of that period.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) An order of suspension confirmed by the Upazila Parishad shall remain valid for a period of forty five days.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Any person aggrieved by an order of suspension confirmed by the Upazila Parishad may make an application to such authority as may be prescribed for review of the order and the decision of that authority on such review shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Cancellation of licence</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) A licence granted under this Ordinance may be cancelled by the Upazila Parishad if, on a report from the Committee, it is satisfied that,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the licensee has violated the terms and conditions of the licence; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the licence was suspended for more than three times during one year preceding the order:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no licence shall be cancelled unless the licensee is given a reasonable opportunity of being heard.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Supply of tube wells by Corporation, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, neither the Bangladesh Agricultural Development Corporation established under the Agricultural Development Corporation Ordinance, 1961 (E.P. Ord. XXXVII of 1961), nor any other authority or person dealing with tube wells shall supply tube wells to any person unless he has a licence for installation of a tube well granted under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Offences</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. Whoever contravenes any provision of this Ordinance or rules made thereafter shall be punishable with fine which may extend to two thousand taka.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Cognizance of offence</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. No Court shall take cognizance of an offence under this Ordinance except on a complaint made in writing by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to exempt</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, exempt any project or any area specified in the notification from the operation of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source  :  Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
652	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE HAOR DEVELOPMENT BOARD (DISSOLUTION) ORDINANCE 1982</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE HAOR DEVELOPMENT BOARD (DISSOLUTION) ORDINANCE, 1982</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XXXVII OF 1982).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[21st September, 1982]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to make provision for the dissolution of the Haor Development Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to make provision for the dissolution of the Haor Development Board and for matters connected therewith or incidental thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 24th March, 1982, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the Chief Martial Law Administrator is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>commencement</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Haor Development Board (Dissolution) Ordinance, 1982.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force on the 1st October, 1982.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Divisional Development Board” means any of the following Boards namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         the Khulna Division Development Board established under the Khulna Division Development Board Ordinance, 1976 (Ord. LXXV of 1976);</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        the Rajshahi Division Development Board established under the Rajshahi Division Development Board Ordinance, 1976 (Ord. LXXX of 1976);</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       the Dacca Division Development Board established under the Dacca Division Development Board Ordinance, 1976 (Ord. LXXXI of 1976);</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv)       the Chittagong Division Development Board established under the Chittagong Division Development Board Ordinance, 1976 (Ord. LXXXIX of 1976);</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “undertaking” includes any project, scheme, asset, right, power, authority and privilege and any property movable and immovable, including any land, building, work, machinery, cash or bank balance, reserve fund, investment, and any other right and interest in, or arising out of, such property and any book of accounts, register, record and any other document of whatever nature relating thereto.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Dissolution of the Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in any law, rule, regulation, agreement or contract for the time being in force, on the commencement of this Ordinance,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the Haor Development Board established under section 3 of the Haor Development Board Ordinance, 1977 (Ord. IX of 1977), hereinafter referred to as the said Board, shall stand dissolved;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the undertakings of the said Board shall be transferred to such Divisional Development Boards as the Government may direct;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        all debts, liabilities and obligations incurred, all contracts entered into, and all matters and things engaged to be done by, with or for, the said Board arising out of, connected with or incidental to, any undertaking before the commencement of this Ordinance shall be deemed to have been incurred, entered into or engaged to be done by, with or for, the Divisional Development Board to which the undertaking has been transferred under clause (b);</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        all suits and other legal proceedings instituted by or against the said Board arising out of, connected with or incidental to, any undertaking before the commencement of this Ordinance, shall be deemed to be suits and other legal proceedings by or against the Divisional Development Board to which the undertaking has been transferred; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        the Haor Development Board Ordinance, 1977 (Ord. IX of 1977), shall stand repealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
653	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE HINDU RELIGIOUS WELFARE TRUST ORDINANCE 1983</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE HINDU RELIGIOUS WELFARE TRUST ORDINANCE 1983</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. LXVIII OF 1983).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[20th December, 1983]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the establishment of a Hindu Religious Welfare Trust.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of a Hindu Religious Welfare Trust and for matters incidental and ancillary thereof;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 24th March, 1982, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>commencement</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Hindu Religious Welfare Trust Ordinance 1983.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force on such date as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “Board” means the Board of Trustees constituted under section 5;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules or regulations made under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “Trust” means the Hindu Religious Welfare Trust established under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “Trustee” means a Trustee of the Board; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) “Vice-Chairman” means the Vice-Chairman of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Establishment of the Trust</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) There shall be established a Trust to be called the Hindu Religious Welfare Trust for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Trust shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession and a common seal, with power to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Head Office of the Trust shall be at such place as the Government may by notification in the official Gazette, specify.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>General Direction</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. Subject to rules and regulations made under this Ordinance, the general direction and administration of the affairs of the Trust shall vest in a Board of Trustees which may exercise all powers and do all acts and things which may be exercised or done by the Trust.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. 1[ (1)] The Board shall consist of the following Trustees, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) Minister, Religious Affairs Division, who shall also be the Chairman of the Board; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) 2[ twenty-one] Trustees to be appointed by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government shall appoint one of the Trustees to be the Vice-Chairman of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Trustees appointed by the Government shall hold office for a period of three years.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Government may at any time terminate the appointment of a Trustee without assigning any reason.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) An appointed Trustee may at any time resign his office in writing addressed to the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Meetings of the Board</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) The meetings of the Board shall be held at such times and places and in such manner as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that, until so prescribed, such meetings shall be held at such times and places as may be determined by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Board, not less than four Trustees shall be present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) All meetings of the Board shall be presided over by the Chairman and, in his absence, by the Vice-Chairman and, in the absence of both, by any other Trustee authorised by the Chairman in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) At a meeting of the Board, each Trustee shall have one vote and, in the event of equality of votes, the person presiding shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) No act or proceeding of the Board shall be invalid or be called in question merely on the ground of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Functions of the Trust</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) The functions of the Trust shall generally be to provide for the religious welfare of the Hindu community.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing provisions, the Trust may,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        provide financial assistance for the maintenance and administration of places of Hindu religious worship;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        adopt measures for the maintenance of sanctity of places of Hindu religious worship;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        do such other acts and things as may be considered necessary for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Appointment of officers, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) There shall be a Secretary of the Trust who shall be appointed by the Board on such terms and conditions as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Trust may appoint such other officers and employees as it considers necessary for the efficient performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Secretary and other officers and employees of the Trust shall exercise such powers and perform such functions as may be prescribed or assigned to them by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Delegation of powers</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. The Board may, by general or special order in writing, direct that such of its powers shall, in such circumstances and under such conditions, if any, as may be specified in the order, be exercisable also by the Chairman, or by such other Trustee or by an officer of the Board as may be so specified.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Funds of the Trust</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) The Trust shall have its own fund which shall be utilised by it to meet the charges in connection with its functions under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government shall make a fixed deposit of 3[ nine crore Taka] with a scheduled bank and the interest accruing therefrom from time to time shall be transferred to the fund of the Trust as grant of the Government</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 Provided that, the Government may from time to time increase the amount of the fixed deposit.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The fund shall consist of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        interest accrued from the fixed deposit made by the Government under sub-section (2);</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) donations and endowments;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) receipts from such other sources as may be approved by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) All moneys of the Trust shall be kept in any scheduled bank.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The bank account of the Trust shall be operated by such Trustee or officer as the Board may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Audit and accounts</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) The Board shall keep proper account of all moneys received and expended by the Trust.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The account of the Trust shall be audited by the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Submission of reports, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) The Trust shall submit to the Government an annual report on the conduct of its affairs.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may require the Trust to furnish any report, statement or information regarding its affairs or in respect of any matter under its control and the Trust shall comply with such requisition.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to make rules</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to make Regulations</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. The Trust may, with the previous approval of the Government, make regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules made thereunder, to provide for all matters for which provision is necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. The brackets and figure “(1)” were inserted by section 2 of the Hindu Religious Welfare Trust (Amendment) Ordinance, 1986 (Ordinance No. VII of 1986)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. The word “twenty-one” was substituted for the word “fourteen” by section 2 of the Hindu Religious Welfare Trust (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. V of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. The words “nine crore Taka” were substituted for the words “two crore taka” by section 2 of the Hindu Religious Welfare Trust (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. LI of 2001)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. <strong>The colon</strong> (:) was substituted for the full-stop (.) and thereafter the proviso was added by section 2 of the Hindu Religious Welfare Trust (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. LI of 2001)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Source</strong> :  Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
654	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE INCOME-TAX ORDINANCE, 1984</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">THE INCOME-TAX ORDINANCE, 1984</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XXXVI OF 1984).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[4th June, 1984]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to consolidate and amend the law relating to Income-tax.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to consolidate and amend the law relating to income-tax;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 24th March, 1982, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in this behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">CHAPTER I</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">PRELIMINARY</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Short title and commencement</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Income-tax Ordinance, 1984.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force on the first day of July, 1984.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Definitions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) “agricultural income” means-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) any income derived from any land in Bangladesh and used for agricultural purposes-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) by means of agriculture; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) by the performance of any process ordinarily employed by a cultivator to render marketable the produce of such land; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii) by the sale of the produce of the land raised by the cultivator in respect of which no process, other than that to render the produce marketable, has been performed; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv) by granting a right to any person to use the land for any period; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) any income derived from any building which-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) is occupied by the cultivator of any such land as is referred to in sub-clause (a) in which any process is carried on to render marketable any such produce as aforesaid;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) is on, or in the immediate vicinity of, such land; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii) is required by the cultivator as the dwelling house or store-house or other out-house by reason of his connection with such land;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) “amalgamation”, in relation to companies, means the merger of one or more companies with another company, or the merger of two or more companies to form one company (the company or companies which so merged being referred to as the amalgamating company or companies and the company with which they merge or which is formed as a result of the merger as the amalgamated company) in such a manner that by virtue of, and for reasons attributable to, the merger,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) all the property of the amalgamating company or companies immediately before the merger becomes the property of the amalgamated company;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) all the liabilities of the amalgamating company or companies immediately before the merger become the liabilities of the amalgamated company; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) the shareholders holding not less than nine-tenths in value of the shares in the amalgamating company or companies (other than shares already held therein immediately before the merger by, or by a nominee for, the amalgamated company or its subsidiary) become shareholders of the amalgamated company;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) “annual value” shall be deemed to be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) in relation to any property let out,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) (i) the sum for which property might reasonably be expected to let from year to year 1[ ***] 2[ and any amount received by letting out furniture, fixture, fittings etc; or]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) where the annual rent in respect thereof is in excess of the sum referred to in paragraph (i), the amount of the annual rent;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) “Appellate Joint Commissioner” means a person appointed to be an Appellate Joint Commissioner of Taxes under section 3 4[ , and includes a 5[ an Appellate Additional Commissioner of Taxes]] 6[ and also a person appointed to hold current charge of an Appellate Joint Commissioner of Taxes];</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) “Appellate Tribunal” means the Taxes Appellate Tribunal established under section 11;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7[ (5A) “approved gratuity fund” means a gratuity fund which has been and continues to be approved by the Board in accordance with the provisions of Part C of the First Schedule;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) “Approved superannuation fund” means a superannuation fund 8[ or a pension fund] which has been and continues to be approved by the Board in accordance with the provisions of Part A of the First Schedule;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) “Assessee”, means a person by whom any tax or other sum of money is payable under this Ordinance, and includes-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) every person in respect of whom any proceeding under this Ordinance has been taken for the assessment of his income or the income of any other person in respect of which he is assessable, or of the amount of refund due to him or to such other person;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) every person who is required to file a return under section 75, section 89 or section 91;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) every person who desires to be assessed and submits his return of income under this Ordinance; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) every person who is deemed to be an assessee, or an assessee in default, under any provision of this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(8) “assessment”, with its grammatical variations and cognate expressions, includes re-assessment and additional or further assessment;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(9) “assessment year” means the period of twelve months commencing on the first day of July every year; and includes any such period which is deemed, under the provisions of this Ordinance, to be assessment year in respect of any income for any period;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(10) “Assistant Commissioner of Taxes” means a person appointed to be an Assistant Commissioner of Taxes under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(11) “Bangladeshi company” means a company formed and registered under the Companies Act, 1913 (VII of 1913) 9[ or ???????? ???, ???? (???? ???? ?? ?? ???), and includes a body corporate] established or constituted by or under any law for the time being in force in Bangladesh having in either case its registered office in Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(12) “Banking company” has the same meaning as in 10[ ??????-???????? ???, ???? (???? ???? ?? ?? ???)], and includes any body corporate established or constituted by or under any law for the time being in force which transacts the business of banking in Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(13) “Board” means the National Board of Revenue constituted under the National Board of Revenue Order, 1972 (P. O. No. 76 of 1972);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(14) “business” includes any trade, commerce or manufacture or any adventure or concern in the nature of trade, commerce or manufacture;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(15) “capital asset” means property of any kind held by an assessee, whether or not connected with his business or profession, but does not include-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) any stock-in-trade (not being stocks and shares), consumable stores or raw materials held for the purposes of his business or profession;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) personal effects, that is to say, movable property (including wearing apparel, jewellery, furniture, fixture, equipment and vehicles), which are held exclusively for personal use by, and are not used for purposes of the business or profession of the assessee or any member of his family dependent on him; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) agricultural land in Bangladesh, not being land situate-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) in any area which is comprised within the jurisdiction of municipality (whether known as a municipality, municipal corporation, town, or by any other name) or a cantonment Board and which has a population of not less than ten thousand according to the last preceding census of which the relevant figures have been published before the first day of the income year; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) in any area within such distance not being more than five miles from the local limits of any municipality or cantonment board referred to in paragraph (i), as the Government may having regard to the extent of, and scope for, urbanisation of that area and other relevant considerations, specify in this behalf by notification in the official Gazette;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(16) “charitable purpose” includes relief of the poor, education, medical relief and the advancement of any object of general public utility;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(17) “chartered accountant” means a chartered accountant as defined in the Bangladesh Chartered Accountants Order, 1973 (P.O. No. 2 of 1973);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(18) “child”, in relation to any individual, includes a step-child and an adopted child of that individual;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11[ (19) “Commissioner” means a person appointed to be a Commissioner of Taxes or Commissioner (Large Taxpayer Unit) under section 3, or a person appointed to hold current charge of a Commissioner of Taxes or Commissioner (Large Taxpayer Unit);]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12[ (19A) “Commissioner (Appeals)” means a person appointed to be a 13[ Commissioner of Taxes (Appeals) under section 3 and includes a person appointed to hold current charge of a Commissioner of Taxes (Appeal)];</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(20) “Company” means a company as defined in 15[ the Companies Act, 1913 (VII of 1913) or ???????? ???, ???? (???? ???? ?? ?? ???)] and includes-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) a body corporate established or constituted by or under any law for the time being in force;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) any nationalised banking or other financial institution, insurance body and industrial or business enterprise; 16[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17[ 18[ (bb) an association or combination of persons, called by whatever name, if any of such persons is a company as defined in 19[ the Companies Act, 1913 (VII of 1913) or ???????? ???, ???? (???? ???? ?? ?? ???)];</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(bbb) any association or body incorporated by or under the laws of a country outside Bangladesh; and]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) any foreign association or body, 20[ not incorporated by or under any law], which the Board may, by general or special order, declare to be a company for the purposes of this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(21) “co-operative society” means a co-operative society registered under the Co-operative Societies Act, 1940 (Beng. Act XXI of 1940), or under any other law for the time being in force governing the registration of co-operative societies;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(22) “cost and management accountant” means a cost and management accountant as defined in the Cost and Management Accountants Ordinance, 1977 (LIII of 1977);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(23) “Deputy Commissioner of Taxes” means a person appointed to be a Deputy Commissioner of Taxes under section 3, and includes a person appointed to be an Assistant Commissioner of Taxes, an Extra Assistant Commissioner of Taxes and a Tax Recovery Officer;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(24) “director” and “manager” in relation to a company have the meanings assigned to them in 21[ the Companies Act, 1913 (VII of 1913) or ???????? ???, ???? (???? ???? ?? ?? ???)];</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">22[ (25) “Director-General of Inspection” means a person appointed to be a Director-General of Inspection (Taxes) under section 3, and except for the purpose of section 117, includes a person appointed for the purpose of this Ordinance to be an Additional Director-General of Inspection (Taxes), a Deputy Director-General of Inspection (Taxes), or an Assistant Director-General of Inspection (Taxes);]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">23[ (25A) “Director General (Training)” means a person appointed to be Director General (Training);]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">24[ (25AA) “Director General, Central Intelligence Cell” means of persons appointed to be Director General, Central Intelligence Cell 25[ or 26[ any Additional Director General, Central Intelligence Cell or] any Joint Director General, Central Intelligence Cell or Deputy Director General, Central Intelligence Cell authorised by him]];</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(26) “dividend” includes-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) any distribution by a company of accumulated profits, whether capitalised or not, if such distribution entails the release by the company to its shareholders of all or any part of its assets or reserves;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) any distribution by a company, to the extent to which the company possesses accumulated profits, whether capitalised or not, to its shareholders of debentures, debenture-stock or deposit certificates in any form, whether with or without interest;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) any distribution made to the shareholders of a company on its liquidation to the extent to which the distribution is attributable to the accumulated profits of the company immediately before its liquidation, whether capitalised or not;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) any distribution by a company to its shareholders on the reduction of its capital, to the extent to which the company possesses accumulated profits, whether such accumulated profits have been capitalised or not;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">27[ (dd) any profit remitted outside Bangladesh by a company not incorporated in Bangladesh under ???????? ???, ???? (???? ???? ?? ?? ???)];</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) any payment by a private company of any sum (whether as representing a part of the assets of the company or otherwise) by way of advance or loan to a shareholder or any payment by any such company on behalf, or for the individual benefit, of any such shareholder, to the extent to which the company, in either case, possesses accumulated profit;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">but does not include-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) a distribution made in accordance with sub-clause (c) or sub-clause (d) in respect of any share including preference share for full cash consideration, or redemption of debentures or debenture-stock, where the holder of the share or debenture is not entitled in the event of liquidation to participate in the surplus assets;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) any advance or loan made to a shareholder in the ordinary course of its business, where the lending of money is a substantial part of the business of the company;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii) any dividend paid by a company which is set off by the company against the whole or any part of any sum previously paid by it and treated as dividend within the meaning of sub-clause (e) to the extent to which it is so set off;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">28[ (iiia) any bonus share issued by a company;] 29[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation.- The expression “accumulated profits”,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) wherever it occurs in this clause, includes any reserve made up wholly or partly of any allowance, deduction or exemption admissible under this Ordinance or under the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), but does not include capital gains arising before the first day of April, 1946, or after the thirty-first day of March, 1949, and before the eighth day of June, 1963;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) as used in sub-clauses (a), (b) and (d), includes all profits of the company up to the date of such distribution; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) as used in sub-clause (c), includes all profits of the company up to the date of its liquidation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(27) “employer” includes a former employer;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(28) “employee”, in relation to a company, includes the managing director, or any other director or other person, who, irrespective of his designation, performs any duties or functions in connection with the management of the affairs of the company;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(29) “Extra Assistant Commissioner of Taxes” means a person appointed to be an Extra Assistant Commissioner of Taxes under section 3 30[ and includes a person appointed to hold current charge of an Extra Assistant Commissioner of Taxes];</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: on sale in the open market on the relevant day, and, where such price is not ascertainable, the price which the Deputy Commissioner of Taxes may, with the approval in writing of the Inspecting Joint Commissioner, determine;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the residual value received from the lessee in case of an asset leased by a financial institution having license from the Bangladesh Bank on termination of lease agreement on maturity or otherwise subject to the condition that such residual value plus amount realised during the currency of the lease agreement towards the cost of the asset is not less than the cost of acquisition to the lessor financial institution.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(31) “fees for technical services” means any consideration (including any lump sum consideration) for the rendering of any managerial, technical or consultancy services (including the provision of services of technical or other personnel) but does not include consideration for any construction, assembly, mining or like project undertaken by the recipient, or consideration which would be income of the recipient classifiable under the head “Salaries”;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(32) “firm” has the same meaning as assigned to it in the Partnership Act, 1932 (IX of 1932);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(33) “foreign company” means a company which is not a Bangladeshi company;</p><p style="text-align: income, profits or gains;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) the profits and gains of any business of insurance carried on by a mutual insurance association arising or received, or deemed to accrue or arise or be received in Bangladesh under any provision of this Ordinance 32[ :</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: (???? ???? ?? ?? ???)]; to its shareholders with a view to increase its paid-up share capital shall not be included as income of that share-holder.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">33[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(35) “income year”, in respect of any separate source of income, means-</p><p year; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) where the accounts or the assessee have been made up to a date within the said financial year and the assessee so opts, ending or that date; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) in the case of a business or profession newly set up in the twelve months immediately preceding the said financial year-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) if the accounts of the assessee have been made up to a date within the said financial year and the period from the date of the setting up of the business or profession to the first-mentioned date does not exceed twelve months, then, at the option of the assessee, such period, or</p><p or profession and ending with the last day of that period, as the case may be; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) in the case of any person or class of persons or any business or profession or class of business or profession such period as may be determined by the Board or by such authority as the Board may authorise in this behalf;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) in respect of the assessee's share in the income of a firm of which the assessee is a partner and the firm has been assessed as such, the period determined as the income year for the assessment of income of the firm;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) where in respect of a particular source of income an assessee has once been assessed or where in respect of a business or profession newly set up, an assessee has once exercised the option under sub-clause (b) or sub-clause (c) (ii) or sub-clause (d) (i) then, he shall not, in respect of that source, or, as the case may be, business or profession, be entitled to vary the meaning of the expression “income year” as then applicable to him, except with the consent of the Deputy Commissioner of Taxes upon such conditions as the Deputy Commissioner of Taxes may think fit to impose;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(36) “Inspecting Joint Commissioner” means a person appointed to be an Inspecting Joint Commissioner of Taxes under section 3 34[ , and includes 35[ an Inspecting by an employer in the form of cash or in any other form excluding basic salary, festival bonus, incentive bonus not exceeding ten per cent of disclosed profit of relevant income year, arrear salary, fund;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(46) “person” includes an individual, a firm, an association of persons, a Hindu undivided family, a local authority, a company and every other artificial juridical person;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(47) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Ordinance;</p><p any person connected with the management or the administration of the local authority, company, body or association upon whom the Deputy Commissioner of Taxes has served a notice of his intention to treat him as principal officer thereof;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(49) “profession” includes a vocation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p assessee from his employer at, or in connection with, the termination of, or the modification of any terms and conditions relating to, his employment; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) any payment due to, or received by, an assessee from a provident or other fund to the extent to which it does not consist of contributions by the assessee and the interest on such contributions;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(51) “public servant” has the same meaning as in section 21 of the Penal Code (Act No. XLV of 1860);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(52) “recognised provident fund” means a provident fund which has been, and continues to be, recognised by the Commissioner in accordance with the provisions of Part B of the First Schedule;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">38[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(54) “relative”, in relation to an individual, means the husband, wife, brother, sister or any lineal ascendant or descendant of that individual;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(55) “resident”, in respect of any income year, means-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) an individual who has been in Bangladesh-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) for a period of, or for periods amounting in all to, one hundred and eighty-two days or more in that year; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) for a period of, or periods amounting in all to, ninety days or more in that year having previously been in Bangladesh for a period of, or periods amounting in all to, three hundred and sixty-five days or more during four years preceding that year;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) a Hindu undivided family, firm or other association of persons, the control and management of whose affairs is situated wholly or partly in Bangladesh in that year; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) a Bangladeshi company or any other company the control and management of whose affairs is situated wholly in Bangladesh in that year;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(56) “royalty” means consideration (including any lump sum consideration but excluding any consideration which is classifiable as income of the recipient under the head “Capital gains”) for-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) transfer of all or any rights, including the granting of a licence, in respect of a patent, invention, model, design, mark or similar property;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the imparting of any information concerning the working of, or the use of, a patent, invention, model, design, secret process or formula, or trade mark or similar property;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) the use of any patent, invention, model, design, secret process or formula, or trade mark or similar property;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) the imparting of any information concerning technical, industrial, commercial, or scientific knowledge, experience or skill;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) the transfer of all or any rights, including granting of a licence, in respect of any copyright, literacy, artistic or scientific work, including films or video tapes for use in connection with television or tapes for use in connection with radio broadcasting, but not including consideration for sale, distribution or exhibition of cinematograph films; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) the rendering of any services in connection with any of the aforesaid activities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(57) “rules” means rules made under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(58) “salary” includes-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) any wages;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) any annuity, pension or gratuity;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) any fees, commissions, allowances, perquisites or profits in lieu of, or in addition to, salary or wages;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) any advance of salary; 39[ (e) any leave encashment;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(59) “scheduled bank” has the same meaning as in the Bangladesh Bank Order, 1972 (P. O. No. 127 of 1972); 40[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(60) “shareholder” includes a preference shareholder;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(61) “speculation-business” means business in which a contract for the purchase or sale of any commodity, including stocks and shares, is periodically or ultimately settled otherwise than by the actual delivery or transfer of the commodity or scripts, but does not include business in which-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) a contract in respect of raw materials or merchandise is entered into by a person in the course of his manufacturing or mercantile business to guard against loss through future price fluctuations for the purpose of fulfilling his other contracts for the actual delivery of the goods to be manufactured or the merchandise to be sold by him;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) a contract in respect of stocks and shares is entered into by a dealer or investor therein to guard against loss in his holdings of stocks and shared through price fluctuations; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) a contract is entered into by a member of a forward market or a stock exchange in the course of any transaction in the nature of jobbing or arbitrage to guard against loss which may arise in the ordinary course of his business as such member; 41[ (62) “tax” means the income tax payable under this Ordinance and includes any additional tax, excess profit tax, penalty, interest, fee or other charges leviable or payable under this Ordinance;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">42[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(64) “Tax Recovery Officer” means a person appointed to be a Tax Recovery Officer under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(65) “total income” means the total amount of income referred to in section 17 computed in the manner laid down in this Ordinance, and includes any income which, under any provision of this Ordinance, is to be included in the total income of an assessee;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(66) “transfer”, in relation to a capital asset, includes the sale, exchange or relinquishment of the asset, or the extinguishment of any right therein, but does not include-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) any transfer of the capital asset under a gift, bequest, will or an irrevocable trust;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) any distribution of the assets of a company to its shareholders on its liquidation; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) any distribution of capital assets on the dissolution of a firm or other association of persons or on the partition of a Hindu undivided family;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">43[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(68) “written down value” means the written down value as defined in the Third Schedule;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(69) “year” means a financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">CHAPTER II</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">ADMINISTRATION</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Income-tax authorities</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. There shall be the following classes of income-tax authorities for the purposes of this Ordinance, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) The National Board of Revenue,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">44[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">45[ (2) Directors-General of Inspection (Taxes),]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">46[ (2A) Commissioner of Taxes (Appeals),]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">47[ (2B) Commissioner of Taxes (Large Taxpayer Unit),]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">48[ (2C) Director General (Training),]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">49[ (2D) Director General, Central Intelligence Cell,]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Commissioners of Taxes,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">50[ (3A) Additional Commissioners of Taxes who may be either Appellate Additional Commissioners of Taxes or Inspecting Additional Commissioners of Taxes,]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Joint Commissioner of Taxes who may be either Appellate Joint Commissioner of Taxes or Inspecting Joint Commissioner of Taxes,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) Deputy Commissioners of Taxes,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) Tax Recovery Officers,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) Assistant Commissioners of Taxes,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(8) Extra Assistant Commissioners of Taxes, and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(9) Inspectors of Taxes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of income-tax authorities</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) Subject to the rules and orders of the Government regulating the terms and conditions of service of persons in public services and posts, appointment of income-tax authorities shall be made in accordance with the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board may appoint 51[ Director General, Central Intelligence Cell,] 52[ * * *] as many 53[ Directors-General of Inspection], 54[ Commissioners (Appeals),] Commissioners, Joint Commissioners of Taxes, Deputy Commissioners of Taxes, Tax Recovery Officers and Assistant Commissioners of Taxes and such other executive or ministerial officers and staff as it may think fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">55[ (2A) Notwithstanding anything contained in this Ordinance, the Board may, with the approval of the Government, appoint one or more person having appropriate professional skill and experience to perform such function as may be specified by an order issued in this behalf, and the person or persons so appointed shall be deemed to be an income-tax authority for the purposes of this Ordinance.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Subject to such orders or instructions as the Board may, from time to time, issue in this behalf, any other income-tax authority may appoint any income-tax authority subordinate thereto and such other executive or ministerial officers and staff as may be necessary for assistance in the execution of its functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Delegation of powers</p><p style="text-align: justify;">56[ 4A. The Board may, by notification in the official Gazette, and subject to such limitations or conditions, if any, as may be specified therein, empower by name or designation,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) any Inspecting Additional Commissioner of Taxes to exercise the powers of a Commissioner of Taxes 57[ ;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) any Appellate Additional Commissioner of Taxes to exercise the powers of a Commissioner of Taxes (Appeal) 58[ ; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) any Additional Director General or Joint Director General of Central Intelligence Cell to exercise the powers of Director General, Central Intelligence Cell.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Subordination and control of income-tax authorities</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. 59[ (1) The 60[ * * *] Directors-General of Inspection, Commissioners (Appeals), and Commissioners shall be subordinate to the Board.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The 61[ Additional Commissioners of Taxes, Joint Commissioners of Taxes], Deputy Commissioners of Taxes and Inspectors shall be subordinate to the Commissioners 62[ or the Commissioner (Appeals), as the case may be,] within whose jurisdiction they are appointed to perform their function:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no order, direction or instruction shall be given so as to interfere with the discretion of the Appellate Joint Commissioners 63[ or the Commissioners (Appeals)] in the exercise of their appellate functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Deputy Commissioners of Taxes and Inspectors shall be subordinate to the Inspecting Joint Commissioner within whose jurisdiction they perform their functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Inspectors shall be subordinate to the Deputy Commissioners of Taxes within whose jurisdiction they perform their functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Jurisdiction of income-tax authorities</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) Subject to the provisions of this Ordinance,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">64[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">65[ (aa) the Directors-General of Inspection shall perform the following functions, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) carry out inspection of income tax cases;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) investigate or cause investigation to be carried out in respect of cases involving leakage of revenue or evasion of taxes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii) carry out audit of cases or offices involving income tax revenues only;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv) furnish annual report about the working of income tax offices dealing with revenue matters to the Board by the thirty first day of December following the end of the financial year to which it relates; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(v) such other functions as may be assigned to them by the Board;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">66[ (aaa) the Director General of Central Intelligence Cell shall perform the following functions, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) carry out intelligence works to gather information about taxpayers;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) analyse information gathered through intelligence work vis-a-vis concerned income tax records;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii) detect tax evasions, concealments of income and offences as described in chapter XXI of Income Tax Ordinance, 1984;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv) carry out investigations to prove tax evasion or concealment or any other irregularities relating to taxes and to collect evidences in support of tax offences or tax frauds for recovery of tax with penalty and to suggest prosecutions in fit cases;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(v) to carry out functions as authorised by any other law.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the Commissioners 67[ , the Commissioners (Appeals)] and the Appellate Joint Commissioners shall perform their functions in respect of such areas, or such persons or classes of persons, or such cases or classes of cases, or such incomes or classes of incomes, as the Board may assign to them;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">68[ (bb) the Commissioner (Large Taxpayer Unit) shall perform his functions in respect of such areas, or such persons or classes of persons, or such cases or classes of cases or such incomes or classes of incomes, as the Board may assign to him;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) the Inspecting Joint Commissioners and the Deputy Commissioners of Taxes shall perform their functions in respect of such areas, or such persons or classes of persons, or such cases or classes of cases, or such incomes or classes of incomes as the Commissioner to whom they are subordinate may assign to them; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) other income-tax authorities shall perform such functions as may be assigned to them by the income-tax authority to whom they are subordinate.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) (a) Any area or other jurisdiction or function assigned to an income-tax authority under sub-section (1) may be modified or varied, or may be transferred to any other income-tax authority with respect to areas, persons or classes of persons, or cases or classes of cases, or proceeding or classes of proceedings;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) any such transfer as is referred to in clause (a) may be
