(1) The produce of any barga land shall be divided in the following manner, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        one-third shall be received by the owner for the land;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        one third shall be received by bargadar for the labour;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        one-third shall be received by the owner or the bargadar or by both in proportion to the cost of cultivation, other than the cost of labour, borne by them.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The harvested crop of any barga land shall be stored for thrashing and division either at any place belonging to the bargadar or any place belonging to the owner, whichever is nearer to the barga land, or at any other place agreed upon between the parties.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The bargadar shall tender to the owner the share of the produce due to him immediately after harvesting of the crop and when the tendered share is accepted by the owner, each party shall give to the other a receipt in such form as may be prescribed for the quantity of the produce received by him.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) If the owner refuses to accept the share of the produce tendered to him by the bargadar or to give a receipt therefore, the bargadar shall give intimation of such fact in writing to the prescribed authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The prescribed authority shall, on receipt of such intimation, serve a notice upon the owner, in such form and manner as may be prescribed, asking him to take delivery of the produce within seven days from the date of service of the notice.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) If the owner fails to take delivery of the produce within seven days from the date of service of the notice, the prescribed authority shall permit the bargadar to sell the produce to any Government purchasing agency or, in the absence of such agency, in the local market.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) If the bargadar sells the produce, he shall deposit the proceeds of such sale with the prescribed authority within seven days from the date of sale.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(8) The prescribed authority shall give to the bargadar a receipt, in such form as may be prescribed, stating therein the amount of money deposited with him and the quantity of produce sold by the bargadar and such receipt shall discharge the bargadar from his obligation to deliver the share of the produce to the owner:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the quantity of the produce due to the owner, the obligation of the bargadar with regard to the delivery of the quantity of the produce not tendered or sold shall continue.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(9) Where a deposit is made under sub-section (7), the prescribed authority shall give intimation of such deposit to the owner in such form and manner as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(10) If the owner does not receive the money in deposit from the prescribed authority within one month from the date of receipt of intimation of such deposit, the prescribed authority may deposit the money in the treasury in revenue deposit to the credit of the owner and give intimation of such deposit to the owner in such form and manner as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Bargadar’s right to purchase</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. (1) Where the owner intends to sell the barga land, he shall ask the bargadar in writing if he is willing to purchase the land:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that this provision shall not apply where the owner sells the land to a co-sharer or to his parent, wife, son, daughter or son's son or to any other member of his family.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The bargadar shall, within fifteen days from the date of receipt of the offer, inform the owner in writing of his decision to purchase or not to purchase the land.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) If the bargadar agrees to purchase the land, he shall negotiate the price of the land with the owner and purchase the land on such terms as may be agreed upon between them.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) If the owner does not receive any intimation from the bargadar regarding his decision either to purchase or not to purchase the land within the specified time or if the bargadar informs the owner of his decision not to purchase the land or if the bargadar does not agree to pay the price demanded by the owner, the owner may sell the land to any person he deems fit:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the owner shall not sell the land to such person at a price which is lower than the price offered by the bargadar.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) Where the barga land is purchased by a person other than the bargadar, the barga contract in respect of the land shall be binding upon the purchaser as if the purchaser were a party to the contract.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Ceiling of barga land</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) No bargadar shall be entitled to cultivate more than fifteen standard bighas of land.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation.- In computing this ceiling, area of any land owned by the bargadar as well as the land cultivated by him as a bargadar and held by him under a complete usufructuary mortgage shall be taken into account.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If a bargadar cultivates land in excess of fifteen standard bighas, the share of the produce due to him as a bargadar in respect of the excess land may be compulsorily procured by the Government by order made in this behalf by the prescribed authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Restriction of cultivation</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) No person shall cultivate the land of another person except under a barga contract or complete usufructuary mortgage or as a servant or labourer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If a person cultivates the land of another person in violation of the provisions of this section, the produce of the land may be compulsorily procured by the Government by order made in this behalf by the prescribed authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Disputes</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) Every disputes between a bargadar and the owner in respect of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) division or delivery of the produce,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        termination of barga contract,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        place of storing and thrashing of the produce,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall be decided by the prescribed authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If in deciding any dispute referred to in sub-section (1), any question arises as to whether a person is a bargadar or not or to whom the share of the produce is deliverable, such question shall be determined by the prescribed authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The prescribed authority shall not entertain any dispute if it is not referred to it by an application praying for its decision thereon within three months from the date on which the dispute arose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The prescribed authority shall, after giving the parties an opportunity of being heard and adducing evidence and making such enquiry as it deems necessary, give its decision within three months from the date of receipt of the application.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Appeals</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. (1) An appeal shall lie to the prescribed appellate authority against any order, decision or action made or taken by the prescribed authority under any provision of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) An appeal under sub-section (1) shall be filed within thirty days from the date of receipt or knowledge of the order, decision or action appealed against.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The decision of the prescribed appellate authority shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Procedure</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. (1) The prescribed authority and the prescribed appellate authority shall, in deciding any matter, dispute or appeal, follow such procedure as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any person filing any application to the prescribed authority or any appeal to the prescribed appellate authority shall pay such fees as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Execution</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. Any decision or order of the prescribed authority or of the prescribed appellate authority shall be executed or enforced in such manner as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>MISCELLANEOUS</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Bar of jurisdiction</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. No order, decision, action or proceedings made or taken by any authority under this Ordinance shall be called in question in any Court and no Court shall entertain any suit or proceeding in respect of any such order, decision, action or proceedings.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Penalty</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. Any person who violates any provision of this Ordinance or the rules or any order of any authority made under this Ordinance or the rules shall be punishable with fine which may extend to two thousand Taka.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to make rules</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Source</strong> : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
660	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE LIVESTOCK RESEARCH INSTITUTE ORDINANCE, 1984</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">THE LIVESTOCK RESEARCH INSTITUTE ORDINANCE, 1984</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XXVIII OF 1984).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[23rd April, 1984]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the establishment of a Livestock Research Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of a Livestock Research Institute and for matters connected therewith or incidental thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the proclamation of the 24th March, 1982, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Short title and commencement</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Ordinance may be called the Livestock Research Institute Ordinance, 1984.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force on such date as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Definitions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “Board” means the Board of Governors of the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Institute” means the Livestock Research Institute established under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “member” means a member of the Board; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules or regulations made under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment of the Institute</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) There shall be an Institute to be called the Livestock Research Institute for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Institute shall be a body corporate, having perpetual succession and a common seal with power to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">General direction</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. Subject to the rules and regulations made under this Ordinance, the general direction, administration and supervision of the affairs of the Institute shall vest in a Board of Governors which may exercise all powers and do all acts and things that may be exercised or done by the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. The Board shall consist of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) Minister, Fisheries and Livestock Division, who shall also be the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) Secretary, Fisheries and Livestock Division, who shall also be the Vice-Chairman of the Board, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) Secretary, Finance Division, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) Executive Vice-Chairman, Bangladesh Agricultural Research Council, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) Vice-Chancellor, Bangladesh  Agricultural University, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) Member (Agriculture), Planning Commission, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) Director of Livestock Services, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) two persons to be appointed by the Government from among persons engaged in research activities in the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) two persons to be appointed by the Government from among persons having interest in livestock matters; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) Director-General of the Institute, who shall also be the member secretary of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions of the Institute</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The functions of the Institute shall be-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) to identify and solve the basic livestock problems of the country through research;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to develop suitable method for quick diagnosis and treatment of various livestock diseases;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to study epidemiology on the existing situation of various bacterial, viral, fungal, parasitic diseases and their pathogenic effects on the productivity of animals;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to study immunological characteristic of various organism of important diseases of livestock and poultry and to develop appropriate technology for production of suitable biologics;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to develop suitable breed of livestock for increasing production of milk, meat and drought powers and poultry for eggs and meat;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) to develop methods for improving production and preservation of fodder and feeds, and for better utilisation of agricultural by-products, wastes and non-conventional foodstuff for improving livestock production;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) to improve management practices that will ensure better health and production of animals and birds;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) to evaluate indigenous herbs and shrubs and explore the possibility of their use as drugs in livestock treatment;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) to identify poisonous plants and their effects on animal health and their remedy;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) to develop improved methods for collection, processing and storage of livestock products that will reduce spoilage and improve storage quality;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) to assess the production cost of components of various livestock and their products;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) to identify marketing problems of livestock and their products and develop suitable system for grading and marketing of livestock products;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m) to improve livestock production technology;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n) to disseminate information regarding research of livestock to the farmers;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(o) to organise seminar, symposium and workshop on problems of national importance in the field of livestock;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(p) to publish annual reports of the activities of the Institute; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(q) to perform such other functions as may be necessary for the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meeting of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) The meetings of the Board shall be held at such times and places and in such manner as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that, until so prescribed, such meetings shall be held at such times and places as may be determined by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Board not less than five members shall be present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) All meeting of the Board shall be presided over by the Chairman and, in his absence, by the Vice-Chairman and in the absence of both, by a member authorised in writing by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) No act or proceeding of the Board shall be invalid or be called in question merely on the ground of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Director-General</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) There shall be a Director-General for the Institute who shall be appointed by the Government for such period and on such terms and conditions as may be determined by it.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Director-General shall be a whole-time officer and the chief executive of the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, the Director-General shall be responsible for the efficient management of the affairs and business of the Institute and for the proper execution of the decisions of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Director-General shall perform such other functions as may be assigned to him by the Board or as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) If a vacancy occurs in the office of Director-General or if the Director-General is unable to discharge the functions of his office on account of absence, illness or any other cause, the Government shall make such arrangement for discharging the functions of the Director-General as it may consider expedient.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of officers, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. Subject to the approval of the Government the Institute may appoint such officers and other employees as it consider necessary for the efficient performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Committees</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. The Board may appoint such committees as it may consider necessary to assist it in the performance of its functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Delegation of powers</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. The Board may, by general or special order in writing, direct that such of its powers shall, in such circumstances and under such conditions, if any, as may be specified in the order, be exercisable also by the Chairman or the Director-General, or by such other member or by such officer of the Institute as may be so specified:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no power to make regulations under section 19 shall be delegated under this section.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Funds of the Institute</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) The funds of the Institute shall comprise-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) grants made by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) grants from the local authorities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) loans obtained from the Government or, with the prior approval of the Government, from the local authorities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) sale proceeds and royalties accruing from the property owned by the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) receipt from any other source.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The funds of the Institute shall be kept in a nationalised commercial bank or in such other scheduled bank as the Government may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Budget of the Institute</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. The Institute shall, by such date in each year as may be specified by the Government, submit to the Government for approval a budget for each financial year showing the estimated receipts and expenditure and the sums which are likely to be required from the Government during that financial year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Audit and accounts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) The Institute shall maintain its accounts in such manner and form as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The accounts of the Institute shall be audited by the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh, hereinafter in this section referred to as the Auditor-General, in such manner as he deems fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) For the purpose of an audit under sub-section (2), the Auditor-General or any person authorised by him in this behalf shall have access to all records, books, documents, cash, securities, stores and other property of the Institute and may examine the Chairman or any member or any officer or employee of the Institute.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Auditor-General shall, as soon as possible after completion of the audit, send to the Board his audit report and the Board shall forward it with its comments thereon to the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Institute shall take steps forthwith to remedy any defects or irregularity pointed out in the audit report.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Submission of annual reports, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. (1) The Institute shall, as soon as possible after the end of every financial year, submit to the Government an annual report on the conduct of its affairs for that year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may require the Institute to furnish any report, return, statement, estimate, statistics or other information regarding any matter under the control of the Institute and the Institute shall comply with every such requisition.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Certain organisations to cease to exist etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any regulation, resolution, agreement, contract or other instrument, on the commencement of this Ordinance-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the Central Cattle Breeding Station, hereinafter referred to as the said organisations, shall cease to exist;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) such assets and properties, movable or immovable, used by or for the purposes of the said organisations as are specified by the Government by order in writing shall stand transferred to, and vest in, the Institute;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) such officers and other employees employed in the said organisations as are specified by the Government by order in writing shall stand transferred to the Institute and shall serve the Institute on the same terms and conditions as were applicable to them immediately before such transfer:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Institute may, with the approval of the Government, alter such terms and conditions:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that if the terms and conditions so altered are disadvantageous to any officer or employee, such officer or employee may opt to revert to his original post or service.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may, for the purposes of removing any difficulty in relation to the transfer and other matter specified in sub-section (1), make such order as it may consider expedient and any such order shall be deemed to be given effect to as part of the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Indemnity</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against the Board, the Chairman, the Director-General or any member or any officer or employee of the Institute for anything done or intended to be done in good faith under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make regulations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. (1) The Board may make regulations, no inconsistent with this Ordinance or rules made thereunder, to provide for all matters for which provision is necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All regulations made under this section shall be published in the official Gazette and shall come into force on such publication.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
661	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE LOCAL GOVERNMENT (UNION PARISHADS) ORDINANCE 1983   </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;">THE LOCAL GOVERNMENT (UNION PARISHADS) ORDINANCE 1983</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. LI OF 1983).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[12th September,1983]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the constitution of Union Parishads for the unions in rural areas.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the constitution of Union Parishads for the unions in rural areas and for matters incidental or ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 24th March, 1982, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the Chief Martial Law Administrator is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Local Government (Union Parishads) Ordinance, 1983.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1) “annual value” means the gross rent at which a building or land may be let from year to year;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) “building” includes any shop, house, hut, out house, shed, stable or enclosure built of any material and used for any purpose, and also includes a wall, well, verandah, platform, plinth and steps;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) “Chairman” means the Chairman of a Union Parishad;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) “Circle Officer” means the Circle Officer of the police station concerned, and includes any officer specially appointed by the Government to perform all or any of the functions of a Circle Officer under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) “Deputy Commissioner” includes any officer specially appointed by the Government to perform all or any of the functions of a Deputy Commissioner under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) “district” means a revenue district;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(7) “Election Commission” means the Election Commission of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(8)  “function” includes powers to be exercised and duties to be discharged;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(9) “infectious disease” means cholera, plague, small-pox and tuberculosis and includes such other disease as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, declare to be an infectious disease for the purposes of this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(10) “land” includes land which is being built upon or is built up or is covered with water;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(11)   “member” means a member of a Union Parishad;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(12) “municipal body” means a body constituted under any law relating to local government in urban areas, but does not include Cantonment Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(13) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(14) “public road” means a road maintained by the Government or by a Union Parishad or other local authority;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(15) “public street” means a street maintained by the Government or by a Union Parishad or other local authority;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(16) “public way” means a way maintained by the Government or by a Union Parishad or other local authority;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(17) “regulations” means regulations made under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(18)“road” includes a road which is not a thoroughfare;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(19)“rules” means rules made under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(20) “rural area” means any area which is not an urban area;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(21) “street” includes a street which is not a thoroughfare;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(24) “Tax” includes any rate, fee or other impost leviable under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3[ (25) “Thana” means a police station within the meaning of “police station” as defined in clause (s) of sub-section (1) of section 4 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898 (Act V of 1898);</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(25A) “Thana Nirbahi Officer” means the Thana Nirbahi Officer of a Thana;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(26) “union” means a rural area declared to be a union under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(27) “Union Parishad” means a Union Parishad constituted under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(30) “Urban area” means an area within the jurisdiction of a municipal body;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(31) “ward” means a ward of a Union Parishad; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(32) “way” includes a foot-way, square, court, alley or passage accessible to the public, whether a thoroughfare or not.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Declaration of Union and alteration of limits thereof</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. <strong>The Deputy Commissioner may, in the prescribed manner</strong>,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)  divide the rural areas of a police station within his jurisdiction separately into a number of areas, and declare each such area to be a union;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) extend, curtail or otherwise alter the limits of any such union; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) declare that any such area shall, from a date to be specified, cease to be a union.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Union to be administrative unit</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6[ 3A. Every union shall be an administrative unit for the purpose of article 59 of the Constitution of the People's Republic of Bangladesh.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Constitution of Union Parishads</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) As soon as may be after the commencement of this Ordinance, there shall be constituted, in accordance with the provisions of this Ordinance, a Union Parishad for a union.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A Union Parishad shall be known by such local name as the Deputy Commissioner may assign.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Every Union Parishad shall be a body corporate, having perpetual succession and a common seal, with power, subject to the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules, to acquire and hold property both movable and immovable, and shall by its name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Composition of Union Parishads</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. 7[ (1) A Union Parishad shall consist of a Chairman and twelve members including three members exclusively reserved for women.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) 8[ Subject to the provisions of sub-section (3), the Chairman and members] shall be elected by direct election on the basis of adult franchise in accordance with the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9[ (3) There shall be reserved three seats exclusively for women members in each Union Parishad, hereinafter referred to as reserved seats, who shall be elected by direct election on the basis of adult franchise in accordance with the provisions of this Ordinance and the rules:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that nothing in this sub-section shall prevent a woman from being elected to any of the nine general seats provided for in sub-section (1).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Chairman of a Union Parishad shall also be deemed to be a member of the Parishad.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) There shall be paid to the Chairman and members of a Union Parishad such honorarium as may be determined by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10[ ]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) The term of a Union parishad shall be a period of 11[ five] years commencing on the day of its first meeting after its constitution:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12[ Provided that, notwithstanding the expiration of its term, a Union Parishad shall continue to function until the first meeting of the Parishad constituted to succeed it.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14[ (1B) Notwithstanding anything contained in this Ordinance, a Union Parishad shall be deemed to have been duly constituted after the election of seventy-five per cent of the total number of its 15[ members 16[ * * *]] has taken place.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation.- For calculating the seventy-five per cent of the total number of 17[ * * *] members, less than point five zero per cent shall be ignored and point five zero and above per cent shall be rounded off into a whole number.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A Union Parishad shall, after its constitution, hold its first meeting on such date, not later than thirty days from the day on which the names of its Chairman and elected members are notified in the official Gazette, as may be appointed by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Qualifications and disqualifications of Chairman and members of Union Parishads</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) A person shall, subject to the provisions of sub section (2), be qualified to be elected 18[ * * *] as, and to be, a Chairman or member if-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        he is a citizen of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        he has attained the age of twenty five years; 19[ * * *</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        in the case of Chairman, his name appears on the electoral roll for any ward in the Union;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        in the case of a member including a member of reserved seats, his name appears on the electoral roll of the concerned ward.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A person shall be disqualified for election 20[ * * *] as, or for being, a Chairman or a member if-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21[ 22[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(aa) he is declared by a competent Court to be of unsound mind;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        he is an undischarged insolvent;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        he has ceased to be a citizen of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        he has been, on conviction for a criminal offence involving moral turpitude, sentenced to imprisonment for a term of not less than two years, unless a period of five years has elapsed since his release;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        he holds any full time office of profit in the service of the Republic or of the Union Parishad or of any other local authority; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         he is a party to a contract for work to be done for, or goods to be supplied to, the Union Parishad concerned, or has otherwise any pecuniary interest in its affairs, or is a dealer in essential commodities appointed by the Government 23[ ;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        he has defaulted in repaying any loan taken by him from any specified bank within the time allowed by the bank therefore;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Explanation.- For the purposes of clause (g), “specified bank” means the Sonali Bank, the Agrani Bank and the Janata Bank constituted under the Bangladesh Banks (Nationalisation) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 26 of 1972), the Shilpa Rin Sangstha established under the Shilpa Rin</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Sangstha Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 128 of 1972), the Bangladesh Shilpa Bank Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 129 of 1972), the House Building Finance Corporation established under the House Building Finance Corporation Order, 1973 (P.O. No. 7 of 1973), the Krishi Bank established under the Krishi Bank Order, 1973 (P.O. No. 27 of 1973), the Investment Corporation of Bangladesh established under the Investment Corporation of Bangladesh Ordinance, 1976 (XL of 1976), the Rajshahi Krishi Unnayan Bank established under the Rajshahi Krishi Unnayan Bank Ordinance, 1986 (LVIII of 1986), and the Rupali Bank Limited 24[ ;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        he is a member of Parliament 25[ ;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         he is a defaulter in paying any of the taxes, rates and fees levied under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) he has been dismissed from the service of the Republic or of any local authority for misconduct involving moral turpitude and unless a period of five years has elapsed since his dismissal.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Persons not to be candidate for two offices</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) A person shall not, at the same time, be a candidate for election to the offices of Chairman and 26[ * * *] member of a Union Parishad.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If a person offers himself, at the same time, to be a candidate for election to the offices of Chairman and 27[ * * *] member, all his nomination papers shall stand void.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) When the office of Chairman falls vacant during the term of the Union Parishad, a member may contest the election to the office of Chairman, and if he is elected, his membership shall cease on the date he makes the oath of office of Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Oath of office</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. Every Chairman and member shall, before he enters upon his office, make, in the prescribed manner and within the prescribed period, an oath in the prescribed form.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Declaration of properties</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. Every Chairman and member shall, before he enters upon his office, submit to such Authority as the Government may direct, a declaration in writing, of properties, both movable and immovable, whether within or outside Bangladesh, which he or any member of his family owns, or which he has in his possession or under his control, or in which he or any member of his family has any beneficial interest.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Explanation:</strong>-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">In this section, the expression “member of his family”, in relation to a person, includes-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the spouse of such person, and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) such of the children, parents, brothers and sisters as reside with and are wholly dependent upon such person.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Resignation of Chairman, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) A Chairman may resign his office by notice in writing under his hand addressed to the Government or such other authority as the Government, may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A member may resign his office by notice in writing under his hand addressed to the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A resignation under this section shall become effective, and the office concerned shall become vacant, on the date on which the notice of resignation is received by the addressee.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Removal of Chairman, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. 28[ (1) A Chairman or member shall render himself liable to removal from his office if -</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        he, without reasonable excuse, absents himself from three consecutive meetings of the Union Parishad;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        he is involved in any activities prejudicial to the interest of the Union Parishad or of the State;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        he becomes physically or mentally incapacitated from performing his functions; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        he is guilty of misconduct or is responsible for any loss or misapplication of money or property of the Union Parishad.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Explanation</strong>: In this sub section, “misconduct” means misuse of power, corruption, jobbery, favouritism, nepotism and wilful maladministration and includes any attempt at, or abetment of, such misconduct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A Chairman or 29[ * * *] member shall not be removed from his office-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        on any ground mentioned in clause (a) or (b) of sub-section (1), unless after such enquiry as may be considered necessary, the Government declares, by an order in writing, that he is liable to be so removed; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        on any ground mentioned in clause (c) or (d) of that sub-section, unless, at a special meeting of the Union Parishad called for the purpose in the prescribed manner, a resolution to the effect that he is liable to be so removed is passed by the votes of not less than 30[ nine members] of the Union Parishad and unless the resolution is approved by the Government:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that no declaration under clause (a) nor a resolution under clause (b) shall be made or passed unless the Chairman or the member concerned has been given a reasonable opportunity of showing cause against the declaration or resolution proposed to be made or passed with respect to him.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2A) A Chairman or 31[ * * *] member shall be deemed to have been removed from his office on the date on which the</p><p style="text-align: justify;">declaration under clause (a) of sub-section (2) of the approval of the Government under clause (b) of that sub-section is received by the Union Parishad.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A Chairman shall stand removed from his office if, at a special meeting of the Union Parishad called for the purpose in the prescribed manner, a motion of no-confidence is passed against him by the votes of not less than seven elected members and the motion is approved by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) Notwithstanding anything contained in any other provision of this Ordinance, a person who has been removed from any office under this section shall not, during the unexpired period of the term of the Union Parishad, be eligible for election 33[ * * *] to that Union Parishad.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Vacation of Office of the Chairman, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. The office of Chairman or member shall become vacant if-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        he becomes disqualified for being such Chairman or member under section 7(2);</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        he fails to make the oath referred to in section 9 within the prescribed period, unless the 34[ Deputy Commissioner], for good cause shown extends the period;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        he resigns his office under section 11;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        he is removed from his office under section 12; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        he dies.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Casual vacancy</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) Where the office of Chairman or a member becomes vacant not later than one hundred and eighty days before the term of the Union Parishad is due to expire, an election 35[ * * *] to fill the office shall be held 36[ * * *] within sixty days of the occurrence of the vacancy, and the person who is elected in such election 37[ * * *] shall hold office for the residue of such term:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that if no election is held within sixty days, the Election Commission may fix a day to hold such election.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) While the office of Chairman is vacant, the functions of the office shall be performed by the Acting Chairman referred to in section 16.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Leave of absence of Chairman, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. A Union Parishad may grant leave of absence to its Chairman for any period not exceeding three months in any one year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Acting Chairman</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. (1) If a vacancy occurs in the office of Chairman or if the Chairman is unable to discharge the functions of his office on account of absence, illness or any other cause, 38[ a member elected by the Union Parishad under sub-section (1A) from amongst the members] shall act as Acting Chairman until a new Chairman elected to fill such vacancy enters upon his office or until the Chairman resumes the functions of his office, as the case may be.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">39[ (1A) An election of Acting Chairman shall be held in such manner as may be directed by the Government.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) At any time when the Acting Chairman is unable to discharge the functions of his office on account of absence, illness or any other cause, another member elected by the Union Parishad from amongst the 40[ * * *] members shall act as Acting Chairman until a new Chairman elected to fill such vacancy enters upon his office or until the Acting Chairman resumes the functions of his office, as the case may be.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Notification of election, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. An election, 41[ * * *] resignation, removal or vacation of office of a Chairman or member shall be notified in the official Gazette by the Government or any other authority as the Government may direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Reconstitution of Union Parishads in certain cases</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">42[ 17A. (1) Where any portion of a union has been declared an urban area and included in a municipality under the Paurashava Ordinance, 1977 (XXVI of 1977), the Union Parishad of the union may, if necessary, notwithstanding anything contained in this Ordinance, be reconstituted in such manner as the Government may direct and a Union Parishad so reconstituted shall continue to function till a Union Parishad is constituted in accordance with the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1), the Government may, instead of reconstituting a Union Parishad, appoint an Administrator to perform the functions of the Union Parishad till a Union Parishad is constituted in accordance with the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Where an Administrator is appointed under this section,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) the Chairman and members of the Union Parishad shall cease to hold office;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) the Government may appoint a Committee consisting of such number of members as it deems fit to assist the Administrator in the discharge of his functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Administrator and the members of the Committee, if any, shall respectively exercise the powers of the Chairman and Members of the Union Parishad.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Government may make such orders regarding the staff and the assets and liabilities of the Union Parishad reconstituted under this section as it may deem fit.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Wards</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">43[ 18. (1) For the purpose of election of members, other than in reserved seats, the Union shall be divided into nine wards.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) For the purpose of election of members in reserved seats, the Union shall be divided into three wards.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Appointment of delimitation officers</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. (1) For the purpose of delimitation of wards, the 44[ Thana Nirbahi Officer] may appoint from amongst persons in the service of the Republic as many delimitation officers and assistant delimitation officers as may be necessary.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) An assistant delimitation officer shall assist the delimitation officer in the performance of his functions and may perform, under the control of the delimitation officer, the functions of the delimitation officer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Delimitation of wards</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. (1) The wards shall be delimited having regard to territorial unity and, so far as practicable, to distribution of population and administrative convenience.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A delimitation officer may, for the purpose of delimiting the wards, make such enquiries and examine such records as he may deem necessary and consider such representations as may be received by him, and shall publish at his office and at the office of the Union Parishad and at such other place or places as he considers necessary a preliminary list of wards specifying the areas proposed to be included in each such ward together with a notice inviting objections or suggestions within fifteen days from the date of publication of the notice.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The objection or suggestion, if any, received under sub section (2), shall be forwarded to the 45[ Thana Nirbahi Officer] who, after making such inquiries as he considers necessary, shall give his decision within a period not exceeding fifteen days from the date of receipt of the objections or suggestions from the delimitation officer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The delimitation officer shall make such amendments, alterations or modifications in the preliminary list published under sub section (2) as may be required by any decision on any objection or suggestion given by the 46[ Thana Nirbahi Officer] under sub-section (3) and may also make such other amendments, alterations or modifications in the said list as may be necessary for correcting any error or omission.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) After making amendments, alterations or modifications, if any, under sub section (4), the delimitation officer shall publish at his office and at the office of the Union Parishad and at such other place or places as he considers necessary the final list of wards, specifying the areas included in such ward and shall forward attested copies thereof to the 47[ Thana Nirbahi Officer] who shall publish the list of wards in the official Gazette.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Delimitation of wards of reserved seats</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">48[ 20A. For the purpose of election to the reserved seats, the Thana Nirbahi Officer shall cause the nine wards, delimited under section 20 to be regrouped into three wards and shall publish the list of such wards in the official Gazette.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Electoral roll</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. (1) There shall be an electoral roll for each ward to be prepared by the Election Commission.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A person shall be entitled to be enrolled on the electoral roll for a ward if he-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)  is a citizen of Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) is not less than eighteen years of age;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) does not stand declared by a competent Court to be of unsound mind; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) is or is deemed to be a resident of that ward.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Right to vote</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. (1) Every person whose name is for the time being entered in the electoral roll of a ward shall be entitled to vote at election of 49[ a member 50 for that ward].</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every person whose name is for the time being entered in the electoral roll of a ward of a union shall be entitled to vote at an election of Chairman for that union.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Election of 51 elected members, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. (1) There shall be elected 52[ one member] from each ward and a Chairman in a Union Parishad.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A general election of Chairman and 53[ members 54[ * * *]] of a Union Parishad shall be held-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) for the purpose of constituting the Union Parishad under</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>section 4, as soon as may be after the commencement of this Ordinance;</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">56[ (b) for the purpose of reconstituting the Union Parishad after the expiration of the term of the Union Parishad, within the period of one hundred eighty days preceding such expiration;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) for the purpose of reconstituting the Union Parishad after the expiration of the period of supersession of the Union Parishad, if any, before such expiration:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the persons elected at a general election under clause (b) or (c) shall not enter upon office as Chairman or member of the Union Parishad except after the expiration of the term of the Union Parishad or the period of supersession of the Union Parishad, as the case may be.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">57[ (3) Where, for any reason, the election of a Union Parishad can not be held within the period specified in clause (b) or (c) of sub-section (2), that election may, notwithstanding anything contained in that sub-section, be held within a period, after the expiration of the term of the Union Parishad, as the Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, specify.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Conduct of election</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. All elections of Chairman and 58[ members 59[ * * *]] of a Union Parishad shall be organised, held and conducted by the Election Commission in accordance with the rules, and such</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>rules may provide for all or any of the following matters, namely</strong>:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the appointment of returning officers, assistant returning officers, presiding officers and polling officers for the conduct of election, and powers and duties of such officers;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the nomination of candidates, objections to nominations and scrutiny of nominations;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the deposits to be made by candidates and the circumstances under which such deposits may be refunded to candidates or forfeited to the Union Parishad;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        the withdrawal of candidature;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        the appointment of agents of candidates;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         the procedure in contested and uncontested elections;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        the date, time and place for poll and other matters relating to the conduct of elections;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) the manner in which votes are to be given;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) the scrutiny and counting of votes, the declaration of the result and the procedure to be followed in case of equality of votes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) the custody and disposal of ballot papers and other papers relating to elections;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) the circumstances under which polls may be suspended and fresh polls may be held;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) the election expenses;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m) the corrupt or illegal practices and other election offences and penalties thereof; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n) any other matter connected with or incidental to elections.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Publication of results of election of Chairman, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. The names of all persons elected as Chairman and 60[ members 61[ * * *]] of a Union Parishad shall as soon as may be after such election, be published in the official Gazette, by the Election Commission.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Election petitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">26. (1) No election under this Ordinance shall be called in question except by an election petition under sub section (2).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any candidate may make an election petition challenging the election at which he was a candidate.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) An election petition shall be presented, in such manner as may be prescribed to the Election Tribunal appointed under section 27.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Appointment of Tribunal</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">27. (1) For the trial of election petitions, the Election Commission shall, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint a judicial officer to be an Election Tribunal for such area as may be specified in the notification.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Where the person constituting an Election Tribunal is succeeded by another, the trial of a petition shall continue before the person so succeeding and any evidence already recorded shall remain upon the record and it shall not be necessary to re examine the witnesses who have already been examined and discharged.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Power to transfer election petitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">28. The Election Commission, either of its own motion or on an application made in this behalf by any of the parties, may, at any stage, transfer an election petition from one Election Tribunal to another Election Tribunal, and the Tribunal to which the petition is so transferred shall proceed with the trial of the petition from the stage at which it was transferred:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Tribunal to which an election petition is so transferred may, if it thinks fit, recall and examine any of the witnesses already examined.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Trial of election petitions</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">29. (1) An Election Tribunal shall, upon receipt of an election petition, give notice thereof to all the contesting candidates at the election to which the petition relates.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Subject to any rules made in this behalf, the Election Tribunal shall, after giving the contesting candidates an opportunity of being heard and taking such evidence as may be produced before it, make such orders as it may think fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">62[ (3) Save as provided in sub-section (4), the decision of an Election Tribunal on an election petition shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Any person aggrieved by a decision of the Election Tribunal may, within thirty days of the announcement of the decision, prefer an appeal to the District Judge within whose jurisdiction the election in dispute was held; and the decision of the District Judge on such appeal shall be final:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that in the case of a decision announced before the commencement of the Local Government (Union Parishads) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (XLIV of 1984), such appeal may be preferred within thirty days of such commencement.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Civic functions of Union Parishads</p><p style="text-align: justify;">30. (1) Subject to rules, and such directions as the Government may from time to time give, and within the limits of the funds at its disposal, a Union Parishad may undertake all or any of the functions enumerated in Part I of the First Schedule, and such other functions-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) as are declared by the Government to be appropriate matters for administration by Union Parishad generally or by any particular Union Parishad; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) as are entrusted to Union Parishads under any other law for the time being in force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Union Parishads shall, in particular, undertake the following functions:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) maintenance of law and order and assistance to administration in the maintenance of law and order;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) adoption of measures for preventing crime, disorder and smuggling;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) adoption and implementation of development schemes in the fields of agriculture, forest, fisheries, livestock, education, health, cottage industries, communication, irrigation and flood protection with a view to increasing economic and social upliftment of people;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) promotion of family planning;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) development of local resources and their use;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) protection and maintenance of public property, such as roads, bridges, canals, embankments, telephones and electricity lines;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) review of the Development Activities of all agencies at the union level and to make recommendations to the 65[ Thana Nirbahi Officer] in regard to their activities;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) motivation and persuasion of the people to install sanitary latrines;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j) registration of Births, deaths, blinds, beggars and destitutes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) conducting of census of all kinds.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Police and defence functions of Union Parishads</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">31. (1) The Government may establish a village police force in such rural areas as may be notified from time to time, and may by rules regulate the appointment, the training and discipline and the terms and conditions of service of the members of such police force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The village police shall exercise such powers and discharge such duties as are specified in Part II of the First Schedule.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Where the Deputy Commissioner is of the opinion that in any union or a part thereof, special measures are required to secure village defence or public security, he may, by order, require, that all or any of the able-bodied adult male inhabitants of the union or such part thereof shall be liable to patrol duty for such period and in such manner as may be specified in the order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Where an order is made under sub section (3), the Union Parishad shall exercise such powers and discharge such duties as may be specified in the order.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Revenue and general administrative functions of Union Parishads</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">32. (1) It shall be the duty of the Chairman-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) to assist village revenue officials in the union, by whatever name called or howsoever designated, in the proper performance of their duties with regard to the collection of rent or land development tax and the general administration;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) to render such assistance in the preparation of records and assessments, and in the work of survey or crop inspection, and of other branches of revenue administration in the union as the Deputy Commissioner may require;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) to report to the police the commission of any offence, to bring to the notice of the police the presence in the union of persons of notorious character, and to assist in the investigation and prevention of crime, and in arresting criminals;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) to report to competent authority all cases of damage to or encroachments upon any public road, street or way, or any public place, building or property;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to publicise in the union all matters the publicity of which is required by the Government or other competent authority; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) to assist officials in the execution of their official duties, and to furnish such information as may be required by them for official purposes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Nothing in sub section (1) shall be construed as authorising the Chairman to interfere in the performance by any official of his official duties.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Development functions of Union Parishads</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">33. (1) A Union Parishad shall be responsible for agricultural, industrial and community development in the union, and may, for that purpose, perform such functions as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A Union Parishad may, for the purposes of rural development, adopt such measures and perform such functions as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Appointment for the purpose of sports, etc</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">34. Every Union Parishad may appoint one of its members, or, if the circumstances so require, any other person to be in charge of promoting public games, sports and cultural activities.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Transfer of functions from Union Parishads to Government and vice versa</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">35. Notwithstanding anything in this Ordinance or in any other law for the time being in force, the Government may from time to time direct that, subject to such terms and conditions as may be specified in the direction,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) any institution or service maintained by a Union Parishad shall be transferred to the management and control of the Government or 66[ any other authority]; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) any institution or service maintained by the Government or 67[ any other authority] shall be transferred to the management and control of a Union Parishad.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Executive powers</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">36. (1) The executive powers of a Union Parishad shall extend to the doing of all acts necessary for the due discharge of its functions under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Save as otherwise provided in this Ordinance and the rules, the executive powers of a Union Parishad shall vest in and be exercised by its Chairman, either directly or through other persons authorised by him, in accordance with this Ordinance or the rules.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) All acts of a Union Parishad, whether executive or not, shall be expressed to be taken in the name of the Union Parishad, and shall be authenticated in the manner prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Disposal of business</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">37. (1) All business of a Union Parishad shall, to the extent and in the manner prescribed, be disposed of at its meeting, or at the meetings of its 68[ Standing Committees], or by its Chairman or members, officers or employees.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All meetings of a Union Parishad shall be presided over by the Chairman and, in his absence, by the acting Chairman, and in the absence of both, by a member chosen for that purpose by the members present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) No act or proceedings of a Union Parishad shall be invalid by reason only of the existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Parishad, or by reason only that some person who was not entitled to do so, sat or voted, or otherwise took part in its proceedings.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Minutes of the proceedings of every meeting of a Union Parishad shall be drawn up and recorded in a book to be kept for the purpose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) All decisions of a Union Parishad shall be reported to the 69[ Thana Nirbahi Officer] along with a copy to the Deputy Commissioner within fourteen days from the date on which the minutes of the meeting are signed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Constitution of Standing Committees</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">70[ 38. (1) The Union Parishad shall, at its first meeting, in each year, or as soon as may be at any meeting subsequent thereto, constitute Standing Committees for dealing respectively with-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) finance and establishment;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">71[ (b) education and mass education;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) health, family planning and epidemic control;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) audit and accounts;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) agriculture and other development works;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         social welfare and community centres;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) cottage industries and co-operatives 72[ ;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        law and order;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         women and children welfare, culture and sports;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         fisheries and livestock;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k) conservation of environment and tree plantation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) union public works;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m) rural water supply and sanitation.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">73[ (1A) A Standing Committee under this section shall consist of such number of members and other co-opted persons as may be determined by the Union Parishad concerned.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Union Parishad may, with the previous approval of the Deputy Commissioner, constitute additional Standing Committees for such purpose as may be prescribed by regulations.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">74[ (3) A Standing Committee shall elect one of its members, other than a co-opted member to be its Chairman and another such member to be its Vice-Chairman:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that one-fourth of the total number of Chairmen of the Standing Committees shall, subject to the availability of candidate, be elected from amongst the members elected in reserved seats:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that where any office of Chairman of any Standing Committee within the number aforesaid can not be filled in by a member elected in reserved seat for any reason whatsoever, the office of Vice-Chairman of that Standing Committee shall be filled in by election of a member elected in reserved seat.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) A Union Parishad may co-opt a person of either sex who is not a member of the Parishad but who may, in the opinion of the Parishad, possess special qualifications for serving on any Standing Committee; and such member shall not have any right to vote at meetings of the Standing Committee, but shall be deemed to be member thereof for all other purposes.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Samaj Unnayan Committee</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">75[ 38A.
