Privileges) (Second Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. LIV of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8 The words “on his ceasing to be a Judge” were substituted for the words “on retirement” by section 2 of the Supreme Court Judges (Leave, Pension and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 1993 (Act No. XXIII of 1993)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9 The words “Taka one hundred eleven” were substituted for the words “Taka fifty” by section 2 of the Supreme Court Judges (Leave, Pension and Privileges) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1985 (Ordinance No. XLVI of 1985)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10 The words “two hundred and fifty” were substituted for the words “one hundred thirty nine” by section 2 of the Supreme Court Judges (Leave, Pension and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 1993 (Act No. XXIII of 1993)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11 The words “Taka four thousand” were substituted for the words “Taka one thousand eight hundred” by section 2 of the Supreme Court Judges (Leave, Pension and Privileges) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1985 (Ordinance No. XLVI of 1985)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12 The words “eight thousand and five hundred” were substituted for the words “five thousand” by section 2 of the Supreme Court Judges (Leave, Pension and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 1993 (Act No. XXIII of 1993)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13 The word “President” was substituted for the words “Chief Martial Law Administrator” by section 4 of the Supreme Court Judges (Leave, Pension and Privileges) (Second Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. LIV of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14 The previous provision was re-numbered as sub-section (1) by section 2 of the Supreme Court Judges (Leave, Pension and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. VII of 2001)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15 The word “one-half” were substituted for the word “one-fourth” by section 4 of the Supreme Court Judges (Leave, Pension and Privileges) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. V of 1984</p><p style="text-align: justify;">16 The word and figure “Taka 210 ” were substituted for the letters and figure “Tk. 192” by section 4 of the Supreme Court Judges (Leave, Pension and Privileges) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. V of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17 The figure “230” was substituted for the figure “210” by section 3 of the Supreme Court Judges (Leave, Pension and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. XXIV of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">18 The word and figure “Taka 195 ” were substituted for the letters and figure “Tk. 178” by section 4 of the Supreme Court Judges (Leave, Pension and Privileges) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. V of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">19 The figure “215” was substituted for the figure “195” by section 3 of the Supreme Court Judges (Leave, Pension and Privileges) (Amendment) Act, 1990 (Act No. XXIV of 1990)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">20 The word and figure “Taka 180 ” were substituted for the letters and figure “Tk. 165” by section 4 of the Supreme Court Judges (Leave, Pension and Privileges) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. V of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21 The figure “200” was substituted for the figure “180” by section 3 of the Supreme Court Judges (Leave, word “15 years ” were substituted for the figure and word “10 years” by section 4 of the Supreme Court Judges (Leave, Pension and Privileges) (Amendment) Ordinance, 1984 (Ordinance No. V of 1984)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25 The figure and word “15 years ” were substituted for the figure and word “10 years” by section 4 of the Supreme Court Judges (Leave, Pension and Privileges) Ordinance shall be determined by the rules or other similar instruments” were substituted for the words</p><p style="text-align: justify;">32 The word “President” was substituted for the words “Chief justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p> </div></div>
675	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE SURPLUS PUBLIC SERVANTS ABSORPTION ORDINANCE, 1985</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">THE SURPLUS PUBLIC SERVANTS ABSORPTION ORDINANCE, 1985</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XXIV OF 1985).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[20th May, 1985]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for absorption of surplus public servants and for matters ancillary thereto.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for absorption of surplus public servants and for matters ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 24th March, 1982, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Short title and commencement</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1.         (1) This Ordinance may be called the Surplus Public Servants Absorption Ordinance, 1985.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall be deemed to have taken effect on the 16th day of December, 1971, except section 3 which shall be deemed to have taken effect on the 17th day of June, 1975.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Definitions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2.         In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) “cadre post” means a post in any service specified in Schedule I to the Bangladesh Civil Service Recruitment Rules, 1981, and includes a post in the Senior Services Pool;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “local authority” means any body corporate or other authority constituted or established by or under any law and includes any other body or organisation set up by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “post” means a civil post in the service of the Republic or of any local authority and includes a cadre post;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “public servant” means any person who is, for the time being, in the service of the Republic or of any local authority, but does not include any person who-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         is a member of any defence service,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        is employed in or under a commission, committee or board set up for a temporary period for specified purposes,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       is a contingent or work-charged employee,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv)       is employed in or under a project set up for a temporary period for specified purposes, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(v)        is employed on contract for a specified period;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “surplus public servant” means a public servant whose post is abolished by the Government for the purpose of administrative re-organisation or who, being a servant of the erstwhile Government of Pakistan, joined the Government of Bangladesh on repatriation or escaping or defecting from Pakistan, or any other public servant the responsibility of whose absorption has been taken by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Certain newspaper employees to be deemed to be surplus public servants</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3.         Notwithstanding anything contained in this Ordinance, a person who was an employee of a newspaper the declaration of which stood annulled under the Newspaper (Annulment of Declaration) Act, 1975 (XLII of 1975), and the responsibility of whose absorption had been taken by the Government shall be deemed to be a public servant for the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Effect of laws, etc, inconsistent with the Ordinance</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4.         The provisions of this Ordinance and the rules made thereunder shall have effect notwithstanding anything inconsistent therewith contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any rule, regulation, bye-law, instrument, contract, agreement, award or settlement or in any terms and conditions of service of a public servant.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Absorption of surplus public servants</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5.         (1) A surplus public servant shall, as far as practicable, be absorbed in a post carrying the same scale of pay of the post which he held immediately before becoming surplus had carried:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that if a surplus public servant cannot be absorbed in any post which carries same of scale of pay, he may be offered a post carrying lower scale of pay; and if he does not accept the offer, he shall be deemed to have been retired from service with effect from the date he rejects the offer or after thirty days from the date of receipt of the offer, whichever is earlier.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2)        A surplus public servant shall not be absorbed in any post unless he is nominated by the Ministry of Establishment:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that the Ministry of Establishment may authorise a Ministry, Division or a local authority to absorb a surplus public servant in any office under its administrative control.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3)        For the purpose of sub-section (1), no surplus public servant shall be required to sit for any test or examination or to have any particular qualification or length of service or to be within any particular limit of age.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4)        Once a surplus public servant is absorbed in a post under sub-section (1), it shall be final and he shall not be entitled to be re-absorbed in any other post.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Fixation of seniority, pay and pension</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6.         The seniority, pay and pension of surplus public servant shall, on his absorption in a post, be determined in accordance with the principles laid down by the Government from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Application of certain laws, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7.         Subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, a surplus public servant shall, on his absorption in a post, be subject to all laws, rules and regulations relating to that post.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power of Government to prohibit recruitment</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8.         The Government may, by order, prohibit for a period specified therein, recruitment in any local authority without the previous sanction of the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Exclusion from the purview of Bangladesh Public Service Commission</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9.         No consultation with the Bangladesh Public Service Commission shall be necessary for the purpose of absorption of surplus public servants under this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Bar on jurisdiction of Courts, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10.       No action taken or order made under this Ordinance shall be called in question in or before any Court, tribunal or authority and no suit or other legal proceeding shall lie against the Government or any person for anything done or intended to be done in pursuance of this Ordinance or any rules made thereunder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11.       The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source :  Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
676	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE YOUTH WELFARE FUND ORDINANCE, 1985</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">THE YOUTH WELFARE FUND ORDINANCE, 1985</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. XL OF 1985).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[4th August, 1985]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to provide for the establishment of the Youth Welfare Fund.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of the Youth Welfare Fund and for matters ancillary thereto;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 24th March, 1982, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the President is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Short title</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Youth Welfare Fund Ordinance, 1985.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Definitions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Board” means the Youth Welfare Fund Management Board established under section 5;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) “Fund” means the Youth Welfare Fund established under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) “member” means a member of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) “Selection Committee” means the Selection Committee constituted under section 8;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) “President's Order” means the Bangladesh Banks (Nationalisation) Order, 1972 (P.O. No. 26 of 1972);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h) “youth organisation” means any organisation which is formed for the purpose of development of youth and 1[ youth] welfare and registered under any law for the time being in force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment of the Fund</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) There shall be established a Fund to be called the Youth Welfare Fund.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Fund shall consist of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) grants made by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) loans obtained from the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) donations and endowments;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) receipt from such other sources as may be approved by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Government shall make an initial grant of Taka fifty lakh to the Fund.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) All moneys of the Fund shall be kept in any nationalised bank constituted under the President's Order or may be invested in Government securities or in such manner as the Government directs.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Utilisation of the Fund</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) The moneys of the Fund shall be utilised primarily for the purposes of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        making of grants-in-aid to youth organisations;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2[ (b) awarding prizes and making grants to youths.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All expenses in connection with the administration of the Fund shall be met out of the moneys of the Fund.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) There shall be a Board to be known as the Youth Welfare Fund Management Board for the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Board shall consist of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) Minister in-charge of the Ministry or Division dealing with youth and sports, who shall also be the Chairman of the Board, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b) Secretary in-charge of Ministry or Division dealing with Social Welfare and Women's Affairs, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) Secretary in-charge of Ministry or Division dealing with Labour and Manpower, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) Secretary in-charge of Ministry or Division dealing with youth and sports, who shall also be the Secretary of the Board, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        Director General, Department of Social Services, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3[ (ee) Director General, Department of Youth Development, ex-officio;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         four persons to be nominated by the Government from among the members of youth organisations.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A nominated member shall, unless removed by the Government, hold office for a period of two years from the date of his nomination.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) A nominated member may, at any time, resign his office by writing under his hand addressed to the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. 4[ (1) The Board shall-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        formulate policies for making grants-in-aid to different youth organisations and awarding prizes and making grants to youths;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        make grants-in-aid to youth organisations and award prizes and make grants to youths on the recommendation of the Selection Committee;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        sanction expenditure out of the moneys of the Fund;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        do such other acts or things as may be necessary for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2)        The Secretary of the Board shall be responsible for implementation of the decisions of the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meetings of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) Save as hereinafter provided, the Board shall follow such procedure as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2)        The meeting of the Board shall be held on such date and at such time and place as may be determined by the Chairman:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that at least four meetings shall be held in each year.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3)        To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Board, not less than one-third of the total number of its members shall be present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4)        All meetings of the Board shall be presided over by the Chairman and, in his absence, by a member authorised by the Chairman in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Selection Committee</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8.         (1) There shall be a Selection Committee consisting of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        Chairman of the Board, who shall also be the Chairman of the Selection Committee;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        Secretary of the Board, who shall also be the Secretary of the Selection Committee;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        Secretary in-charge of Ministry or Division dealing with Social Welfare and Women's Affairs, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        Vice-Chancellor, Dhaka University, or his nominee;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        two renowned social workers, of whom one shall be a woman, to be nominated by Ministry or Division dealing with youth and sports;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         one journalist to be nominated by Ministry or Division dealing with youth and sports;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        Director-General, Department of youth Development, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        Managing Director of a nationalised bank constituted under the President's Order to be nominated by Ministry or Division dealing with youth and sports;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         one retired Principal of a Government College to be nominated by Ministry or Division dealing with youth and sports;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         Director-General,  Bangladesh Unnayan Gobeshona Protishthan, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2)        The Selection Committee shall select youth organisations for making grants-in-aid and members of youth organisations for making awards and recommend the organisations and members so selected to the Board for making the grants and awards for which they are selected.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3)        The Selection Committee shall follow such procedure as may be determined by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Condition for making grants-in-aid, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5[ 9.     Notwithstanding anything contained in this Ordinance,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        no grants-in-aid shall be made to a youth organisation unless it has any project for youth welfare or it is associated with any such project;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        no prize shall be awarded nor any grant made to a youth unless he has to his credit a record of commendable performance in the field of youth or social welfare, or has made remarkable contribution in the field of education, science, technology, sports, arts and culture, or has shown exemplary patriotism, heroism or courage, or has rendered exemplary services to parents and elders.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Appointment of officers, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10.       The Secretary of the Board may, with the approval of the Board, appoint such officers and other employees as he may consider necessary to assist him in the discharge of his functions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Audit and accounts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11.       (1) The accounts of the Fund shall be maintained in such manner and form as the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh, hereinafter referred to as the Auditor-General, may, from time to time, direct.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2)        The accounts of the Fund shall be audited by the Auditor-General.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3)        A statement of audited accounts shall be furnished to the Government by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for the purpose of giving effect to all or any of the provisions of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The word “youth” was substituted for the word “social” by section 2 of the Youth Welfare Fund (Amendment) Ordinance, 1986 (Ordinance No. LXIII of 1986).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 Clause (b) was substituted by section 2 of the Youth Welfare Fund (Amendment) Act, 1988 (Act No. XVI of 1988).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 Clause (ee) was inserted by section 3 of the Youth Welfare Fund (Amendment) Ordinance, 1986 (LXIII of 1986).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 Sub-section (1) was substituted by section 3 of the Youth Welfare Fund (Amendment) Act, 1988 (Act No. XVI of 1988).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 Section 9 was substituted by section 4 of the Youth Welfare Fund (Amendment) Act, 1988 (Act No. XVI of 1988).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source :  Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
677	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE ZAKAT FUND ORDINANCE, 1982</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">THE ZAKAT FUND ORDINANCE, 1982</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ORDINANCE NO. VI OF 1982).</p><p style="text-align: justify;">[7th June, 1982]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Ordinance to establish Zakat Fund.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to make provisions for the establishment of a Zakat Fund and for matters connected therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of the 24th March, 1982, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that behalf, the Chief Martial Law Administrator is pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Short title</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. This Ordinance may be called the Zakat Fund Ordinance, 1982.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Definitions</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Ordinance, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        “Board” means the Zakat Board constituted under section 5;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Board;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “Fund” means the Zakat Fund established under section 3;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Ordinance;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        “Shariah” means the Code of Islamic Laws.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Zakat Fund</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) There shall be established a Fund to be called the Zakat Fund which shall consist of voluntary payment of Zakat by the Muslims.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The moneys credited to the Fund shall be kept in non-interest bearing accounts of such scheduled banks as may be decided by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) All payments to the Fund shall be made in such manner as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Utilisation of the Fund</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. The moneys credited to the Fund shall be utilised for the purposes for which moneys payable as Zakat may be utilised under the Shariah.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) There shall be a Board to be called the Zakat Board which shall consist of the following members, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        a Chairman 1[ and a Vice-Chairman] to be appointed by the Government from among eminent Muslim Scholars;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the Secretary, Religious Affairs Division, ex-officio;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the Director-General, Islamic Foundation, ex-officio 2[ , who shall also be its Secretary];</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)         3[ nine] eminent Muslim Scholars to be appointed by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chairman 5[ , the Vice-Chairman] and other appointed members shall hold office for a term of three years.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Chairman 6[ , the Vice-Chairman] and other appointed members may be removed from office by the Government at any time without assigning any reason.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Functions of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. The Board shall-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        formulate policies for the management and administration of the Fund;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        sanction expenditure from the Fund for the purposes for which the moneys credited to the Fund may be utilised;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        do such other acts and things as may be necessary for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meetings of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) The meetings of the Board shall be held at such times and places as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that until so prescribed, such meetings shall be held at such times and places as may be determined by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Board not less than three members shall be present.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7[ (3) All meetings of the Board shall be presided over by the Chairman or, in his absence, by the Vice-Chairman and, in the absence of both the Chairman and the Vice-Chairman, by a member elected for that purpose by the members present.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) At a meeting of the Board, each member shall have one vote, and, in the event of an equality of votes, the 8[ person presiding] shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) No act or proceeding of the Board shall be invalid merely on the ground of existence of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of, the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Secretary of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9[ 8. The Secretary of the Board shall be responsible for the execution of the decisions of the Board and for the maintenance of accounts and records of the Fund.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Staff of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. The Board may appoint such officers and other employees as it considers necessary for the performance of its functions on such terms and conditions as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Expenses of the Board</p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. All administrative expenses of the Board shall be borne by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Committees</p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. (1) The Board may appoint Committees for such districts and police-stations and for such other areas as it may deem fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A Committee appointed under sub-section (1) shall consist of not more than nine members of whom two-thirds shall be appointed from among Muslim Scholars.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) A Committee appointed under sub-section (1) shall perform such functions as may be entrusted to it by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Charitable Fund</p><p style="text-align: justify;">12. (1) The Board may establish a Charitable Fund to which shall be credited all voluntary charitable donations and contributions made to it by any person.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The moneys credited to the Charitable Fund may be utilised for any religious or charitable purposes.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Exemption from income-tax</p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. Notwithstanding anything contained in the Income-tax Act, 1922 (XI of 1922), no income-tax shall be payable by any person in respect of any sums paid by him as Zakat to the Fund or as donation or contribution to the Charitable Fund established under section 12.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Audit</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. (1) The accounts of the Fund and the Charitable Fund shall be audited once in every year by the Comptroller and Auditor-General of Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A statement of the accounts audited under sub-section (1) and a report of the Board thereon shall be furnished to the Government by the Board.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make rules</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. The Board may, with the prior approval of the Government, by notification in the official Gazette, make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 The words “and a Vice-Chairman” were inserted by section 2 of the Zakat Fund (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XXXIV of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The comma and words “, who shall also be its Secretary” were inserted by section 2 of the Zakat Fund (Amendment) Ordinance, 1986 (Ordinance No. V of 1986)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The word “nine” was substituted for the word “eight” by section 2 of the Zakat Fund (Second Amendment) Ordinance, 1986 (LX of 1986)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 Clause (e) was omitted by section 2 of the Zakat Fund (Amendment) Ordinance, 1986 (Ordinance No. V of 1986)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The comma and words “, the Vice-Chairman” were inserted by section 2 of the Zakat Fund (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XXXIV of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6 The comma and words “, the Vice-Chairman” were inserted by section 2 of the Zakat Fund (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XXXIV of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7 Sub-section (3) was substituted by section 3 of the Zakat Fund (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XXXIV of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8 The words “person presiding” were substituted for the word “Chairman” by section 3 of the Zakat Fund (Amendment) Ordinance, 1983 (Ordinance No. XXXIV of 1983)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9 Section 8 was substituted by section 3 of the Zakat Fund (Amendment) Ordinance, 1986 (Ordinance No. V of 1986)</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
